desc: This is the world entity. Each map can only contain one, and it's automatically created for you.

keyvalues.name: SkyBox Texture Name
keyvalues.desc: Texture used for the 2D skybox.

keyvalues.name: Chapter Title
keyvalues.desc: Chapter Title that appears onscreen when this level starts.

keyvalues.name: Max occludee area
keyvalues.desc: [Used on PC] Prevents occlusion testing for entities that take up more than X% of the screen.

keyvalues.name: Min occluder area
keyvalues.desc: [Used on PC] Prevents occluders from being used if they take up less than X% of the screen.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Number of pixels wide at which all props in the level start to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). This number is ignored if the prop has a specific fade distance specified.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Minimum number of pixels wide at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). This number is ignored if the prop has a specific fade distance specified.

keyvalues.name: Detail.vbsp file
keyvalues.desc: Detail .vbsp file to use for emitting detail props (found in directory <root>/modname)

keyvalues.name: Detail material file
keyvalues.desc: Material for detail sprites to use for drawing detail props

keyvalues.name: World is cold
keyvalues.desc: Emit steam from NPC's mouths and similar effects.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Projected Textures
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of env_projectedtexture entities that can be enabled at once. Maximum is 8.

desc: Temporary spark shower effect created by env_explosions.When spawned, moves in the forward direction whilst producing sparks, until it fades out.
Actor Cycler
An entity that precaches skybox materials and swaps them on trigger.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.desc: Swap to this skybox.

desc: An entity that places a decal on the world. If the decal has no target name, it will immediately apply itself when the level is loaded.If it has a name specified, it won't apply until it receives the 'Activate' input.

keyvalues.name: Texture
keyvalues.desc: The texture used for the decal.

keyvalues.name: Low Priority
keyvalues.desc: Allow the decal to be overwritten by other decals when needed.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Force the decal to apply itself to the world.

desc: Changes the gravity of the player who activates this entity.

keyvalues.name: Gravity
keyvalues.desc: Gravity.

inputs.name: ChangeGrav
inputs.desc: Change the activator's gravity.

inputs.name: ResetGrav
inputs.desc: Reset the activator's gravity.

desc: A door which is linked by a portal to another 'linked_portal_door' entity. Portal shots will pass through, and no effect appears at the edges.

keyvalues.name: Linked Partner
keyvalues.desc: Another 'linked_portal_door' entity which will link to this one.

keyvalues.name: Half-Width (G)
keyvalues.desc: Half the width of the portal, on the Green axis.

keyvalues.name: Half-Height (B)
keyvalues.desc: Half the height of the portal, on the Blue axis.

keyvalues.name: Static Portal
keyvalues.desc: If set to true, this portal does not ever move or toggle, and allows VRAD to cast light through it.

keyvalues.name: Start Active
keyvalues.desc: Whether to start the linkage as active from the start.

inputs.name: SetWidth
inputs.desc: Sets the width of this portal and the partner. Clamped to 1-1024

inputs.name: SetHeight
inputs.desc: Sets the height of this portal and the partner. Clamped to 1-1024

desc: Generic Script NPC

An entity that can be used to directly control material vars. To use it, you need to add the MaterialModify or MaterialModifyAnimated proxy to the material you intend to change. Parent this entity the entity who's material you want to control. If not parented, this applies to all materials in the map with the given name.

inputs.name: SetMaterialVar
inputs.desc: Fire to modify a material variable. The argument is the value to set the variable to.

inputs.name: SetMaterialVarToCurrentTime
inputs.desc: This sets the material variable to the current time on the server.

inputs.name: StartAnimSequence
inputs.desc: Force an animated material with the MaterialModifyAnimated proxy to play a set of animation frames. Format is: <Frame Start> <Frame End> <Frame Rate> <Loop>. Setting <Frame End> to -1 uses the last frame of the texture. <Loop> should be 1 or 0.

inputs.name: StartFloatLerp
inputs.desc: Force a material with the MaterialModify proxy to lerp a material var between two floating point values. Format is: <Start Value> <End Value> <Transition Time> <Loop>. <Loop> should be 1 or 0.

desc: A simple physics prop with no unique properties. Model-based entities converted by phys_convert are turned into this entity, as well as dissolving objects.See prop_physics for more options.

A physically simulated gas cannister that can have its cap shot off, at which point gas will start escaping and cause the cannister to fly around. If it takes enough damage, it will explode. The model should have a 'nozzle' attachment point, which is where gas will escape and thrust will be produced from.

keyvalues.name: World model
keyvalues.desc: The model used for the cannister. The original model is fire_equipment/w_weldtank.mdl.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Damage
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage done by the explosion created when the cannister blows up.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Radius
keyvalues.desc: The radius of the explosion to create when the cannister blows up.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage the cannister takes before exploding.

keyvalues.name: Thrust
keyvalues.desc: When the cap has been blown off, and the escaping gas is thrusting the cannister about, this is the amount of thrust generated.

keyvalues.name: Fuel Seconds
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time that gas leaks from the cannister before being considered empty.

keyvalues.name: Thruster Sound
keyvalues.desc: The sound played when the gas is escaping from the cannister.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Start gas escaping from the cannister.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Stop gas escaping from the cannister.

inputs.name: Explode
inputs.desc: Force the cannister to explode.

inputs.name: Wake
inputs.desc: Wakes up the cannister, if it is sleeping.

outputs.name: OnActivate
outputs.desc: Fired when gas starts to escape from the cannister.

outputs.name: OnAwakened
outputs.desc: Fired when this entity becomes awake (collision/force is applied).

desc: An entity used to control the LOD behavior of any water in the map. If your map has water, this entity is required.

keyvalues.name: Start Transition to Cheap Water
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance from the camera that water will start transitioning to cheap water, in unit.

keyvalues.name: End Transition to Cheap Water
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance from the camera that water will finish transitioning to cheap water, in unit.

inputs.name: SetCheapWaterStartDistance
inputs.desc: Set the distance that water starts transitioning to cheap water.

inputs.name: SetCheapWaterEndDistance
inputs.desc: Set the distance that water finishes transitioning to cheap water.

desc: An entity that shoots out gibs. Style of body part depends on language type.
An entity to control the sunlight that casts shadows in the map.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: This is the light cast direction. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, and roll is the rotation around the X axis.

keyvalues.name: Light Color
keyvalues.desc: This is the color of the sunlight.

keyvalues.name: Color Transition Time
keyvalues.desc: This is the number of seconds it takes to get from 0 to 255.

keyvalues.name: Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance of the sun, greater distances produce more orthogonal shadows.

keyvalues.name: FOV
keyvalues.desc: This is the field of view that the sunlight casts in. Use lower values for more distant sun and sharper shadows.

keyvalues.name: NearZ Distance
keyvalues.desc: This controls the near clipping plane's distance from the player.

keyvalues.name: North Offset
keyvalues.desc: This offsets the from the player position where the sun is attached.

keyvalues.name: Enable Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Enables/disables shadows from this projected texture.

inputs.name: LightColor
inputs.desc: Set the light color.

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Set the sun direction.

inputs.name: SetDistance
inputs.desc: Set the distance of the sun.

inputs.name: SetFOV
inputs.desc: Set the field of view the sun casts.

inputs.name: SetNearZDistance
inputs.desc: Set the near z distance.

inputs.name: SetNorthOffset
inputs.desc: Sets the north offset.

inputs.name: SetTexture
inputs.desc: Set the texture cookie of the sunlight.

inputs.name: EnableShadows
inputs.desc: Set the if shadows are enabled

desc: Generic Actor NPC

keyvalues.name: Default Animation
keyvalues.desc: The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.

keyvalues.name: Randomly Animate
keyvalues.desc: If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in Min/Max Random Anim Time. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.

desc: Bounding box for Parallax Corrected Cubemaps.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

desc: An entity used to count the number of players within a zone.

inputs.name: CountPlayersInZone
inputs.desc: Count the number of players in the zone, and fire the corresponding outputs.

outputs.name: OnPlayerInZone
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a count finds a player inside the zone, with the player as the activator.

outputs.name: OnPlayerOutZone
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a count finds a player outside the zone, with the player as the activator.

outputs.name: PlayersInCount
outputs.desc: Fired after a count, and contains the number of players found inside the zone.

outputs.name: PlayersOutCount
outputs.desc: Fired after a count, and contains the number of players found outside the zone.

desc: A brush entity that's designed to be used for rotating wheels, where the player can rotate them to arbitrary positions before stopping.

keyvalues.name: Speed (deg/sec)
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees, that the wheel turns per second.

keyvalues.name: Sounds
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when pressed. Choose from sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Distance
keyvalues.desc: The maximum amount, in degrees, that the wheel is allowed to rotate.

keyvalues.name: Auto-return speed
keyvalues.desc: If the 'Toggle' spawnflag is not set, the speed at which the wheel auto-returns when left alone, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Start Position
keyvalues.desc: Postion when spawned. The value is a range between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0 is the unrotated position and 1 is the rotated position + 'Distance'.

keyvalues.name: Start Direction
keyvalues.desc: Specify the direction the button will move when first used. Ignored if Start Position is 0 or 1.

keyvalues.name: Solid Type
keyvalues.desc: How to calculate collisions. BSP is more rudimentarty but allows more stable collision with players.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the button, preventing it from functioning.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the button, allowing it to function.

inputs.name: SetPosition
inputs.desc: Move to a position. The parameter must be a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the unrotated position and 1 is the rotated position + 'Distance'.

inputs.name: SetPositionImmediately
inputs.desc: Immediately teleport to a position. The parameter must be a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the unrotated position and 1 is the rotated position + 'Distance'.

inputs.name: _DisableUpdateTarget
inputs.desc: Prevent the Position output from firing. Used when lock jiggling is triggered.

inputs.name: _EnableUpdateTarget
inputs.desc: Allow the Position output to fire again. Used when lock jiggling is triggered.

outputs.name: Position
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the button moves. The output is the position of button from 0 to 1, where 0 is the unrotated position and 1 is the rotated position + 'Distance'.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is first pressed.

outputs.name: OnUnpressed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is first released from being pressed.

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button has reached position 1, the rotated position + 'Distance'.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the button has reached position 0, the unrotated starting position.

outputs.name: OnReachedPosition
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the button reaches a goal position: i.e. when it becomes open, becomes closed, or reaches the point specified by a 'SetPosition' input.

desc: A simple physics brush with no unique properties. Brush-based entities converted by phys_convert are turned into this entity. Use func_physbox instead for more options.
An entity to control the color correction in the map.

keyvalues.name: Lookup Fade Duration
keyvalues.desc: This is the duration for the lookup to fade in/out on extry/exit

keyvalues.name: Maximum Weight
keyvalues.desc: This is the maximum weight for this lookup

keyvalues.name: Lookup Table Filename
keyvalues.desc: This is the lookup table filename

desc: An entity to control the fog in the map.

keyvalues.name: Fog Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of the fog entity associated with this volume.

keyvalues.name: Postprocess Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of the postprocess entity associated with this volume.

keyvalues.name: ColorCorrection Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of the color_correction entity associated with this volume.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the enabled/disabled status of this entity.

keyvalues.name: Prop Data
keyvalues.desc: Set to the best approximation of the size and material of this entity's brushes. If set, it will override this entity's health and damage taken from various weapons. See the propdata.txt file in the scripts directory of your MOD to get a detailed list of what each entry specifies.

keyvalues.name: Strength
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking. 0 means don't break.

keyvalues.name: Material Type
keyvalues.desc: Set to the material type of the brush. Used to decide what sounds to make when damaged, and what gibs to produce when broken.

keyvalues.name: Gibs Direction
keyvalues.desc: Used to decide which direction to throw gibs when broken.

keyvalues.name: Precise Gib Direction
keyvalues.desc: Specifies the direction to throw gibs when this breakable breaks. Be sure to select Use Precise Gib Dir in the Gibs Direction field!

keyvalues.name: Damaging it Doesn't Push It
keyvalues.desc: Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move.

keyvalues.name: Spawn On Break
keyvalues.desc: When broken, an entity of the selected type will be created.

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

keyvalues.name: Damage Filter
keyvalues.desc: Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.

inputs.name: SetDamageFilter
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as damage filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the damage filter.

keyvalues.name: Delay before reset
keyvalues.desc: How long until the pickup reappears after being picked up. 0 means it won't disappear and negative values mean it won't reappear.

keyvalues.name: Brightness
keyvalues.desc: Color and brightness of the light.

keyvalues.name: BrightnessScaleHDR
keyvalues.desc: Amount to scale the light by when compiling for HDR.

keyvalues.name: Custom Appearance
keyvalues.desc: Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

keyvalues.name: Fade Tick Interval
keyvalues.desc: The tick interval of the light's fade, in seconds. Lower values cause a faster fade.

keyvalues.name: Cast Entity Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Objects illuminated by this light will cast a directional shadow.

keyvalues.name: Entity shadow offset
keyvalues.desc: A world-space offset applied to the shadow origin, in units. X Y Z.

keyvalues.name: No Sprite in Cubemap
keyvalues.desc: If set, this light will not draw a sprite during cubemap building

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the light on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: The the light off.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the light's current state.

inputs.name: SetPattern
inputs.desc: Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

inputs.name: FadeToPattern
inputs.desc: Fades from first value in old pattern, to first value in the new given pattern. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

keyvalues.name: Master (Obsolete)
keyvalues.desc: Legacy support: The name of a master entity. If the master hasn't been activated, this entity will not activate.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

keyvalues.name: Global Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (X Y Z)
keyvalues.desc: This entity's orientation in the world. Roll is the rotation around the X axis, pitch is rotation around the Y axis and yaw is the rotation around the Z axis.

keyvalues.name: Parent
keyvalues.desc: The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent. Set an attachment point via 'parentname,attachment'.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world.

inputs.name: KillHierarchy
inputs.desc: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

inputs.name: SetParent
inputs.desc: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachment
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

inputs.name: ClearParent
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

inputs.name: SetLocalAngles
inputs.desc: Sets the rotation of the entity relative to the parent's rotation.

inputs.name: SetLocalOrigin
inputs.desc: Sets the position of the entity relative to its parent if one exists. Otherwise relative to the world.

inputs.name: SetAbsAngles
inputs.desc: Set this entity's angles, always relative to the world origin.

inputs.name: AddOutput
inputs.desc:
Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity or changes keyvalues dynamically. Format:
'<output name> <targetname>:<inputname>:<parameter>:<delay>:<max times to fire (-1 == infinite, 1 = only once)>'
or 'keyvalue newval'. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: FireUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

inputs.name: Use
inputs.desc: More or less replicates the player interacting with an entity. (+USE)

inputs.name: PassUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser1 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser2 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser3 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser4 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: FireRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OnUser1, OnUser2, OnUser3, or OnUser4 with a 25% chance of each.

inputs.name: PassRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OutUser1, OutUser2, OutUser3, or OutUser4 with a 25% chance of each. The parameter is passed along unchanged.

inputs.name: KillIfNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity if it is not in a player's viewcone.

inputs.name: KillWhenNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity when it is not in a player's viewcone. You can pass a time for when this should start.

inputs.name: FireOutput
inputs.desc: Fires the named output on this entity. Format: '<output name>:<activator>:<caller>:<parameter>:<delay>' (OnDeath:hl3cardgame:gaben). Everything beyond the output name is optional.

inputs.name: RemoveOutput
inputs.desc: Removes all instances of the named output on this entity. Wildcards are supported, meaning you could just pass '*' to wipe all outputs from this entity.

inputs.name: AcceptInput
inputs.desc: Fires the named input on this entity. Format: '<input name>:<parameter>:<activator>:<caller>:<output ID>' (SetTarget:cheese). Everything beyond the input name is optional. Mind the fact this is arranged differently from FireOutput, having the parameter right after the input name.

inputs.name: CancelPending
inputs.desc: Cancels any events fired by this entity that are currently pending in the I/O event queue.

inputs.name: FreeChildren
inputs.desc: Unparents all direct children of this entity.

inputs.name: SetLocalVelocity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current velocity.

inputs.name: SetLocalAngularVelocity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current angular velocity.

inputs.name: AddSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Adds spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: RemoveSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Removes spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: AddSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Adds solid flags to this entity.

inputs.name: RemoveSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Removes solid flags from this entity.

inputs.name: ChangeVariable
inputs.desc: Similar to AddOutput, except it changes an internal variable similar to logic_datadesc_accessor instead. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: SetHealth
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's health.

inputs.name: AddHealth
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's health.

inputs.name: RemoveHealth
inputs.desc: Removes from this entity's health.

inputs.name: SetMaxHealth
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's max health.

inputs.name: SetEntityName
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's name that other entities should refer to it by.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's target. This is specific to certain entities, particularly logic entities that involve a target.

inputs.name: SetOwnerEntity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's owner entity. This has nothing to do with parenting and has more to do with collision and kill credits.

inputs.name: SetThinkNull
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's general think function to null. Behavior varies from entity to entity..

inputs.name: Touch
inputs.desc: Simulates this entity touching the specified entity.

outputs.name: OnUser1
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

outputs.name: OnUser2
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

outputs.name: OnUser3
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

outputs.name: OnUser4
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

outputs.name: OutUser1
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser1 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser2
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser2 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser3
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser3 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser4
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser4 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

keyvalues.name: Global Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.

keyvalues.name: Parent
keyvalues.desc: The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent. Set an attachment point via 'parentname,attachment'.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Overrides the NPC's default health. Cannot be higher than Max Health.

keyvalues.name: Max Health
keyvalues.desc: Overrides the NPC's max health. Health cannot exceed this amount.

keyvalues.name: Squad Name
keyvalues.desc: NPCs that are in the same squad (i.e. have matching squad names) will share information about enemies, and will take turns attacking and covering each other.

keyvalues.name: Hint Group
keyvalues.desc: Hint groups are used by NPCs to restrict their hint-node searching to a subset of the map's hint nodes. Only hint nodes with matching hint group names will be considered by this NPC.

keyvalues.name: Hint Limit Nav
keyvalues.desc: Limits NPC to using specified hint group for navigation requests, but does not limit local navigation.

keyvalues.name: Weapon Held
keyvalues.desc: Gives the NPC a weapon. NPCs may attack oddly or not attack if they don't know how to use a particular weapon.

keyvalues.name: Relationship
keyvalues.desc: Changes whether this NPC likes or dislikes certain others. Format is: <string|targetname or classname> <string|disposition> <integer|rank>. Values for disposition are: D_HT (Hate), D_FR (Fear), D_LI (Like), D_NU, (Neutral).

keyvalues.name: Sleep State
keyvalues.desc: Holds the NPC in stasis until specified condition. See also 'Wake Radius' and 'Wake Squad'.

keyvalues.name: Wake Radius
keyvalues.desc: Auto-wake if player within this distance

keyvalues.name: Wake Squad
keyvalues.desc: Wake all of the NPCs squadmates if the NPC is woken

keyvalues.name: Enemy Filter
keyvalues.desc: Filter by which to filter potential enemies

keyvalues.name: Ignore unseen enemies
keyvalues.desc: Prefer visible enemies, regardless of distance or relationship priority

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scales damage energy when this character is hit by a physics object. With a value of 0 the NPC will take no damage from physics.

keyvalues.name: Local Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Velocity generated by the entity, can cause strange behavior if changed with AddOutput.

keyvalues.name: Base Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Velocity to start with on spawn. Can be changed with AddOutput, where it will be immediately added.

keyvalues.name: Angular Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Angular velocity to start with on spawn. Can be changed with AddOutput, where it will be immediately added.

keyvalues.name: Water Level
keyvalues.desc: Current water level of the entity, can cause strange behavior if changed with AddOutput.

inputs.name: SetRelationship
inputs.desc: Changes this entity's relationship with another entity or class. Format: <entityname/classname> <D_HT/D_FR/D_LI/D_NU> <priority>

inputs.name: SetEnemyFilter
inputs.desc: Changes this NPC's enemy filter to the named filter.

inputs.name: SetHealth
inputs.desc: Set this NPC's health.

inputs.name: PhysDamageScale
inputs.desc: Sets the value that scales damage energy when this character is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Makes the NPC die and disappear.

inputs.name: StartScripting
inputs.desc: Enter scripting state. In this state, NPCs ignore a variety of stimulus that would make them break out of their scripts: They ignore danger sounds, ignore +USE, don't idle speak or respond to other NPC's idle speech, and so on.

inputs.name: StopScripting
inputs.desc: Exit scripting state.

inputs.name: SetSquad
inputs.desc: Set the name of this NPC's squad. It will be removed from any existing squad automatically. Leaving the parameter blank will remove the NPC from any existing squad.

inputs.name: Wake
inputs.desc: Wakes up the NPC if it is sleeping.

inputs.name: ForgetEntity
inputs.desc: Clears out the NPC's knowledge of a named entity.

inputs.name: GagEnable
inputs.desc: Turn on the NPC Gag flag. NPC won't speak outside of choreographed scenes.

inputs.name: GagDisable
inputs.desc: Turn off the NPC Gag flag.

inputs.name: IgnoreDangerSounds
inputs.desc: Ignore danger sounds for the specified number of seconds.

inputs.name: HolsterWeapon
inputs.desc: Force the NPC to holster their weapon. Ignored if the NPC is scripting, if the NPC's weapon is already holstered, or if the NPC doesn't use weapons.

inputs.name: HolsterAndDestroyWeapon
inputs.desc: Identical to HolsterWeapon, except the weapon is destroyed once it has been holstered and concealed.

inputs.name: UnholsterWeapon
inputs.desc: Force the NPC to draw their weapon. Ignored if the NPC is scripting, if the NPC's weapon is already drawn, or if the NPC doesn't use weapons.

inputs.name: ForceInteractionWithNPC
inputs.desc: Force the NPC to use a dynamic interaction with another NPC. Parameter format: <target NPC name> <dynamic interaction name>

inputs.name: UpdateEnemyMemory
inputs.desc: Update (or Create) this NPC's memory of an enemy and its location

inputs.name: BecomeRagdoll
inputs.desc: This NPC will instantly become a ragdoll with ZERO force (just go limp). OnDeath, OnHalfHealth, etc. Outputs will **NOT** BE FIRED.

outputs.name: OnDamaged
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC takes damage.

outputs.name: OnDeath
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC is killed.

outputs.name: OnHalfHealth
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC reaches half of its maximum health.

outputs.name: OnHearWorld
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears a sound (other than combat or the player).

outputs.name: OnHearPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears the player.

outputs.name: OnHearCombat
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears combat sounds.

outputs.name: OnFoundEnemy
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC establishes line of sight to its enemy (outputs entity).

outputs.name: OnLostEnemyLOS
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC loses line of sight to its enemy.

outputs.name: OnLostEnemy
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC loses its enemy. Usually due to the enemy being killed/removed, or because this NPC has selected a newer, more dangerous enemy.

outputs.name: OnFoundPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC establishes line of sight to its enemy, and that enemy is a player (outputs player entity).

outputs.name: OnLostPlayerLOS
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC loses line of sight to its enemy, and that enemy is a player.

outputs.name: OnLostPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC loses its enemy, and that enemy was a player. Usually due to the enemy being killed/removed, or because this NPC has selected a newer, more dangerous enemy.

outputs.name: OnDamagedByPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC is hurt by a player.

outputs.name: OnDamagedByPlayerSquad
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC is hurt by a player OR by one of the player's squadmates.

outputs.name: OnDenyCommanderUse
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC has refused to join the player's squad.

outputs.name: OnSleep
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC enters a sleep state.

outputs.name: OnWake
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC comes out of a sleep state.

outputs.name: OnForcedInteractionStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when the NPC starts a forced interaction.

outputs.name: OnForcedInteractionAborted
outputs.desc: Fired when the NPC aborts a forced interaction for some reason (target NPC died, couldn't be pathed to, etc)

outputs.name: OnForcedInteractionFinished
outputs.desc: NPCs in actbusies can no longer perform dynamic interactions.

keyvalues.name: Effect Flags
keyvalues.desc: For configuring visual effects. If you want to combine effects, turn SmartEdit off and add the effect numbers together, i.e. 64 + 8 = 72.

keyvalues.name: VRAD Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Determines if this entity will cast lightmap shadows.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Light Level
keyvalues.desc: The minimum level of ambient light that hits this brush.

keyvalues.name: Disable Receiving Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevents dynamic shadows (e.g. player and prop shadows) from appearing on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable ShadowDepth
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable rendering into shadow depth (for flashlight) for this entity.

keyvalues.name: Projected Texture Cache
keyvalues.desc: Used to hint projected texture system whether it is sufficient to cache shadow volume of this entity or to force render it every frame instead.

keyvalues.name: Disable flashlight
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable flashlight (env_projectedtexture) lighting and shadows on this entity.

inputs.name: DisableShadow
inputs.desc: Allows the entity to draw a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: EnableShadow
inputs.desc: Prevents the entity from drawing a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: DisableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object will not recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: EnableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object may recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does not apply physics forces to it.

inputs.name: AlternativeSorting
inputs.desc: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

inputs.name: EndTouch
inputs.desc: Fires the OnEndTouch output. If called by an entity inside the trigger, the OnEndTouch will be fired for them as the activator. Note that this input is passed even if the player is being treated as 'not' touching the trigger while outside it.

outputs.name: OnStartTouchAll
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity starts touching this trigger, and no other entities are touching it. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters are considered.

outputs.name: OnEndTouch
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity stops touching this trigger. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters will cause this output to fire.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchAll
outputs.desc: Fires when an entity stops touching this trigger, and no other entities are touching it. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters are considered.

outputs.name: OnJump
outputs.desc: Fires when a player jumps in this trigger. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters are considered.

outputs.name: OnLand
outputs.desc: Fires when a player lands in this trigger. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters are considered.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the door moves.

keyvalues.name: Start Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound to play when the door starts moving.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound to play when the door stops moving.

keyvalues.name: Start Close Sound
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) Sound to play when the door starts closing. If not set, the Start Sound will be used instead.

keyvalues.name: Stop Close Sound
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) Sound to play when the door stops closing. If not set, the Stop Sound will be used instead.

keyvalues.name: Loop Moving Sound?
keyvalues.desc: If set to true, the door's 'Start Sound' will be continually looped until the door finishes moving.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before Reset (-1 stay)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the door has opened before it closes. Once it has closed, it can be used again. If the value is set to -1, the door never closes itself.

keyvalues.name: Lip
keyvalues.desc: The amount the door will keep overlapping with the original position. The distance moved = the size of the brush on the movement axis - lip. Negative values cause the door to move even further.

keyvalues.name: Blocking Damage
keyvalues.desc: Amount of damage done to entities that block the movement of this door, per frame.

keyvalues.name: Linked Door
keyvalues.desc: Passes the door's +use inputs and touch events onto a different door, so it also is activated.

keyvalues.name: Force Closed
keyvalues.desc: If set, this door will close no matter what. Useful for doors that have to close even if the player tries to block them with objects.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Debris
keyvalues.desc: If set this will change the door's collision group to one that ignore collisions with debris objects (note that this is not compatible with the non-solid-to-player spawnflag).

keyvalues.name: Solid Type
keyvalues.desc: How to calculate collisions. BSP is more rudimentarty but allows more stable collision with players.

keyvalues.name: Door Health
keyvalues.desc: The health of the door (allows someone to shoot it open). 0 means invincible.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the player tries to use the door, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door is unlocked.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the player tries to use the door, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the door is unlocked.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door, if it is not fully open.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door, if it is not fully closed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the door between open and closed.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the door.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the door.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the door speed.

inputs.name: SetToggleState
inputs.desc: Force the door instantly to currently open or closed.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Fired when the door starts closing.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door starts opening.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully open position. Reversed if 'Start Open' flag is set.

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully closed position. Reversed if 'Start Open' flag is set.

outputs.name: OnBlockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnBlockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnLockedUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player uses the door, but it is locked.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: A filter entity to test potential activators against.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable this trigger.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable this trigger, some trigger entities may also fire OnEndTouch when disabled.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles this trigger between enabled and disabled states.

inputs.name: TouchTest
inputs.desc: Triggers either the OnTouching or OnNotTouching outputs for whether anything is touching this entity.

inputs.name: StartTouch
inputs.desc: Fires the OnStartTouch output. If called by an entity inside the trigger, the OnStartTouch will be fired for them as the activator. Note that this input is passed even if the player is being treated as 'not' touching the trigger while inside it.

outputs.name: OnTrigger
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the trigger is activated.

outputs.name: OnStartTouch
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity starts touching this trigger. The touching entity must pass this trigger's filters to cause this output to fire.

outputs.name: OnTouching
outputs.desc: Fired when the TouchTest input is called, and an entity is touching this. Does not call activators.

outputs.name: OnNotTouching
outputs.desc: Fired when the TouchTest input is called, and no entity is touching this. Does not call activators.

keyvalues.name: Attached Object
keyvalues.desc: Object to apply the force to.

keyvalues.name: Time of Force (0=inf)
keyvalues.desc: Automatic shut-off after this time has passed (0 = stay on forever or until deactivated)

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn the force on

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the force off

inputs.name: Scale
inputs.desc: Set Force Scale

keyvalues.name: Next KeyFrame
keyvalues.desc: Name of the next keyframe along this keyframe path.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

keyvalues.name: Global Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.

keyvalues.name: Origin (X Y Z)
keyvalues.desc: The position of this brush entity's center in the world. Rotating entities typically rotate around their origin.

keyvalues.name: Parent
keyvalues.desc: The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent. Set an attachment point via 'parentname,attachment'.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Bounding Box Size
keyvalues.desc: Co-ordinate of the minimum bounding box corner, relative to entity origin. The bounding box is drawn from this corner to the other one. Requires Bounding Box collisions (solid 2) to be used. Can be used to overwrite the collision shape of a brush, although it can only be a cuboid. Can be AddOutputed to change shape at runtime.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Bounding Box Size
keyvalues.desc: Co-ordinate of the maximum bounding box corner, relative to entity origin. The bounding box is drawn from this corner to the other one. Requires Bounding Box collisions (solid 2) to be used. Can be used to overwrite the collision shape of a brush, although it can only be a cuboid. Can be AddOutputed to change shape at runtime.

keyvalues.name: Collisions
keyvalues.desc: Method of collision for this entity. Can be changed at runtime with AddOutput.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world.

inputs.name: KillHierarchy
inputs.desc: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

inputs.name: SetParent
inputs.desc: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachment
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

inputs.name: ClearParent
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

inputs.name: SetLocalAngles
inputs.desc: Sets the rotation of the entity relative to the parent's rotation.

inputs.name: SetLocalOrigin
inputs.desc: Sets the position of the entity relative to its parent if one exists. Otherwise relative to the world.

inputs.name: SetAbsAngles
inputs.desc: Set this entity's angles, always relative to the world origin.

inputs.name: AddOutput
inputs.desc:
Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity or changes keyvalues dynamically. Format:
'<output name> <targetname>:<inputname>:<parameter>:<delay>:<max times to fire (-1 == infinite, 1 = only once)>'
or 'keyvalue newval'. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: FireUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

inputs.name: Use
inputs.desc: More or less replicates the player interacting with an entity. (+USE)

inputs.name: PassUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser1 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser2 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser3 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser4 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: FireRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OnUser1, OnUser2, OnUser3, or OnUser4 with a 25% chance of each.

inputs.name: PassRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OutUser1, OutUser2, OutUser3, or OutUser4 with a 25% chance of each. The parameter is passed along unchanged.

inputs.name: KillIfNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity if it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: KillWhenNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity when it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: FireOutput
inputs.desc: Fires the named output on this entity. Format: '<output name>:<activator>:<caller>:<parameter>:<delay>' (OnDeath:hl3cardgame:gaben). Everything beyond the output name is optional.

inputs.name: RemoveOutput
inputs.desc: Removes all instances of the named output on this entity. Wildcards are supported, meaning you could just pass '*' to wipe all outputs from this entity.

inputs.name: AcceptInput
inputs.desc: Fires the named input on this entity. Format: '<input name>:<parameter>:<activator>:<caller>:<output ID>' (SetTarget:cheese). Everything beyond the input name is optional. Mind the fact this is arranged differently from FireOutput, having the parameter right after the input name.

inputs.name: CancelPending
inputs.desc: Cancels any events fired by this entity that are currently pending in the I/O event queue.

inputs.name: FreeChildren
inputs.desc: Unparents all direct children of this entity.

inputs.name: SetLocalVelocity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current velocity.

inputs.name: SetLocalAngularVelocity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current angular velocity.

inputs.name: AddSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Adds spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: RemoveSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Removes spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: AddSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Adds solid flags to this entity.

inputs.name: RemoveSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Removes solid flags from this entity.

inputs.name: ChangeVariable
inputs.desc: Similar to AddOutput, except it changes an internal variable similar to logic_datadesc_accessor instead. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: SetHealth
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's health.

inputs.name: AddHealth
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's health.

inputs.name: RemoveHealth
inputs.desc: Removes from this entity's health.

inputs.name: SetMaxHealth
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's max health.

inputs.name: SetEntityName
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's name that other entities should refer to it by.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's target. This is specific to certain entities, particularly logic entities that involve a target.

inputs.name: SetOwnerEntity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's owner entity. This has nothing to do with parenting and has more to do with collision and kill credits.

inputs.name: SetThinkNull
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's general think function to null. Behavior varies from entity to entity..

inputs.name: Touch
inputs.desc: Simulates this entity touching the specified entity.

outputs.name: OnUser1
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

outputs.name: OnUser2
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

outputs.name: OnUser3
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

outputs.name: OnUser4
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

outputs.name: OutUser1
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser1 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser2
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser2 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser3
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser3 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser4
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser4 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

keyvalues.name: Damage Type
keyvalues.desc: Kind of damage to apply. These fields can be ORed together.

inputs.name: DisableDraw
inputs.desc: Add the EF_NODRAW flag to this entity. Some entities manage this on their own so be aware you can override that value.

inputs.name: EnableDraw
inputs.desc: Remove the EF_NODRAW flag to this entity. Some entities manage this on their own so be aware you can override that value.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist).

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Max fade distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out).

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

keyvalues.name: Default Animation
keyvalues.desc: The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.

keyvalues.name: Randomly Animate
keyvalues.desc: If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.

keyvalues.name: Min Random Anim Time
keyvalues.desc: Minimum time between random animations.

keyvalues.name: Max Random Anim Time
keyvalues.desc: Maximum time between random animations.

keyvalues.name: Disable Bone Followers
keyvalues.desc: If set, the prop will not use bone followers, even if it has them defined.

keyvalues.name: Hold Animation
keyvalues.desc: If set, the prop will not loop its animation, but hold the last frame.

keyvalues.name: Suppress Anim Sounds
keyvalues.desc: If set, the prop will not play any sounds that are embedded in animations it plays.

keyvalues.name: Animate Every Frame
keyvalues.desc: Force this prop to animate every frame. This ensures it immediately transitions to the next animation, but means it's contantly checking this.

inputs.name: SetAnimation
inputs.desc: Force the prop to play an animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

inputs.name: SetDefaultAnimation
inputs.desc: Set the Default Animation to the one specified in the parameter.

inputs.name: SetPlaybackRate
inputs.desc: Set the playback rate for the animation.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Set the visible bodygroup, by index.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Make the prop visible.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Make the prop invisible.

inputs.name: EnableCollision
inputs.desc: Enable collision on the prop.

inputs.name: DisableCollision
inputs.desc: Disable collision on the prop.

inputs.name: SetAnimationNoReset
inputs.desc: Force the prop to play an animation unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

inputs.name: BecomeRagdoll
inputs.desc: Change into a ragdoll immediately.

inputs.name: FadeAndKill
inputs.desc: Fade out then remove this prop.

outputs.name: OnAnimationBegun
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a new animation has begun playing.

outputs.name: OnAnimationDone
outputs.desc: Fired whenever an animation is complete.

keyvalues.name: Collisions
keyvalues.desc: Method of collision for this entity. Can be changed at runtime with AddOutput.

keyvalues.name: Bodygroup
keyvalues.desc: Sets the body group index for the model, starting with 0, if available.

keyvalues.name: Texture Frame
keyvalues.desc: The frame number for any animated textures on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select any entity (not info_lighting!) from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin Offset
keyvalues.desc: The info_lighting_relative from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Cast Distance
keyvalues.desc: Sets how far the entity casts dynamic shadows, in units. 0 means default distance from the shadow_control entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevent the entity from creating cheap render-to-texture/dynamic shadows.

keyvalues.name: Disable Receiving Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevents dynamic shadows (e.g. player and prop shadows) from appearing on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Model Scale
keyvalues.desc: A multiplier for the size of the model.

inputs.name: Skin
inputs.desc: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Change the model's bodygroup to the specified index number.

inputs.name: Ignite
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire indefinitely.

inputs.name: IgniteLifetime
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire for a given amount of time.

inputs.name: IgniteNumHitboxFires
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given number of hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: IgniteHitboxFireScale
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given scale for hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: BecomeRagdoll
inputs.desc: Kills the entity and creates a client-side ragdoll from the model. Input is only passed if the model contains ragdolling, for other models phys_convert can be used instead.

inputs.name: SetLightingOrigin
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as the entity's lighting origin. Any entity can be used.

inputs.name: SetLightingOriginHack
inputs.desc: Offsets the entity's lighting origin by their distance from an info_lighting_relative.

inputs.name: fademindist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: fademaxdist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: DisableShadow
inputs.desc: Allows the entity to draw a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: EnableShadow
inputs.desc: Prevents the entity from drawing a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: AlternativeSorting
inputs.desc: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

inputs.name: SetModelScale
inputs.desc: Sets the scale of the model. Secondary parameter (space delimited) sets the duration of time to scale the model.

outputs.name: OnIgnite
outputs.desc: Fired when this object catches fire.

keyvalues.name: Particle Per Second
keyvalues.desc: Number of particles to spawn, per second.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Particle Speed
keyvalues.desc: Maximum speed that the particles can move after spawning.

keyvalues.name: Particle Fall Speed
keyvalues.desc: How fast the particles fall to the ground. This value is subtracted from the particle speed in the Z-axis only.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Particle Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: Minimum number of seconds until each particle dies. Particles live for a random duration between this and 'Maximum Particle Lifetime'.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Particle Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of seconds until each particle dies. Particles live for a random duration between 'Minimum Particle Lifetime' and this. Will be clamped to a max of 15.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Visible Distance
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which particles are visible. They fade to translucent at this distance.

keyvalues.name: Frozen
keyvalues.desc: When set, this entity spawns the number of particles in SpawnRate immediately, and then goes inactive.

keyvalues.name: Affected by Wind
keyvalues.desc: When set, the dust will be affected by any env_wind entity settings in the map.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn off.

keyvalues.name: Origin (X Y Z)
keyvalues.desc: The position of this entity's center in the world. Rotating entities typically rotate around their origin.

keyvalues.name: Control Volume
keyvalues.desc: Name of a trigger the specifies the volume in which a player must be to control this tank.

keyvalues.name: Smoke Sprite
keyvalues.desc: A specific sprite to use for the muzzle's smoke effect.

keyvalues.name: Flash Sprite
keyvalues.desc: A specific sprite to use for the muzzle's flash effect.

keyvalues.name: Sprite scale
keyvalues.desc: The scale for smoke and flash sprites.

keyvalues.name: Damage Per Bullet
keyvalues.desc: If set to 0, it'll use the base weapon bullet's damage.

keyvalues.name: Damage Per Bullet Vs Player
keyvalues.desc: If set to 0, it'll use the Damage Per Bullet value.

keyvalues.name: Firing persistence
keyvalues.desc: (Seconds) How long to keep firing at last known position after lose sight of target

keyvalues.name: Firing persistence2
keyvalues.desc: (Seconds) After lost enemy and persistence time has passed, how long to occasionally fire at enemy's last known position

keyvalues.name: Gun Base Attachment
keyvalues.desc: If Parent is specified, this is the attachment point on the parent to aim from.

keyvalues.name: Gun Barrel Attachment
keyvalues.desc: If Parent is specified, this is the attachment point on the parent to fire from. If you specify this, you'll want to specify the Gun Base Attachment too.

keyvalues.name: Gun Yaw Pose Param
keyvalues.desc: If Parent + the Gun Pitch Pose Param is specified, then the gun itself will be invisible and the func_tank will steer a gun on the parent using the pose parameters.

keyvalues.name: Gun Yaw Pose Center
keyvalues.desc: The center yaw pose parameter of the gun on the parent

keyvalues.name: Gun Pitch Pose Param
keyvalues.desc: If Parent + the Gun Yaw Pose Param is specified, then the gun itself will be invisible and the func_tank will steer a gun on the parent using the pose parameters.

keyvalues.name: Gun Pitch Pose Center
keyvalues.desc: The center pitch pose parameter of the gun on the parent

keyvalues.name: Ammunition Count
keyvalues.desc: Only applies to player use. -1 = unlimited ammo.

keyvalues.name: Player Lock Time
keyvalues.desc: The tank must have the player as a target for this amount of time before it's allowed to fire.

keyvalues.name: Effect Handling
keyvalues.desc: Special effect handling that influences sound and muzzle effects. Individual settings can override parts of it.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn the tank on

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the tank off (go dormant)

inputs.name: SetFireRate
inputs.desc: How fast to fire (0 = don't fire)

inputs.name: SetDamage
inputs.desc: Set the Damage Per Bullet

inputs.name: SetTargetPosition
inputs.desc: World position that I should aim at

inputs.name: SetTargetDir
inputs.desc: Direction to aim at.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntityName
inputs.desc: Name of entity I should follow/attack

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Set the entity I should follow/attack to the passed in entity.

inputs.name: ClearTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Clear the entity I should be attacking.

inputs.name: SetMaxRange
inputs.desc: Set the max range of the func_tank.

outputs.name: OnFire
outputs.desc: Fires when the tank fires its bullets

outputs.name: OnAquireTarget
outputs.desc: Fires when target is newly in range and can be shot

outputs.name: OnLoseTarget
outputs.desc: Fires when when target goes out of range

outputs.name: OnAmmoDepleted
outputs.desc: Fires when tank runs out of ammo

outputs.name: OnGotPlayerController
outputs.desc: Fires when a Player starts to control this tank. NPCs do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnLostPlayerController
outputs.desc: Fires when the Player controller of the tank stops controlling it. NPCs do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnReadyToFire
outputs.desc: Fires once when the tank is done waiting to fire between rounds

keyvalues.name: Gib Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction the gibs will fly.

keyvalues.name: Number of Gibs
keyvalues.desc: Total number of gibs to shoot each time it's activated.

keyvalues.name: Delay between shots
keyvalues.desc: Delay (in seconds) between shooting each gib. If 0, all gibs shoot at once.

keyvalues.name: Gib Angles (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The orientation of the spawned gibs.

keyvalues.name: Max angular velocity
keyvalues.desc: How fast (degrees/sec) the gib pieces should spin. They will spin on x and y axis at between 10% and 100% of this speed.

keyvalues.name: Gib Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Speed of the fired gibs.

keyvalues.name: Course Variance
keyvalues.desc: How much variance in the direction gibs are fired.

keyvalues.name: Gib Life
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for gibs to live +/- 5%.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from for all gibs spawned by this shooter, instead of their own origins.

inputs.name: Shoot
inputs.desc: Force the gibshooter to create and shoot a gib.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Damage
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Radius
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.

keyvalues.name: Explode Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage.

keyvalues.name: Performance Mode
keyvalues.desc: Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

keyvalues.name: Pressure Delay
keyvalues.desc: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).

keyvalues.name: Minimum Damage to Hurt
keyvalues.desc: The entity will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking. 0 means don't break.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Breaks the breakable.

inputs.name: SetHealth
inputs.desc: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: AddHealth
inputs.desc: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: RemoveHealth
inputs.desc: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: EnablePhyscannonPickup
inputs.desc: Makes the breakable able to picked up by the physcannon.

inputs.name: DisablePhyscannonPickup
inputs.desc: Makes the breakable not able to picked up by the physcannon.

inputs.name: SetMass
inputs.desc: Set mass of this object.

outputs.name: OnBreak
outputs.desc: Fired when this breakable breaks.

outputs.name: OnTakeDamage
outputs.desc: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

outputs.name: OnHealthChanged
outputs.desc: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonDetach
outputs.desc: Fired when the physcannon has ripped this breakable off of the wall. Only fired if ACT_PHYSCANNON_DETACH is defined in the model this breakable is using.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePreStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the Pre physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_PRE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePullStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre pull anim, this will be fired after the Pre anim has finished playing.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonPullAnimFinished
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop has finished playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre & Post pull anims, this will be fired after the Post anim has finished playing.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePostStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the Post physcannon-pull activity. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_POST activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

keyvalues.name: Effect Flags
keyvalues.desc: For configuring visual effects. If you want to combine effects, turn SmartEdit off and add the effect numbers together, i.e. 64 + 8 = 72.

keyvalues.name: Collisions
keyvalues.desc: Method of collision for this entity. Can be changed at runtime with AddOutput.

keyvalues.name: Bodygroup
keyvalues.desc: Body Groups allow turning on and off parts of a model, so sections can be shown or hidden dynamically.

keyvalues.name: (Set) Body Group
keyvalues.desc: Identical to Body Group (body), ask Valve why this is duplicated. Body Groups allow turning on and off parts of a model, so sections can be shown or hidden dynamically.

keyvalues.name: Texture Frame
keyvalues.desc: The frame number for any animated textures on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Hitbox Set
keyvalues.desc: Sets the $hboxset to use for collision testing.

keyvalues.name: Model Scale
keyvalues.desc: A multiplier for the size of the model.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select any entity (not info_lighting!) from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin Offset
keyvalues.desc: The info_lighting_relative from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Cast Distance
keyvalues.desc: Sets how far the entity casts dynamic shadows, in units. 0 means default distance from the shadow_control entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevent the entity from creating cheap render-to-texture/dynamic shadows.

keyvalues.name: Disable Receiving Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevents dynamic shadows (e.g. player and prop shadows) from appearing on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable ShadowDepth
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable rendering into shadow depth (for flashlight) for this entity.

keyvalues.name: Projected Texture Cache
keyvalues.desc: Used to hint projected texture system whether it is sufficient to cache shadow volume of this entity or to force render it every frame instead.

keyvalues.name: Disable flashlight
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable flashlight (env_projectedtexture) lighting and shadows on this entity.

inputs.name: Skin
inputs.desc: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Change the model's bodygroup to the specified index number.

inputs.name: Ignite
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire indefinitely.

inputs.name: IgniteLifetime
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire for a given amount of time.

inputs.name: IgniteNumHitboxFires
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given number of hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: IgniteHitboxFireScale
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given scale for hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: BecomeRagdoll
inputs.desc: Kills the entity and creates a client-side ragdoll from the model with ZERO force (just go limp). Input is only passed if the model contains ragdolling, for other models phys_convert can be used instead. OnDeath, OnHalfHealth, etc. outputs will **NOT** BE FIRED.

inputs.name: SetLightingOrigin
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as the entity's lighting origin. Any entity can be used.

inputs.name: SetLightingOriginHack
inputs.desc: Offsets the entity's lighting origin by their distance from an info_lighting_relative.

inputs.name: fademindist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: fademaxdist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: DisableShadow
inputs.desc: Allows the entity to draw a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: EnableShadow
inputs.desc: Prevents the entity from drawing a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: DisableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object will not recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: EnableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object may recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: AlternativeSorting
inputs.desc: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

inputs.name: SetModelScale
inputs.desc: Sets the scale of the model. Secondary parameter (space delimited) sets the duration of time to scale the model.

outputs.name: OnIgnite
outputs.desc: Fired when this object catches fire.

keyvalues.name: Render in Fast Reflections
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, causes this entity/prop to to render in fast water reflections (i.e. when a water material specifies $reflectonlymarkedentities) and in the world impostor pass.

inputs.name: DisableDrawInFastReflection
inputs.desc: Turns off rendering of this entity in reflections when using $reflectonlymarkedentities in water material.

inputs.name: EnableDrawInFastReflection
inputs.desc: Turn on rendering of this entity in reflections when using $reflectonlymarkedentities in water material.

keyvalues.name: Next Rope
keyvalues.desc: Name of the next rope along this path.

keyvalues.name: Slack
keyvalues.desc: How much extra length the rope has (by default it has the length between its two endpoints in the editor).

keyvalues.name: Subdivision
keyvalues.desc: Number of subdivisions between each rope segment. Maximum value is 8. Higher values make smoother ropes, but are slower to render.

keyvalues.name: Barbed
keyvalues.desc: Test effect that makes the rope look sharper and more barbed.

keyvalues.name: Width (1-64)
keyvalues.desc: Width of the rope.

keyvalues.name: Texture Scale
keyvalues.desc: This changes the texture resolution. The default resolution is 4 pixels per unit. Larger values stretch the texture and smaller values scrunch it up.

keyvalues.name: Start Dangling
keyvalues.desc: When set to Yes, the rope starts out detached from its target endpoint.

keyvalues.name: Breakable
keyvalues.desc: When set to yes, the rope can be detached from either endpoint when shot.

keyvalues.name: Rope Material
keyvalues.desc: The material to use when rendering the rope.

keyvalues.name: Wind
keyvalues.desc: Is the rope affected by wind?

keyvalues.name: Position Interpolator
keyvalues.desc: Curve Type. Currently only Rope is fully supported.

inputs.name: SetScrollSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed at which the texture scrolls.

inputs.name: SetForce
inputs.desc: Apply a force instantaneously to the rope. The parameter should be a vector containing the force to be applied (X Y Z).

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Break the rope, if it's marked to do so.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

keyvalues.name: Global Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world.

inputs.name: KillHierarchy
inputs.desc: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

inputs.name: AddOutput
inputs.desc:
Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity or changes keyvalues dynamically. Format:
'<output name> <targetname>:<inputname>:<parameter>:<delay>:<max times to fire (-1 == infinite, 1 = only once)>'
or 'keyvalue newval'. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: FireUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

inputs.name: Use
inputs.desc: More or less replicates the player interacting with an entity. (+USE)

inputs.name: CancelPending
inputs.desc: Cancels any events fired by this entity that are currently pending in the I/O event queue.

inputs.name: PassUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser1 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser2 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser3 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser4 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: FireRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OnUser1, OnUser2, OnUser3, or OnUser4 with a 25% chance of each.

inputs.name: PassRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OutUser1, OutUser2, OutUser3, or OutUser4 with a 25% chance of each. The parameter is passed along unchanged.

inputs.name: KillIfNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity if it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: KillWhenNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity when it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: FireOutput
inputs.desc: Fires the named output on this entity. Format: '<output name>:<activator>:<caller>:<parameter>:<delay>' (OnDeath:hl3cardgame:gaben). Everything beyond the output name is optional.

inputs.name: RemoveOutput
inputs.desc: Removes all instances of the named output on this entity. Wildcards are supported, meaning you could just pass '*' to wipe all outputs from this entity.

inputs.name: AcceptInput
inputs.desc: Fires the named input on this entity. Format: '<input name>:<parameter>:<activator>:<caller>:<output ID>' (SetTarget:cheese). Everything beyond the input name is optional. Mind the fact this is arranged differently from FireOutput, having the parameter right after the input name.

inputs.name: AddSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Adds spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: RemoveSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Removes spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: AddSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Adds solid flags to this entity.

inputs.name: RemoveSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Removes solid flags from this entity.

inputs.name: ChangeVariable
inputs.desc: Similar to AddOutput, except it changes an internal variable similar to logic_datadesc_accessor instead. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: SetEntityName
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's name that other entities should refer to it by.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's target. This is specific to certain entities, particularly logic entities that involve a target.

inputs.name: SetOwnerEntity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's owner entity. This has nothing to do with parenting and has more to do with collision and kill credits.

inputs.name: SetThinkNull
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's general think function to null. Behavior varies from entity to entity..

outputs.name: OnUser1
