outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

outputs.name: OnUser2
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

outputs.name: OnUser3
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

outputs.name: OnUser4
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

outputs.name: OutUser1
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser1 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser2
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser2 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser3
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser3 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser4
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser4 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

keyvalues.name: Press Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when pressed. Choose from sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the player tries to use the button, and fails because it's locked. These are sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the button is unlocked. These are sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the player tries to use the button, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the button is unlocked.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the button, preventing it from functioning.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the button, allowing it to function.

inputs.name: Press
inputs.desc: Activate the button as if it was pressed.

inputs.name: PressIn
inputs.desc: Activate the button as if it was pressed, sending it to the bottom position.

inputs.name: PressOut
inputs.desc: Unpress the button, sending it to the top position.

outputs.name: OnDamaged
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is damaged.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is pressed.

outputs.name: OnUseLocked
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is used while locked.

outputs.name: OnIn
outputs.desc: Fired when the button reaches the in/pressed position.

outputs.name: OnOut
outputs.desc: Fired when the button reaches the out/released position.

desc: An entity that can be linked to another door and create a passage between them dynamically.

inputs.name: SetPartner
inputs.desc: Set a new partner door.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door and cause the portal to activate.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door and cause the portal to deactivate.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its open animation.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its close animation.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

desc: Behaviour only applicable to visible NPCs.

keyvalues.name: Target Path Corner
keyvalues.desc: If set, the name of a path corner entity that this NPC will walk to, after spawning.

keyvalues.name: Expression Override
keyvalues.desc: Enter a VCD file to override facial expressions on this NPC.

keyvalues.name: Don't Use Speech Semaphore?
keyvalues.desc: Friendly NPCs are not allowed to speak if another friendly NPC is speaking. In some cases we don't want speaking NPCs to prevent other NPCs from speaking (for instance, if there is a friendly NPC speaking for a long time on a monitor). To make this NPC not prevent other NPCs from talking, make it not grab the semaphore when it speaks.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: HACK: Sets this NPC's body group (from 0 - n). You'd better know what you are doing!

inputs.name: SetExpressionOverride
inputs.desc: Set a VCD file to override facial expressions on this NPC.

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

outputs.name: OnTakeDamage
outputs.desc: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

desc: This is the definition of the 'beam' class, but we don't want that in the entity list.

keyvalues.name: Render Mode
keyvalues.desc: Render mode is forced to Texture, but set to Color in Hammer to ensure correct rendering.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Amount of noise (0-64)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of noise in the beam. 0 is a perfectly straight beam.

keyvalues.name: Frames per 10 seconds
keyvalues.desc: Framerate at which the beam texture should animate, if it has multiple frames.

keyvalues.name: Starting Frame
keyvalues.desc: The frame to start the beam texture on.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Name
keyvalues.desc: The material used to draw the beam.

keyvalues.name: Texture Scroll Rate (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Rate at which the beam texture should scroll along the beam.

keyvalues.name: Damage / second
keyvalues.desc: How much damage this beam does per second to things while active. For continuous damage, the value should be greater than 10 or it may not work.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turns the beam on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turns the beam off.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the beam between on and off.

inputs.name: Noise
inputs.desc: Set the noise of the beam, in pixels.

inputs.name: Width
inputs.desc: Set the width of the beam, in pixels.

inputs.name: ScrollSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the scroll speed in units per second (0 - 100).

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.desc: Sets the beam's alpha (0 - 255).

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Sets the beam's render color (R G B).

inputs.name: ColorRedValue
inputs.desc: Sets the red color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorGreenValue
inputs.desc: Sets the green color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorBlueValue
inputs.desc: Sets the blue color channel's value (0 - 255).

keyvalues.name: Entity 1 (Yellow)
keyvalues.desc: The first entity to constrain. If blank the second entity will be constrained to the World.

keyvalues.name: Entity 2 (Blue)
keyvalues.desc: The second entity to constrain. If blank the first entity will be constrained to the World.

keyvalues.name: Constraint System Manager
keyvalues.desc: The name of a phys_constraintsystem that this constraint should be a part of. All constraints on a set of entities should be placed in the same system, or they will fight each other during simulation.

keyvalues.name: Force Limit to Break (lbs)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of force an impact must apply to the constraint to break it. A way of calculating this is to set it to the mass of an object that would break this constraint if it were resting on the constrainted objects.

keyvalues.name: Torque Limit to Break (lbs * distance)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of torque required to break the constraint. A way of calculating this is to multiply any reference mass by the resting distance (from the center of mass of the object) needed to break the constraint.

keyvalues.name: Play Sound on Break
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the constraint is broken.

keyvalues.name: Follow teleport distance
keyvalues.desc: If one object teleports more than this many units away it will cause the other constrained object to teleport to an appropriate relative position.

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Force the constraint to break.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable the constraint.  Do this when the objects don't exist when the constraint spawns - or when you have deactivated the constraint.  Broken constraints can NOT be turned on.  They have been deleted.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable this constraint.

outputs.name: OnBreak
outputs.desc: Fired when the constraint breaks.

keyvalues.name: Spawn path_track
keyvalues.desc: The name of the first path_track in the train's path. The train will spawn at this path_track. It will also turn to face direction indicated by the 'Orientation Type' setting.

keyvalues.name: Max Speed (units / second)
keyvalues.desc: The maximum speed that this train can move. Any speeds applied to this train, such as by path_tracks or SetSpeed inputs, will be clipped to this maximum value.

keyvalues.name: Initial Speed (units / second)
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the train will move at after it spawns, 0 = stopped.

keyvalues.name: Change Velocity
keyvalues.desc: The method through which this train changes its velocity as it moves along the path.

keyvalues.name: Change Orientation
keyvalues.desc: The method through which this train changes its orientation as it moves along the path.

keyvalues.name: Distance Between the Wheels
keyvalues.desc: Used for turning and stopping.

keyvalues.name: Height above track
keyvalues.desc: The height above the track that this train moves.

keyvalues.name: Damage on Crush
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage this train does to entities that block it.

keyvalues.name: Move Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound that is played (and looped) while the train is moving.

keyvalues.name: Move Ping Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound that is played more frequently as the train speeds up.

keyvalues.name: Start Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the train starts moving.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the train stops moving.

keyvalues.name: Min pitch (1-255, > 100 = higher)
keyvalues.desc: The sound pitch value that the train will approach as it comes to a stop.

keyvalues.name: Max pitch (1-255, > 100 = higher)
keyvalues.desc: The sound pitch value that the train will approach as it approaches its max speed  or 1000 units/second if the 'Use max speed for pitch shifting move sound' flag is not set.

keyvalues.name: Min move sound interval
keyvalues.desc: Minimum interval at which to play the move ping sound.

keyvalues.name: Max move sound interval
keyvalues.desc: Maximum interval at which to play the move ping sound.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train, as a ratio of max speed [0, 1]

inputs.name: SetSpeedDir
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train, as a ratio of max speed. Negative values reverse the direction [-1, 1]

inputs.name: SetSpeedReal
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train. Must be a positive value from 0 to max speed.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop the train.

inputs.name: StartForward
inputs.desc: Start the train moving forward.

inputs.name: StartBackward
inputs.desc: Start the train moving backward.

inputs.name: Resume
inputs.desc: Resume the train moving in the current direction after it was stopped via the 'Stop' or 'Toggle' input.

inputs.name: Reverse
inputs.desc: Reverse the direction of the train.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the train between start and stop.

keyvalues.name: Track Number
keyvalues.desc: Track number that this entity belongs to. -1 = all tracks, 0 = main map, > 0 = bonus zone (of that number).

keyvalues.name: 50 percent falloff distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which brightness should fall off to 50%. If set, overrides linear constant and quadratic parameters.

keyvalues.name: 0 percent falloff distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which brightness should fall off to negligible (1/256)%. Must set _fifty_percent_distance to use.

keyvalues.name: Hard Falloff
keyvalues.desc: If set, causes lights to fall to exactly zero beyond the zero percent distance. May cause unrealistic lighting if not used carefully.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance that light is allowed to cast.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fires when the player +uses this weapon.

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Fires when the player picks up this weapon.

outputs.name: OnCacheInteraction
outputs.desc: Fires when the player 'proves' they've found this weapon. Fires on: Player Touch and +USE pickup.

keyvalues.name: Render Mode
keyvalues.desc: Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'.* Color & Texture = src*a+dest*(1-a)* Glow = src*a + dest, fixed on screen for sprites* Solid = Performs alphatest transparency* Additive = src*a + dest* Additive FF = blend between sprite nimation frames* Alpha Add = src + dest*(1-a)* World Space Glow = src*a + dest

keyvalues.name: FX Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: A color to mix with the model/sprite.

keyvalues.name: FX Alpha (0 - 255)
keyvalues.desc: Transparency amount, requires a Render Mode other than Normal. 0 is invisible, 255 is fully visible.

keyvalues.name: Render FX
keyvalues.desc: Various somewhat legacy alpha effects. Material Proxies are more modern.

keyvalues.name: View ID nodraw
keyvalues.desc: This keyvalue can control whether an entity should only draw on things like monitors or mirrors, or the opposite. The code for this is { m_iViewHideFlags & (1 << CurrentViewID()) } and supports any combination of view IDs.

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.desc: Set the entity's alpha (0 - 255).

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Set the entity's color (R G B).

inputs.name: SetRenderMode
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's render mode.

inputs.name: SetRenderFX
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's render FX.

inputs.name: SetViewHideFlags
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's view ID nodraw flags (takes raw flag combination).

inputs.name: AddEffects
inputs.desc: Adds an entity effect.

inputs.name: RemoveEffects
inputs.desc: Removes an entity effect.

inputs.name: EnableDraw
inputs.desc: Draws an entity if it is not drawn. Equivalent to RemoveEffects > 32.

inputs.name: DisableDraw
inputs.desc: Undraws an entity if it is drawn. Equivalent to AddEffects > 32.

inputs.name: AddEFlags
inputs.desc: Adds an entity flag. NOTE: Entity flags are not the spawn flags you see in Hammer. Use AddSpawnFlags to add spawnflags.

inputs.name: RemoveEFlags
inputs.desc: Removes an entity flag. NOTE: Entity flags are not the spawn flags you see in Hammer. Use RemoveSpawnFlags to remove spawnflags.

inputs.name: SetCollisionGroup
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's collision group.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: The model to use for this entity.

keyvalues.name: World Number
keyvalues.desc: The world number the stage is in. -1 (usually) defaults to the current world.

keyvalues.name: Stage Number
keyvalues.desc: The stage number.

desc: For prop_physics-like entities.

keyvalues.name: Min Damage to Hurt
keyvalues.desc: The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Cast Distance
keyvalues.desc: Use this to override how far this object casts shadows. 0 = default distance.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc:
Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.
Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.

keyvalues.name: Damaging it Doesn't Push It
keyvalues.desc: Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move.

keyvalues.name: Scale Factor For Inertia
keyvalues.desc: Scales the angular mass of an object. Used to hack angular damage and collision response.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

keyvalues.name: Override Parameters
keyvalues.desc: A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.

keyvalues.name: Health Level to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Force to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value on the physbox will enable motion.

inputs.name: Wake
inputs.desc: Wake up this physics object, if it is sleeping.

inputs.name: Sleep
inputs.desc: Put this physics object to sleep. It will wake if given the Wake input, or if force is applied to it. Note that physics objects go to sleep automatically after coming to rest for a while, so you don't really need to use this.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Enable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Disable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableFloating
inputs.desc: Disable fluid/floating simulation to reduce cost.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Set this prop's body group (from 0 - n).

inputs.name: physdamagescale
inputs.desc: Set the Physics Impact Damage Scale for this character. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

inputs.name: EnablePuntSound
inputs.desc: Allow this prop to play its own sound when punted.

inputs.name: DisablePuntSound
inputs.desc: Prevent this prop from playing its own sound when punted.

outputs.name: OnMotionEnabled
outputs.desc: Fired when motion is enabled on this prop, either via 'Health Level to Override Motion' or from the EnableMotion input.

outputs.name: OnAwakened
outputs.desc: Fired when this entity becomes awake (collision/force is applied to it while it's asleep).

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when the player picks up the prop with the physcannon or +USE.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPunt
outputs.desc: Fired when a player punts this object with the physgun.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunOnlyPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when a player picks this object up WITH THE PHYSGUN. +USE pickups do not fire this output.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunDrop
outputs.desc: Fired when the player drops the prop with the physcannon or USE.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player tries to +USE the prop. This output will fire only if the Generate output on +USE spawnflag is set.

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player picks up this prop (with the physcannon or with +USE).

outputs.name: OnOutOfWorld
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the prop is out of the allowed world bounds.

desc: Targetnames only used in compilation.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity only exists during compilation, so the name is only usable in limited situations.

keyvalues.name: Game Type
keyvalues.desc: The game type of the map.

keyvalues.name: Response Contexts
keyvalues.desc: Response system context(s) for this entity. Format should be: 'key:value,key2:value2,etc'. When this entity speaks, the list of keys & values will be passed to the response rules system.

inputs.name: AddContext
inputs.desc: Adds a context to this entity's list of response contexts. The format should be 'key:value'.

inputs.name: RemoveContext
inputs.desc: Remove a context from this entity's list of response contexts. The name should match the 'key' of a previously added context.

inputs.name: ClearContext
inputs.desc: Removes all contexts in this entity's list of response contexts.

keyvalues.name: Orientation
keyvalues.desc: How the prop/sprite rotates to face the camera.

desc: An entity that constrains players to a radius around itself, slowing them down the closer they get to the edge of the radius.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius to constrain players to.

keyvalues.name: Constraint Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the constraint edge. This is the distance in which to start slowing players down as they approach the edge of the radius.

keyvalues.name: Speed Factor
keyvalues.desc: Factor applied to the player's max speed as they approach the radius edge.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Start constraining any players within the radius.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Stop constraining any players previously constrained.

outputs.name: OnConstraintBroken
outputs.desc: Fired when a player breaks through the constraint.

desc: An entity that displays a text message oriented in the world, at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Text Size
keyvalues.desc: Text Size.

keyvalues.name: Font Material
keyvalues.desc: The font material atlas to use for the text

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start displaying the message text, if the player is within the message radius.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop displaying the message text.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the display status

inputs.name: SetMessage
inputs.desc: Set the message text.

desc: An entity that relays bonus maps changes.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlocks the filename/map combination.

inputs.name: Complete
inputs.desc: Completes the filename/map combination.

inputs.name: Save
inputs.desc: Saves bonus map data.

desc: An entity that will find an entity and pass it along as the !caller with the OutEntity output. Requires using !caller as the parameter on the input.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to narrow set of findable entities. See filter_activator_name for more explanation.

keyvalues.name: Reference Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity to use when evaluating criteria. For example, when using 'Nearest', this is the entity that distance will be measured from. If left blank will use the point_entity_finder.

inputs.name: FindEntity
inputs.desc: Find an entity that meets the specified criteria.  Will fire OutEntity if found and pass the entity as !Caller.

outputs.name: OnFoundEntity
outputs.desc: Fired when FindEntity is input and an entity was found. Passes the found entity as !Caller.

desc: An entity that does damage to all entities in a radius around itself, with a specified delay. If 'Target Entity' is specified, the damage is only done to that entity.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, only this entity will take damage. Otherwise, all entities within the Radius will take damage.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: All entities within this radius of this entity will take damage. If a 'Target Entity' is specified, only that entity will take damage.

keyvalues.name: Damage
keyvalues.desc: Damage done to all affected entities each time this entity fires.

keyvalues.name: Delay
keyvalues.desc: Delay between refires, in seconds.

inputs.name: Hurt
inputs.desc: Force a single fire, damaging either the Target Entity or all entities within the radius.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable this entity. It will start damaging entities everytime it fires, and refire based upon the specified Delay.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable this entity. It will stop damaging entities.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle this entity between On/Off state.

desc: An entity that issues commands to the client console, as if it was typed in by the player (if activator is a player, or the local player in single player).

inputs.name: Command
inputs.desc: Command(s) to execute, separated by semicolons.

desc: A camera entity that controls the player's view. While it's active, the player will see out of the camera.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Look At
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that the camera should point at and track while active.

keyvalues.name: Target Attachment Name
keyvalues.desc: If set, the camera will focus on the specified attachment on the 'Entity to Look At'.

keyvalues.name: Hold Time
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time the camera should control the player's view for, after which it deactivates itself. If the camera should stay active until told to deactive, set the 'Infinite Hold Time' spawnflag.

keyvalues.name: Path Corner
keyvalues.desc: The first path corner in a track that the camera should move along once it's activated. If not specified, the camera won't move.

keyvalues.name: Interpolate Position To Player
keyvalues.desc: Gradually interpolate player's position to here on start. (Episodic only)

keyvalues.name: Initial Speed
keyvalues.desc: The starting speed that the camera moves at, if it's on a path track.

keyvalues.name: Acceleration units/sec^2
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the camera accelerates to path corner's desired speeds.

keyvalues.name: Stop Deceleration units/sec^2
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the camera decelerates to path corner's desired speeds.

keyvalues.name: Tracking Speed of the camera
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the camera tries to follow it's look target.

keyvalues.name: Field of view
keyvalues.desc: Player FOV (if Set FOV spawnflag is set)

keyvalues.name: Seconds to reach FOV target
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time it should take to reach the specified FOV

keyvalues.name: Don't set player view
keyvalues.desc: Prevents this point_viewcontrol from actually controlling the player's view. FOV, player-affecting spawnflags, etc. may still happen.

keyvalues.name: <Far Plane>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to display the view frustum preview.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the point_viewcontrol, and start controlling the player's view.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the point_viewcontrol, and stop controlling the player's view.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Set a new target for the camera to point at.

inputs.name: SetTargetAttachment
inputs.desc: Set a new attachment on the target for the camera to point at.

inputs.name: ReturnToEyes
inputs.desc: Return the camera view to the player's eyes.

inputs.name: TeleportToView
inputs.desc: Teleport the player to the current position of the camera.

inputs.name: SetTrackSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed that the camera will try to track it's target.

inputs.name: SetPath
inputs.desc: Have the camera start following a new path.

outputs.name: OnEndFollow
outputs.desc: Fired when the point_viewcontrol deactivates, due to the Disable input being received, the Entity to Look At being destroyed, or the Hold Time expiring.

desc: Commentary node for the developer commentary. Usually added after-the-fact by the commentary system, but can also be placed manually.

keyvalues.name: Commentary File
keyvalues.desc: The sound that will play when this is triggered.

keyvalues.name: Commentary File (no HDR)
keyvalues.desc: If HDR is off and this exists it will be played instead.

keyvalues.name: Speaker(s)
keyvalues.desc: The characters/people who are saying the commentary.

keyvalues.name: Start Disabled
keyvalues.desc: Should it be disabled or not?

keyvalues.name: Prevent Movement?
keyvalues.desc: If enabled players won't be able to move while the commentary is playing.

keyvalues.name: Pre-Command
keyvalues.desc: Command that will fire before the sound file is played. Use semicolons to delimit multiple commands.

keyvalues.name: Post-Command
keyvalues.desc: Command that will fire after the sound file is played. Also accepts semicolons.

keyvalues.name: View Position
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity the player's view will move to.

keyvalues.name: View Target
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity the player's view will track. If set, the player cannot move their camera.

inputs.name: StartCommentary
inputs.desc: Start the commentary, just like if the player +USEd this.

inputs.name: StopCommentary
inputs.desc: Force the commentary node to stop.

inputs.name: StartUnstoppableCommentary
inputs.desc: Start the commentary but don't let the player cancel it.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryStarted
outputs.desc: Triggered when the commentary starts.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryStopped
outputs.desc: Triggered when the commentary stops. If viewposition is set, this triggers after the player's returns to their regular view.

desc: An entity that detects if another entity points in a given direction for a period of time.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose angles will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Look At Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity we want to check to see if the Target Entity is looking at.

keyvalues.name: Duration
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time the Target Entity must look at the 'Look at Entity' to trigger this entity, in seconds.

keyvalues.name: Tolerance
keyvalues.desc: The tolerance, in degrees, in the checking to determine when the Target Entity is looking at the Look At Entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the sensor between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Check to see if the Target Entity is facing the Look At Entity within the specified tolerance, firing either the OnFacingLookat or OnNotFacingLookat output based on the result.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Set the target entity

outputs.name: TargetDir
outputs.desc: Fired when the forward direction of the Target Entity changes. Passes the new forward direction as a parameter.

outputs.name: OnFacingLookat
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity points at the Look At Entity for more than the specified Duration, or in response to a Test input.

outputs.name: OnNotFacingLookat
outputs.desc: Fires in response to a Test input when the Target Entity is not pointing at the Look At Entity.

outputs.name: FacingPercentage
outputs.desc: Normalized value (0..1) where 1 is facing directly at target and 0 is at or beyond the angle of tolerance.

desc: An entity that teleports a target entity to this position and angles. If 'Teleport Home' spawn flag is set, teleports the target entity to its spawn position instead. If object is physically simulated, simulation is turned off when teleported.

keyvalues.name: Entity To Teleport
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that will be teleported.

keyvalues.name: [H] Model
keyvalues.desc: The model shown in Hammer, to use for positioning.

inputs.name: Teleport
inputs.desc: Teleport the target entity.

inputs.name: TeleportToCurrentPos
inputs.desc: Teleport the target entity to wherever the point_teleport entity is currently. The Teleport input teleports to the initial position of the point_teleport, so this input was added to avoid breaking old content.

inputs.name: TeleportEntity
inputs.desc: Teleport the entity specified by the parameter override. Use this to teleport an entity other than the one specified in the Entity To Teleport field.

desc: An entity that issues commands to the server console.

inputs.name: Command
inputs.desc: Command(s) to execute, separated by semicolons.

desc: A camera entity that moves the player's view. Use this if you want the player to retain control of where the player looks but want to move the position to another location.

keyvalues.name: Offset type
keyvalues.desc: How the player's view moves to the view of the camera.

keyvalues.name: Proxy Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that the camera uses to translate the view.

keyvalues.name: Attachment Point
keyvalues.desc: Use this attachment on the proxy's parent for position and orientation.

keyvalues.name: Tilt Fraction
keyvalues.desc: How much the angle of the proxy affects the angle of the view. 0.0 will keep the players view angles unmodified. 1.0 will add in the whole tilt from the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Use Fake Acceleration
keyvalues.desc: If the player maintains an offset from the proxy apply fake acceleration on the player based on the movement of the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Skew Acceleration Forward
keyvalues.desc: If this is set fake acceleration will be more noticeable in the direction of the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Acceleration Scalar
keyvalues.desc: Multiply the fake acceleration by this ammount.

keyvalues.name: Ease Angles To Camera
keyvalues.desc: Move the player's angles to the camera - this will stop them from looking around.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the view proxy, and start modifying the player's view.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the view proxy, and start modifying the player's view.

inputs.name: TeleportPlayerToProxy
inputs.desc: Move the player to the view proxy.

desc: An entity that detects if another entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds a threshold value.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose angular velocity will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Threshold Velocity
keyvalues.desc: The threshold angular velocity to compare against, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Fire Interval
keyvalues.desc: Angular velocity must cross the threshold for at least this long to fire.

keyvalues.name: Use Axis Helper
keyvalues.desc: Use axis helper to determine rotation values (clockwise/counter-clockwise).

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Checks to see if the Target Entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds the Threshold Velocity, firing either the OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo or OnLessThan output based on the result.

inputs.name: TestWithInterval
inputs.desc: Checks to see if the Target Entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds the Threshold Velocity. Once the Fire Interval expires, fires the appropriate test result output if the result is stable throughout the Fire Interval.

outputs.name: AngularVelocity
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target's Angular Velocity changes, passing the new magnitude of the angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from slower than the threshold angular velocity to faster than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from slower than the threshold angular velocity to faster than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnLessThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from faster than the threshold angular velocity to slower than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnLessThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from faster than the threshold angular velocity to slower than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity reaches the threshold angular velocity from a different velocity.

desc: Camera

keyvalues.name: FOV
keyvalues.desc: Field of view in degrees

keyvalues.name: Fog Start
keyvalues.desc: The near fog plane.

keyvalues.name: Fog End
keyvalues.desc: The far fog/clipping plane.

keyvalues.name: Fog Max Density [0..1]
keyvalues.desc: The maximum fog density. 0=no fog, 1=full fog.

inputs.name: ChangeFOV
inputs.desc: Changes camera's FOV over time

inputs.name: SetOnAndTurnOthersOff
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on, and turn all other cameras off.

inputs.name: SetOn
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on.

inputs.name: SetOff
inputs.desc: Turn the camera off.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on, activate it and deactivate all other cameras.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the camera off, deactivate it.

desc: An entity that creates tesla lightning arcs around its origin.

keyvalues.name: Start Enabled
keyvalues.desc: Should the tesla start active?

keyvalues.name: Source Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, tesla lightning will originate from the specified entity. Otherwise, they originate from this entity.

keyvalues.name: Sound Name
keyvalues.desc: Sound to be played whenever lightning is created.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Name
keyvalues.desc: Material to use for the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius around the origin to find a point to strike with a tesla lightning beam.

keyvalues.name: Min # of Beams
keyvalues.desc: Minimum number of tesla lightning beams to create when creating an arc.

keyvalues.name: Max # of Beams
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of tesla lightning beams to create when creating an arc.

keyvalues.name: Min Beam Width
keyvalues.desc: Minimum width of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Max Beam Width
keyvalues.desc: Maximum width of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Min Time Visible
keyvalues.desc: Minimum lifetime of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Max Time Visible
keyvalues.desc: Maximum lifetime of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Min Time Between Arcs
keyvalues.desc: Minimum time delay between random arcing.

keyvalues.name: Max Time Between Arcs
keyvalues.desc: Maximum time delay between random arcing.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn emitter on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn emitter off.

inputs.name: DoSpark
inputs.desc: Force a single arc.

desc: An entity that sets the default specialized settings to the map.

keyvalues.name: Gravity value
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default gravity value.

keyvalues.name: Maximum velocity
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default max velocity value.

keyvalues.name: Water accelerate speed
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default water accelerate speed value.

keyvalues.name: Air accelerate speed
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default air accelerate speed value.

keyvalues.name: Accelerate speed
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default ground accelerate speed value.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default friction value. The lower the number, the more slippery the player will move, the higher the number, the more slower and gripped the player is to the floor. 4 is default.

keyvalues.name: Back speed
keyvalues.desc: How much to slow down backwards motion.

keyvalues.name: Stop speed
keyvalues.desc: Set here the default ground accelerate speed value.

keyvalues.name: Step size
keyvalues.desc: Vertical view fixup when eyes are near a new plane.

keyvalues.name: Water distance
keyvalues.desc: Vertical view fixup when eyes are near water plane.

keyvalues.name: Foot steps sound
keyvalues.desc: Enable/Disable foot steps sounds.

keyvalues.name: Swim sound
keyvalues.desc: Enable/Disable swimming sounds.

desc: An entity that detects and outputs an entity's velocity.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose velocity will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Start Enabled
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not to start enabled and active.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the sensor.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the sensor.

outputs.name: Velocity
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target's Velocity changes, passing the new magnitude of the velocity.

desc: An entity that detects another entity's proximity to a target position.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose position will be sensed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the sensor between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity and begins output. The targetnames !activator and !caller are accepted.

outputs.name: Distance
outputs.desc: Distance of the target entity away from this entity.

desc: Generic game statistics counter.

inputs.name: SetName
inputs.desc: Changes name of statistic counter

inputs.name: Increment
inputs.desc: Increments named statistic counter by specified value

desc:
Turns an entity, or set of entities, into a single template that can be instanced anywhere, and multiple times. If there are interdependencies (entity I/O, hierarchy, or other name references) between the entities in the template, the entities in the template will have their names changed and the interdependencies will be reconnected to the changes names. The name change format is as follows: '<original name>&0000', where the 0000 will be replaced with the current global template instance, so wildcard searches for '<original name>*' will still find them.
If you don't want the name fixup to happen, because you're only spawning the template once, or you want inputs to trigger all instances of the template, check the 'Preserve entity names' spawnflag. 
To spawn the template in other places, use an env_entity_maker.

inputs.name: ForceSpawn
inputs.desc: Spawn an instance of the template at the original position.

outputs.name: OnEntitySpawned
outputs.desc: Fired after spawning an instance of this template.

desc: An entity that controls a pose parameter of a prop and cycles the pose clientside.

keyvalues.name: Target
keyvalues.desc: Name of the prop to control. Can be any animating entity.

keyvalues.name: Pose Parameter Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the pose parameter to control. Setting this to an invalid value will crash the game!

keyvalues.name: Pose Parameter Value
keyvalues.desc: Normalized value for the pose parameter from 0.0 and 1.0 (maps to min and max range).

keyvalues.name: Interpolation Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds (0.0 to 10.0) for client to match absolue pose values.

keyvalues.name: Interpolation Wrap
keyvalues.desc: Should wrap from 0.0 to 1.0 when interpolating.

keyvalues.name: Cycle Frequency
keyvalues.desc: Base cycles per second from -10.0 to 10.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Time Offset
keyvalues.desc: Modulation time offset from -1.0f to 1.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Rate
keyvalues.desc: Modulation cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Amplitude
keyvalues.desc: Modulation extents from 0.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterName
inputs.desc: Sets the pose parameter to control.

inputs.name: SetPoseValue
inputs.desc: Set the pose parameter to a normalized value between 0.0 and 1.0 (maps to min and max range).

inputs.name: SetInterpolationTime
inputs.desc: Set the interpolation time to a number of seconds between 0.0 and 10.0.

inputs.name: SetCycleFrequency
inputs.desc: Set the pose parameter's base cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetFModType
inputs.desc: Set the type of frequency modulation.

inputs.name: SetFModTimeOffset
inputs.desc: Set the modulation time offset from -1.0f to 1.0.

inputs.name: SetFModRate
inputs.desc: Set the modulation cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetFModAmplitude
inputs.desc: Set the modulation extents from 0.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: RandomizeFMod
inputs.desc: Randomize the frequency modulation by an extremeness of 0.0 to 1.0.

inputs.name: GetFmod
inputs.desc: Outputs the current modulation settings in console.

desc: An entity that displays a text message in the world, at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Show message radius
keyvalues.desc: Distance the player must be within to see this message.

keyvalues.name: Developer Only?
keyvalues.desc: If set, this message will only be visible when developer mode is on.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start displaying the message text, if the player is within the message radius.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop displaying the message text.

desc: An entity used by the -makedevshots system, which automatically takes screenshots at the position of every devshot camera in the level.

keyvalues.name: Camera Name
keyvalues.desc: Used as the name of the directory to store screenshots from this camera. Must be unique within the level.

keyvalues.name: Camera FOV
keyvalues.desc: FOV of this camera.

keyvalues.name: <Far Plane>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to display the view frustum preview.

inputs.name: TakeScreenshot
inputs.desc: Takes a single screenshot from this camera only

desc: An entity to draw a spotlight. Will draw a beam when the player views it side on, and a halo when it's facing towards the player. Unless the 'No Dynamic Light' spawnflag is checked, it will also create a dynamic light wherever the end of the spotlight rests.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Length
keyvalues.desc: Length of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Solid
keyvalues.desc: If set, this spotlight won't trace for solids.

keyvalues.name: Brightness
keyvalues.desc: Integer value representing spotlight brightness (0-255)

inputs.name: LightOn
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight on.

inputs.name: LightOff
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight off

inputs.name: SetColor
inputs.desc: Change the color of the spotlight.

inputs.name: ForceUpdate
inputs.desc: Force an update of the spotlight position and orientation.

inputs.name: SetBrightness
inputs.desc: Set the brightness of the spotlight.

outputs.name: OnLightOn
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns on.

outputs.name: OnLightOff
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns off.

desc: An entity used to move a motion-disabled prop when it enables motion. Parent this entity to the prop, and when the prop has its motion enabled, it will immediately teleport to the origin of this entity.

An entity used to manage a group of interacting constraints and keep them stable. All constraints on a set of entities should be placed in the same system, or they will fight each other during simulation.

keyvalues.name: Additional System Iterations
keyvalues.desc: Adding iterations makes the interactions among constraints in a system tighter. It will not compensate for errors due to collision, but will help in cases where objects of disparate mass are constrained to each other.

desc: An entity used to apply constant acceleration to a physics object. The force and torque is calculated using the position and direction of the thruster as an impulse. So moving those off the object's center will cause torque as well. Torque can be removed by unchecking the 'apply torque' flag. The position of the thruster can be forced to be at the object's center by checking to 'ignore pos' flag.

keyvalues.name: Force
keyvalues.desc: Force (will be integrated, units are force kg*in/s^2)

desc: A constraint that keeps the position of two objects fixed, relative to the constraint's origin. It does not affect rotation.
An entity that tries to spin a target entity at a particular speed.

keyvalues.name: Rotation Speed
keyvalues.desc: Angular speed (units are degress/second)

keyvalues.name: Spin up time
keyvalues.desc: spin up time in seconds (also affects the rate at which speed changes happen)

keyvalues.name: System Interia Scale
keyvalues.desc: Make this larger if the object being driven is constrained to a set of heavier objects.

keyvalues.name: Attached Object
keyvalues.desc: Object to apply the force to

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Sets target speed

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turns motor on

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turns motor off

desc: Turns an arbitrary entity into a physically simulated entity. i.e. brush entities will behave like func_physbox, model entities behave like prop_physics.

keyvalues.name: Entity to convert
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity or entities that will be converted to a physics object when the ConvertTarget input is fired. Maximum of 512 entities.

keyvalues.name: Model Swap Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the entity will be switched to use this entity's model instead of its own. Only one entity will be converted.

keyvalues.name: Mass Override
keyvalues.desc: Sets the mass when the object(s) are converted (0 means auto-calculate)

inputs.name: ConvertTarget
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's target to a physically simulated object.

outputs.name: OnConvert
outputs.desc: Fires after the conversion has taken place.

desc: A constraint that constrains an entity along a line segment.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: Resistance/friction in the constraint

keyvalues.name: Load Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the mass load connected to this constraint (1=just the objects directly connected)

keyvalues.name: Minimum Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling below this many units/sec, will not play any sound.

keyvalues.name: Full Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling at this speed or above, will play sound at full volume.

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (forward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling forward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (backward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling backward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (small)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the small reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (medium)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the medium reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (large)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the large reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (small)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the small threshold but less than medium

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (medium)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the medium threshold but less than large

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (large)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the large threshold

inputs.name: SetVelocity
inputs.desc: Set linear velocity along the constraint

desc: A physically simulated hinge. Use the helper to define the axis of rotation.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: Resistance/friction in the hinge

keyvalues.name: Load Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the load connected to this hinge (1=just the objects directly connected)

keyvalues.name: Minimum Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling below this many units/sec, will not play any sound.

keyvalues.name: Full Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling at this speed or above, will play sound at full volume.

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (forward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling forward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (backward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling backward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (small)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the small reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (medium)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the medium reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (large)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the large reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (small)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the small threshold but less than medium

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (medium)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the medium threshold but less than large

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (large)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the large threshold

inputs.name: SetAngularVelocity
inputs.desc: Set angular velocity around the hinge (motor) in deg/sec

desc: A controller that tries to keep an entity facing a particular direction.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity to align to the desired angles.

keyvalues.name: Angular Limit
keyvalues.desc: The maximum angular velocity that this controller can compensate for, in degrees per second.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable the controller.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable the controller.

desc: An entity that acts like a magnet for ragdolls. Useful for crafting exaggerated ragdoll behavior (i.e. guys falling over rails on death). If the Bar Magnet spawnflag is set, the magnet works like it was a cylindrical magnet i.e. it attracts ragdolls to the nearest point on a line.

keyvalues.name: Bar Magnet Axis
keyvalues.desc: If the Bar Magnet spawnflag is set, ragdolls will be attracted to any point on this line.

keyvalues.name: Effective Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius in which ragdolls are affected around this entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Force
keyvalues.desc: Magnetic force to apply to ragdolls within the radius. Expressed as kilograms per unit per second. So a force of 1000 will add 10 units/second to a 100kg man. It will add 100 units per second to a 10kg headcrab.

keyvalues.name: Entity to affect
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the phys_ragdollmagnet will only affect the target entity.

desc: A constraint that keeps the relative position and orientation of two objects fixed.

A physically simulated spring. 'Length' is what's known as the 'natural spring length'. This is how long the spring would be if it was at rest (nothing hanging on it or attached). When you attach something to the spring, it will stretch longer than its 'natural length'. The amount of stretch is determined by the 'Sprint Constant'. The larger the spring constant the less stretch the spring.

keyvalues.name: Spring Axis
keyvalues.desc: Use the helper. Drag it out to match the virtual spring.

keyvalues.name: Spring Length
keyvalues.desc: How long the spring would be if it was at rest (nothing hanging on it or attached). 0 means the length of the brush.

keyvalues.name: Spring Constant
keyvalues.desc: Stiffness of the spring.  The larger the number the less the spring will stretch.

keyvalues.name: Damping Constant
keyvalues.desc: How much energy the spring loses.  The larger the number, the less bouncy the spring.

keyvalues.name: Relative Damping Constant
keyvalues.desc: The amount of energy the spring loses proportional to the relative velocity of the two objects the spring is attached to.

keyvalues.name: Break on Length
keyvalues.desc: If the spring's length ever exceeds this length, the spring breaks.

inputs.name: SetSpringConstant
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Constant.

inputs.name: SetSpringLength
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Length.

inputs.name: SetSpringDamping
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Damping.

desc: A constraint that preserves the distance between two entities. If the 'Keep Rigid' flag is set, think of it as a rod. If not, think off it as a virtual rope.

keyvalues.name: Additional Length
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the rope.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Length
keyvalues.desc: If the constraint is not rigid, this is the minimum length it can be.

keyvalues.name: Attached object 2 point
keyvalues.default: The position the rope attaches to object 2

desc: An angular thruster. Use it to apply angular force to an entity.
An entity that acts like a magnet, attaching metallic physics objects to itself when they touch it.

keyvalues.name: Force Limit to Break (lbs)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of force necessary to break a stuck object off the magnet. A way of calculating this is to set it to the mass of an object that would break this constraint if it were resting on the magnet.

keyvalues.name: Torque Limit to Break (lbs * distance)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of torque necessary to break a stuck object off the magnet. A way of calculating this is to multiply any reference mass by the resting distance (from the center of mass of the object) needed to break the constraint.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

keyvalues.name: Override parameters
keyvalues.desc: A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Attached Objects
keyvalues.desc: The maximum number of physics objects that can be stuck to the magnet at once. 0 = no limit.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the magnet on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: The the magnet off. This will detach anything current stuck to the magnet.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the magnet on or off.

outputs.name: OnAttach
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity is grabbed by the magnet.

outputs.name: OnDetach
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity is released by the magnet.

desc: A constraint that fixes the position of two entities, relative to this constraint's origin. Also allows for limits on the rotation around each axis, in the space of this constraint.

keyvalues.name: X axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: X axis max limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Y axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Y axis max limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Z axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Z axis max limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

desc: A constraint that is essentially two length constraints and two points. Imagine it as a virtual rope connected to two objects, each suspended from a pulley above them. The constraint keeps the sum of the distances between the pulley points and their suspended objects constant.

keyvalues.name: Additional Length
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the pulley rope.

keyvalues.name: Pulley Gear Ratio
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the pulley rope.

keyvalues.name: Pulley Position 2
keyvalues.desc: The position of the pulley for Entity 2. The pulley for Entity 1 is the origin of this constraint entity. Entity 1 is always suspended from pulley point 1, and Entity 2 is always suspended from pulley point 2.

desc: An entity used to control the 3D Skybox. Its origin is used to determine the 3D Skybox's position relative to the map. Place this entity, in the 3D Skybox, at the point where the origin of the map should be.

keyvalues.name: Parent
keyvalues.desc: The name of the entity to move with. NOTE: sky_camera's position is normally only updated on spawn. Fire the ForceUpdate or StartUpdating inputs to update the sky_camera's position! You might also want to enable Use Angles for Sky.

keyvalues.name: Sky Color
keyvalues.desc: Causes the skybox to use a solid color instead of the sky texture specified in worldspawn. Blended alpha is unfortunately not supported, but an alpha of '0' disables the effect and any alpha greater than that (e.g. 255) enables the effect.

keyvalues.name: 3D Skybox scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the skybox.

keyvalues.name: Use Angles for Sky
keyvalues.desc: Uses angles for actual skybox rotation, as if the world were tilted on this entity's axis.

keyvalues.name: Fog Start
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the skybox fog should start.

keyvalues.name: Fog End
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the skybox fog should be fully opaque.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply fog color by when running in HDR mode.

inputs.name: ForceUpdate
inputs.desc: Forces the 3D skybox to update with this sky_camera's position.

inputs.name: StartUpdating
inputs.desc: Begins per-tick skybox updating, which is needed if you want this sky_camera to move.

inputs.name: StopUpdating
inputs.desc: Ends per-tick skybox updating if it was enabled before.

inputs.name: ActivateSkybox
inputs.desc: Make this skybox the active one.

inputs.name: DeactivateSkybox
inputs.desc: Stops making this sky_camera the active skybox if it is currently the active skybox, which causes the sky to clear.

inputs.name: SetFogStartDist
inputs.desc: Sets the fog start distance.

inputs.name: SetFogEndDist
inputs.desc: Sets the fog end distance.

inputs.name: TurnOnFog
inputs.desc: Turns the fog on.

inputs.name: TurnOffFog
inputs.desc: Turns the fog off.

inputs.name: SetFogColor
inputs.desc: Sets the primary fog color.

inputs.name: SetFogColorSecondary
inputs.desc: Sets the secondary fog color.

inputs.name: SetFarZ
inputs.desc: Sets the far clip plane distance.

inputs.name: SetFogMaxDensity
inputs.desc: 0 to 1, set the fog's max density

inputs.name: SetSkyColor
inputs.desc: Sets the sky color.

desc: Keyframed Move Behavior

A node entity that marks a point in a rope. Traditionally, one move_rope is used to start the chain and then is followed by one or more keyframe_rope entities. However they are freely interchangeable.
Track Move Behavior
Universal ambient sound. Use it to play and control a single sound.

keyvalues.name: Sound Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the GameSound entry for the sound to play. Also supports direct .wav filenames.

keyvalues.name: Volume
keyvalues.desc: Sound volume, expressed as a range from 0 to 10, where 10 is the loudest.

keyvalues.name: Sound Range
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which this sound is audible. Overridden by soundscripts.

keyvalues.name: Pitch
keyvalues.desc: Sound pitch, expressed as a range from 1(low) to 255(high), where 100 is the sound's default pitch. Overridden by soundscripts.

keyvalues.name: Source Entity
keyvalues.desc: If an entity is specified, sound will come from this named entity instead of the location of ambient_generic.

keyvalues.name: Sound Flags
keyvalues.desc: Additional options for your sound.

keyvalues.name: Dynamic Presets
keyvalues.desc: If used, overrides many of the below properties (+pitch) to preset values.

keyvalues.name: Transition Volume
keyvalues.desc: The Volume to start/end with. Use with Fade In and Out times.

keyvalues.name: Volume Transition Time - Start (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for the sound to transition from the Transition Volume to the set volume as it starts playing.

keyvalues.name: Volume Transition Time - Stop (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for the sound to transition from the set volume to the Transition Volume as it stops playing.

keyvalues.name: Transition Pitch
keyvalues.desc: Pitch to start with/end. Use with Spin Up and Spin Down.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Transition Time - Start (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The time taken to change from the Transition Pitch to the final Pitch while the sound starts playing. Simulates the noise powering-up when an object is activated.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Transition Time - Stop (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The time taken to transition from the Pitch to the Transition pitch while the sound stops playing. Simulates the noise fading out as the object shuts down.

keyvalues.name: LFO type
keyvalues.desc: The kind of Low Frequency Oscillation to apply to the sound. Allows subtle modification to the sound. Square waves instantly switch between the high and low values, whereas Triangle Waves gradually switch between the two.

keyvalues.name: LFO rate (0-1000)
keyvalues.desc: How often the Low Frequency Oscillation repeats itself.

keyvalues.name: LFO Effect On Pitch (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The amount the Low Frequency Oscillation affects the pitch.

keyvalues.name: LFO Effect On Volume (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The amount the Low Frequency Oscillation affects the volume.

keyvalues.name: Incremental Spinup Count
keyvalues.desc: Appears non-functional.

inputs.name: Pitch
inputs.desc: Sets the sound pitch, expressed as a range from 1 to 255, where 100 is the sound's default pitch.

inputs.name: PlaySound
inputs.desc: Starts the sound or restart from beginning (if looped).

inputs.name: StopSound
inputs.desc: Stops the sound if it is playing. Only works properly if the looped flag is checked.

inputs.name: ToggleSound
inputs.desc: Toggles the sound between playing and stopping.

inputs.name: Volume
inputs.desc: Sets the sound volume, expressed as a range from 0 to 10, where 10 is the loudest.

inputs.name: FadeIn
inputs.desc: Fades the sound up to full volume over a specified number of seconds, with a range from 0 to 100 seconds.

inputs.name: FadeOut
inputs.desc: Fades the sound to silence over a specified number of seconds, with a range from 0 to 100 seconds. Sound is forced to full volume first!

inputs.name: SetSound
inputs.desc: Sets the sound this ambient_generic should play.

outputs.name: OnSoundFinished
outputs.desc: Fires when the sound finishes playing. NOTE: This sound should be set to pause when the game is paused.

desc: Commentary-specific version of logic_auto.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryNewGame
outputs.desc: Fired when a new game is started with commentary enabled.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryMidGame
outputs.desc: Fired when commentary is enabled in the middle of a map.

desc: An entity to control the color correction in the map.

keyvalues.name: Lookup Falloff Start Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance to the start of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere)

keyvalues.name: Lookup Falloff End Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance to the end of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere)

keyvalues.name: Maximum Weight
keyvalues.desc: This is the maximum weight for this lookup

keyvalues.name: Lookup Table Filename
keyvalues.desc: This is the lookup table filename

keyvalues.name: Lookup Fade In Duration
keyvalues.desc: Duration of fade in on when enabled.

keyvalues.name: Lookup Fade out Duration
keyvalues.desc: Dration of fade out on when disabled.

keyvalues.name: Exlusive
keyvalues.desc: An exclusive color_correction entity disables and fades out all other color corrections when it is enabled. There should only be one active exclusive color_correction ent at any time.

inputs.name: SetFadeInDuration
inputs.desc: Sets the 'fadeInDuration' variable, used to fade cc lookup usage when entity is enabled.

inputs.name: SetFadeOutDuration
inputs.desc: Sets the 'fadeOutDuration' variable, used to fade cc lookup usage when entity is disabled.

desc: Changes the target keyvalue of an entity.

keyvalues.name: Target entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of entity whose target will be changed.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Changes the entities target

desc: An entity that remaps a range of input values to a given range of output values.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values below this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values above this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Output Value When Input Is Min.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Minimum Valid Input Value', this is the output value.

keyvalues.name: Output Value When Input Is Max.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Maximum Valid Input Value', this is the output value.

inputs.name: InValue
inputs.desc: Input a value and fire the output with the remapped value.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the InValue input is received, with the remapped input value as the parameter.

desc: A math_counter variant that specializes in bitwise operations.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: The bits this entity should start with.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Adds bit(s) to this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtracts bit(s) to this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: ShiftLeft
inputs.desc: Shifts this entity's value to the left by the specified number and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: ShiftRight
inputs.desc: Shifts this entity's value to the right by the specified number and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Changes this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Changes this entity's value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes this entity to fire its OnGetValue output with its current bits. Used for polling the current bits when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: ContainsBits
inputs.desc: Tests whether this entity's current value contains at least one of the specified bit(s).

inputs.name: ContainsAllBits
inputs.desc: Tests whether this entity's current value contains all of the specified bit(s).

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the current bits when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired by ContainsBits when the current value contains the specified bit.

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired by ContainsBits when the current value does not contain the specified bit.

desc: Clamps a value between two values. Supports integers, floats, and vectors.

keyvalues.name: Max
keyvalues.desc: The maximum value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

keyvalues.name: Min
keyvalues.desc: The minimum value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: ClampValue
inputs.desc: Clamps the specified value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: SetMax
inputs.desc: Sets the max value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: SetMin
inputs.desc: Sets the max value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Outputs the clamped value.

outputs.name: OnBeforeMin
outputs.desc: Fires when a clamped value was before the minimum value. Outputs the clamped value.

outputs.name: OnBeyondMax
outputs.desc: Fires when a clamped value was beyond the maximum value. Outputs the clamped value.

desc: Used to create a blend between two colors for controlling the color of another entity.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values below this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values above this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Output RGB color when input is min.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Minimum Valid Input Value', this is the output RGB color.

keyvalues.name: Output RGB color when input is max.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Maximum Valid Input Value', this is the output RGB color.

inputs.name: InValue
inputs.desc: Input a value and fire the output with the remapped value.

outputs.name: OutColor
outputs.desc: Fired when the InValue input is received, with the remapped RGB color as the parameter.

desc: Holds a numeric value and performs arithmetic operations upon it. If either the minimum or maximum legal value is nonzero, OutValue will be clamped to the legal range, and the OnHitMin/OnHitMax outputs will be fired at the appropriate times. If both min and max are set to zero, no clamping is performed and only the OutValue output will be fired.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: Starting value for the counter.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Minimum legal value for the counter. If min=0 and max=0, no clamping is performed.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Maximum legal value for the counter. If min=0 and max=0, no clamping is performed.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Add an amount to the counter and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Divide
inputs.desc: Divide the counter by an amount and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Multiply
inputs.desc: Multiply the counter by an amount and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the counter to a new value and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the counter to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtract an amount from the counter and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetHitMax
inputs.desc: Set the upper bound of the counter and fire the OutValue output with the current value.

inputs.name: SetHitMin
inputs.desc: Set the lower bound of the counter and fire the OutValue output with the current value.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes the counter fire its OnGetValue output with the current value of the counter. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: SetMaxValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the upper bound of the counter without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: SetMinValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the lower bound of the counter without firing any outputs.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes.

outputs.name: OnHitMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value meets or goes below the min value. The counter must go back above the min value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnHitMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value meets or exceeds the max value. The counter must go below the max value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes from the minimum value.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes from the max value.

desc: A math_counter variant that specializes in vector operations.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: The vector this entity shuold start with.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Adds a vector to this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Divide
inputs.desc: Divides a vector from this entity's current value and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Multiply
inputs.desc: Multiplies a vector from this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current vector to a new value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current vector to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtracts a vector from this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes this entity to fire its OnGetValue output with its current vector. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: PointAtLocation
inputs.desc: Creates an angle pointing from the entity's current vector to the specified point and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: PointAtEntity
inputs.desc: Creates an angle pointing from the entity's current vector to the specified entity and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: VectorAngles
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector to an angle, assuming the current vector is a direction vector. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorForward
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the forward direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorRight
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the right direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorUp
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the up direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Normalize
inputs.desc: Normalizes this entity's vector and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: NormalizeAngles
inputs.desc: Normalizes this entity's vector as angles and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetX
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: SetY
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: SetZ
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: GetX
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: GetY
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: GetZ
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: AddX
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: AddY
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: AddZ
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractX
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractY
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractZ
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's Z coordinate.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes.

outputs.name: OutX
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting X coordinate.

outputs.name: OutY
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting Y coordinate.

outputs.name: OutZ
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting Z coordinate.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling this entity's current value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnGetX
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetX input.

outputs.name: OnGetY
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetY input.

outputs.name: OnGetZ
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetZ input.

desc: Continuously generates numbers using various generation modes based on material proxies.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: Starting value for the math_generate.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Minimum legal value for generation.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Maximum legal value for generation.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 1
keyvalues.desc: Multi-purpose parameter #1 for the generation algorithms to use for their own needs.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 2
keyvalues.desc: Multi-purpose parameter #2 for the generation algorithms to use for their own needs.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets the math_generate to a new value and fires the OutValue output with the result, performing all generation from that value.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets the math_generate to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes the math_generate to fire its OnGetValue output with the current value. Used for polling the value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: SetGenerateType
inputs.desc: Sets the type of generation this math_generate should perform.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles whether this entity is disabled.

inputs.name: SetHitMin
inputs.desc: Set minimum legal value for generation

inputs.name: SetHitMax
inputs.desc: Set maximum legal value for generation

inputs.name: SetParam1
inputs.desc: Set the value for parameter one

inputs.name: SetParam2
inputs.desc: Set the value for parameter two

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fires each tick while generation is active, passing the value continuously generated by the math_generate.

outputs.name: OnHitMin
outputs.desc: Fired when generation meets the min value. Generation must go back above the min value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnHitMax
outputs.desc: Fired when generation meets the max value. Generation must go below the max value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the current generation value changes from the minimum value.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the current generation value changes from the maximum value.

desc:
A logic entity that attempts to replicate light patterns that can be used on named lights.

WARNING: This is currently out of sync with default light patterns. TODO: Fix that!

keyvalues.name: Appearance
keyvalues.desc: Which preset pattern to use.

keyvalues.name: Custom Appearance
