keyvalues.desc: A custom pattern to use. a = fully dark, z = fully bright. This should always contain lowercase letters for light patterns. Uppercase letters or other types of characters won't work with actual light patterns. (although they shouldn't break the whole entity either)

keyvalues.name: Pattern Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed of the pattern.

inputs.name: SetStyle
inputs.desc: Sets the pattern from the style presets.

inputs.name: SetPattern
inputs.desc: Sets the pattern directly.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles this entity.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Outputs with a brightness equivalent to the current letter.

outputs.name: OutLetter
outputs.desc: Outputs with the current letter itself.

outputs.name: OnLightOn
outputs.desc: Fires when the current letter is equivalent to 'on' (greater than a).

outputs.name: OnLightOff
outputs.desc: Fires when the current letter is equivalent to 'off' (equal to a).

desc: A special version of math_counter with the ability to perform advanced calculations. Otherwise functions identically to math_counter.

keyvalues.name: Preserve Value?
keyvalues.desc: If set to 'Yes', calculations will fire OutValue with the resulting value, but the actual value stored in this entity will stay the same, allowing future calculations to use a constant value. If you want to change the value, you must use SetValueNoFire to set the counter's value or the PreserveValue input to toggle this feature. This also disables min/max functionality.

keyvalues.name: Always Output As Int
keyvalues.desc: If set to 'Yes', the stored value (and OutValue) will always be rounded to an integer before firing.

keyvalues.name: Lerp Percent
keyvalues.desc: The percentage used by the LerpTo input.

inputs.name: PreserveValue
inputs.desc: Sets whether this counter's value should be preserved after calculations. 1 = Yes, 0 = No

inputs.name: AlwaysOutputAsInt
inputs.desc: Sets whether this counter's value should always output as an integer. 1 = Yes, 0 = No

inputs.name: SetValueToPi
inputs.desc: Sets the counter's value to 3.14159265358979323846 and fires the OutValue output with it.

inputs.name: SquareRoot
inputs.desc: Calculates the square root of the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Power
inputs.desc: Raises the power of the counter's current value to this value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Round
inputs.desc: Rounds the counter's current value to the specified number place. For example, rounding 256 to 100 will round it to 300 and rounding 256 to 10 will round it to 260. Use 0 to round decimals to integers. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Floor
inputs.desc: Floors, or rounds down, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Ceil
inputs.desc: Ceils, or rounds up, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Trunc
inputs.desc: Truncates, or rounds toward zero, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Sin
inputs.desc: Applies sine to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Cos
inputs.desc: Applies cosine to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Tan
inputs.desc: Applies tangent to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: RandomInt
inputs.desc: Generates a random integer between the specified bounds. Format = 'lowerbound upperbound', like '22 65'. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: RandomFloat
inputs.desc: Generates a random float between the specified bounds. Format = 'lowerbound upperbound', like '22.5 48.721'. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: LerpTo
inputs.desc: Lerps this counter's value to the specified value based on the lerp percent.

inputs.name: SetLerpPercent
inputs.desc: Sets the lerp percent.

desc: A lightweight entity that performs simple calculations on the fly without needing a complicated I/O chain. This is useful for values that are outputted on a per-frame basis and might not work with a math_counter chain.

keyvalues.name: Mod Value
keyvalues.desc: The value that is applied to input values.

keyvalues.name: Operator
keyvalues.desc: What calculation to perform with the mod value. (input value _ mod value)

inputs.name: SetMod
inputs.desc: Sets the mod value.

inputs.name: ModInt
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified integer.

inputs.name: ModFloat
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified float.

inputs.name: ModVector
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified vector.

inputs.name: SetOperator
inputs.desc: Sets the operator. Use +, -, *, or / to choose addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division respectively.

outputs.name: OutInt
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified integer.

outputs.name: OutFloat
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified float.

outputs.name: OutVector
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified vector.

desc: A VGUI screen. Useful for in-world monitors.

keyvalues.name: Panel Name
keyvalues.desc: The type of display to show.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Material
keyvalues.desc: Name of a material to overlay over the top of the VGUI screen. NOTE: This material must write Z for the VGUI screen to work.

keyvalues.name: Panel Width in World (Green)
keyvalues.desc: Width of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Panel Height in World (Blue)
keyvalues.desc: Height of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Is Transparent?
keyvalues.desc: Set this to true if you would like your background to be invisible instead of a black fill.

inputs.name: SetActive
inputs.desc: Make the vgui screen visible.

inputs.name: SetInactive
inputs.desc: Make the vgui screen invisible.

desc: A VGUI world panel that can be placed and modified by entity logic and display localized text

keyvalues.name: Display Text
keyvalues.desc: The default text to display

keyvalues.name: Display Text Option
keyvalues.desc: Text that will be inserted in the place of a %s1 if you token has one - if you don't know what that is, don't use this

keyvalues.name: Font
keyvalues.desc: The font that will be used (should match an entry in your Scheme.res file)

keyvalues.name: Panel Width in World (Green)
keyvalues.desc: Width of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Panel Height in World (Blue)
keyvalues.desc: Height of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Text Panel Width
keyvalues.desc: Sometimes the text panel needs to be smaller to force a wrap, but keep the same font size.

keyvalues.name: Text Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: The color of the text.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Make text visible.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Make text invisible.

inputs.name: SetDisplayText
inputs.desc: Sets the display text.

inputs.name: SetDisplayTextOption
inputs.desc: Sets the display text option.

desc: Slideshow Display

keyvalues.name: Min Slide Time
keyvalues.desc: Minimum amount of random time that a slide is displayed.

keyvalues.name: Max Slide Time
keyvalues.desc: Maximum amount of random time that a slide is displayed.

keyvalues.name: Panel width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Panel height
keyvalues.desc: Height of the panel in units.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Make slideshow visible.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Make slideshow invisible.

inputs.name: SetDisplayText
inputs.desc: Sets the display text.

inputs.name: RemoveAllSlides
inputs.desc: Removes all slides from slideshow.

inputs.name: AddSlides
inputs.desc: Adds slides by keyword.

inputs.name: SetMinSlideTime
inputs.desc: Sets min random time between slides.

inputs.name: SetMaxSlideTime
inputs.desc: Sets max random time between slides.

inputs.name: SetCycleType
inputs.desc: 0 - random, 1 - forward, 2 - backward

inputs.name: SetNoListRepeat
inputs.desc: Sets if lists can be randomly picked twice in a row.

desc: Movie Display

keyvalues.name: Start enabled
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not the video should start enabled.

keyvalues.name: Start paused
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not the video should start paused.

keyvalues.name: Movie To display
keyvalues.desc: The movie to display.

keyvalues.name: Panel Width in World (Green)
keyvalues.desc: Width of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Panel Height in World (Blue)
keyvalues.desc: Height of the panel in units.

keyvalues.name: Force precache
keyvalues.desc: Precache the movie referred to by Movie Filename on entity spawn.

keyvalues.name: Disable Scanline Overlay
keyvalues.desc: Disables the default scanline overlay.

keyvalues.name: Use Custom UVs
keyvalues.desc: Enables custom uv coordinates to be used.

keyvalues.name: U Min
keyvalues.desc: U Min (Left) Coordinate (0-1). Needs Custom UVs to be enabled!

keyvalues.name: U Max
keyvalues.desc: U Max (Right) Coordinate (0-1). Needs Custom UVs to be enabled!

keyvalues.name: V Min

keyvalues.name: V Max
keyvalues.desc: V Max (Bottom) Coordinate (0-1). Needs Custom UVs to be enabled!

keyvalues.name: Audio Volume
keyvalues.desc: Audio volume to use for video playback. 0-10

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Make movie visible.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Make movie invisible.

inputs.name: Pause
inputs.desc: Pauses the video playback.

inputs.name: Resume
inputs.desc: Resumes the video playback.

inputs.name: SetPaused
inputs.desc: Sets the playback state using the parameter.

inputs.name: SetDisplayText
inputs.desc: Sets the display text.

inputs.name: SetMovie
inputs.desc: Sets the movie to display.

inputs.name: SetUseCustomUVs
inputs.desc: Use custom UVs.

inputs.name: TakeOverAsMaster
inputs.desc: Start using this video as the master of it's group.

inputs.name: SetUMin
inputs.desc: Set the minimum U.

inputs.name: SetUMax
inputs.desc: Set the maximum U.

inputs.name: SetVMin
inputs.desc: Set the minimum V.

inputs.name: SetVMax
inputs.desc: Set the maximum V.

desc: Speeds up or slows down player velocity over time (slow mo/fast forward)

keyvalues.name: Additional Buttons
keyvalues.desc: Additional buttons to suppress, other than those listed in the spawnflags. Advanced users only.

inputs.name: ModifySpeed
inputs.desc: Modifies player speed by X amount.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables the spawnflag abilities without actually modifying the player's speed.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables the spawnflag abilities without actually modifying the player's speed.

inputs.name: SetAdditionalButtons
inputs.desc: Sets the additional suppressed buttons.

desc: Removes weapons from the player.

inputs.name: Strip
inputs.desc: Removes all weapons.

inputs.name: StripWeaponsAndSuit
inputs.desc: Strip player's weapons and suit

desc: A damage filter that filters by the type of damage inflicted. This can only be used as a damage filter, not as an activator filter.

keyvalues.name: Damage Type
keyvalues.desc: The damage type to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only damage types that match will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all damage types EXCEPT those who match will pass the filter.

desc: Filter that checks to see if the local player has beat the given stage of a given world.
A filter that filters a potential enemy entity by a set of criteria.

keyvalues.name: Name/Classname
keyvalues.desc: The classname or entity name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius by which to test the proximity of the enemy.  If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose distance is equal to or closer than the radius will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities outside the radius will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Outer Radius
keyvalues.desc: Enemies outside this radius are considered invalid if Allow is set and valid if Disallow is set.

keyvalues.name: Max Squadmates Per Enemy
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of squadmates allowed to target any given entity.

desc: A filter that filters by the class name of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Classname
keyvalues.desc: The class name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters by the name of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: The name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose name matches the string will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that tests the activator against multiple filters. This allows you to build more complex filters, such as 'Allow anyone on Team 1 who is also class engineer', or 'Allow everyone except classes npc_zombie and npc_headcrab'.

keyvalues.name: Negate Outcome
keyvalues.desc:
Whether to negate the result of the subfilters, after combining them using the Logic Type chosen.
Negating the outcome using the AND logic type means that any subfilter must fail for this filter to pass.
Negating the outcome using the OR logic type means that all subfilters must fail for this filter to pass.

keyvalues.name: Filter 1
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 2
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 3
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 4
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 5
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 6
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 7
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 8
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 9
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 10
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

desc: A filter that tests the activator's surface data.

keyvalues.name: Surface
keyvalues.desc: The surface to test with.

keyvalues.name: Type
keyvalues.desc: What to actually filter by.

desc: Filter a player based on if their track number is the one defined here. -1 defaults to true.
Filter that checks the players' movement state
A filter that filters by the model of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Model
keyvalues.desc: The model to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose model matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose model matches the string will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Use this if you want to filter by skins as well. If you want any skin to be allowed, be sure to leave this at -1! It might automatically change when you choose a model.

desc: A filter that only accepts objects held by the player.
A filter that filters by the activator's keyfields.

keyvalues.name: Key
keyvalues.desc: The key name to filter by. Please note that certain keyvalues, particularly targetnames and base values related to clientside rendering (e.g. render mode), cannot be found by this filter.

keyvalues.name: Value (Optional)
keyvalues.desc: The key value to filter by. If empty, the filter will pass if the entity just has the keyfield.

desc: Filter that checks to see if the player is at or above the given collectible count

keyvalues.name: Minimum req. collectible count
keyvalues.desc: The minimum collectible count that the player needs to be at in order for the filter to accept them.

desc: A filter that filters by the team of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Team Number
keyvalues.desc: The team number to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose team number matches the given team will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose team number matches the given team will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters by the mass of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Mass
keyvalues.desc: The mass to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose mass is greater than the give float will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose mass is greater than the given float will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters by a context on the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Context
keyvalues.desc: The context(s) to filter by. Syntax is 'key:value,key:value'. Values in this field can use wilcards. For example, if this filter contains 'lastname:*', it will pass any entity with the context 'lastname', regardless of its value. Wildcards do not apply to context names and you cannot define the same context multiple times, but inputs like AddContext or RemoveContext can be used to add to the filter context.

keyvalues.name: Pass if entity has any of these contexts
keyvalues.desc: Should this filter only pass if the entity contains all of these contexts or can it pass if the entity has at least one of them?

inputs.name: AddContext
inputs.desc: Adds a context to this fitler's list of response contexts. The format should be 'key:value'.

inputs.name: RemoveContext
inputs.desc: Remove a context from this filter's list of response contexts. The name should match the 'key' of a previously added context.

inputs.name: ClearContext
inputs.desc: Removes all contexts in this filter's list of response contexts.

desc: A filter that tests whether the activator is within a volume.

keyvalues.name: Volume
keyvalues.desc: The volume to be tested with. This filter passes if the activator is within this volume. Intended to be a brush entity. (e.g. a trigger)

keyvalues.name: Volume Tester
keyvalues.desc: Who should be in the volume for the filter to pass?

desc: Base filter, which all other filters are based off of. This filter passes any entity whatsoever.

keyvalues.name: Filter Mode
keyvalues.desc: If set to Allow, only entities who match the criteria will pass the filter. If set to Disallow, only entities who do NOT match the criteria will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Pass caller when tested
keyvalues.desc: When tested with TestActivator or TestEntity, this causes the OnPass and OnFail outputs to use either this filter as the caller or the entity that called the test as the caller.

inputs.name: TestActivator
inputs.desc: Test the activator against the filter and fires OnPass or OnFail output.

inputs.name: TestEntity
inputs.desc: Tests the target entity against the specified entity and fires the OnPass or OnFail output.

inputs.name: SetField
inputs.desc: Sets this filter's primary test criteria. (e.g. the name to test against the activator)

outputs.name: OnPass
outputs.desc: Fired in response to TestActivator input if the activator passes the filter.

outputs.name: OnFail
outputs.desc: Fired in response to TestActivator input if the activator fails to pass the filter.

desc: Filter that checks the player's velocity

keyvalues.name: Dimension
keyvalues.desc: Which component of the entity's velocity to check

keyvalues.name: Match Mode
keyvalues.default: Match when at or above speed (0)
keyvalues.desc: How the entity's speed should be compared to the threshold

keyvalues.name: Check Horizontal Speed Along Yaw Angle
keyvalues.desc: In Specified Yaw Angle mode, compare against the component of the entity's horizontal velocity in this direction.

desc: Fires outputs when a map spawns. If 'Remove on fire' flag is set the logic_auto is deleted after firing. It can be set to check a global state before firing. This allows you to only fire events based on what took place in a previous map.

keyvalues.name: Global State to Read
keyvalues.desc: If set, this specifies a global state to check before firing. The OnMapSpawn output will only fire if the global state is set.

outputs.name: OnMapSpawn
outputs.desc: Fired when the map is loaded for any reason.

outputs.name: OnNewGame
outputs.desc: Fired when the map is loaded to start a new game.

outputs.name: OnMapTransition
outputs.desc: Fired when the map is loaded due to a level transition.

outputs.name: OnBackgroundMap
outputs.desc: Fired when the map is loaded as a background to the main menu.

desc: A message forwarder. Fires up to eight separate outputs, each with a different chance of firing.

keyvalues.name: OnTrigger1 Chance
keyvalues.desc: Chance (from 0 to 1) of the OnTrigger1 output firing when this entity is triggered.

keyvalues.name: OnTrigger2 Chance
keyvalues.desc: Chance (from 0 to 1) of the OnTrigger2 output firing when this entity is triggered.

desc:
Compares an input to up to 16 preset values. If the input value is the same as any of the preset values, an output corresponding to that value is fired.

For example: if Case01 is set to 2 and Case02 is set to 5, and the input value is 5, the OnCase02 output will be fired.

This entity can also be used to select from a number of random targets via the PickRandom input. One of the OnCase outputs that is connected to another entity will be picked at random and fired.

keyvalues.name: Multiple case hits allowed
keyvalues.desc: If an input value matches a given case, are we allowed to test the rest of the cases or should we stop there? Don't worry about this if you're only using this entity for PickRandom.

desc:
A message forwarder. Fires an OnTrigger output when triggered, and can be disabled to prevent forwarding outputs.

Useful as an intermediary between one entity and another for turning on or off an I/O connection, or as a container for holding a set of outputs that can be triggered from multiple places.

inputs.desc: Trigger the relay, causing its OnTrigger output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: TriggerWithParameter
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay with a parameter, causing its OnTriggerParameter output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the relay between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: EnableRefire
inputs.desc: Allow this relay to trigger again quickly, if fast retrigger is disabled. This input allows the relay to fire again early if it is in this state.This is automatically triggered 0.01s after the last OnTrigger output.

outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is spawned. If the relay is set to only trigger once, it will delete itself after firing this output.

desc: A logic entity that could read an entity's response contexts. Use the target and context name keyvalues if you want to store a specific target and/or context. Use the 'Test' input to look for the context on the target. The 'OutValue' output will fire with the context's value if it is found.

keyvalues.desc: The entity with the context to measure.

keyvalues.desc: The name of the context to measure.

inputs.desc: Gets the stored context's value from stored target.

inputs.name: TestContext
inputs.desc: Tests the specified context against the target instead of using the stored context. Does not change the stored context.

inputs.name: TestTarget
inputs.desc: Tests the specified target against the context instead of using the stored target. Does not change the stored target.

inputs.name: SetContext
inputs.desc: Sets the context to measure.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets the stored target's stored context value to the specified string.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fires when a context is found. Passes its value.

outputs.name: OnFailed
outputs.desc: Fires when this entity fails to find the specified context.

desc: Tests a boolean value and fires an output based on whether the value is true or false. Use this entity to branch between two potential sets of events.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the boolean value without performing the comparison. Use this to hold a value for a future test.

inputs.name: SetValueTest

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the boolean value between true and false.

inputs.name: ToggleTest
inputs.desc: Toggle the boolean value and tests it, firing OnTrue or OnFalse based on the new value.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Test the input value and fire OnTrue or OnFalse based on the value.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is true (nonzero).

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is false (zero).

desc: A general logic gate with two inputs. Supports AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, and XNOR operations, which can also be changed through inputs.

inputs.name: GetValue

inputs.name: SetStateA
inputs.desc: Sets the A state.

inputs.name: SetStateB
inputs.desc: Sets the B state.

inputs.name: SetMode
inputs.desc: Sets the mode. 0=AND,1=OR,2=NOT,3=NAND,4=NOR,5=XOR,6=XNOR

outputs.name: OnResultTrue
outputs.desc: Triggered when the state reaches true.

outputs.name: OnResultFalse
outputs.desc: Triggered when the state reaches false.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: When this entity is triggered by GetValue, this output will be called with the current state as the parameter

desc: Compares an input value to another value. If the input value is less than the compare value, the OnLessThan output is fired with the input value. If the input value is equal to the compare value, the OnEqualTo output is fired with the input value. If the input value is greater than the compare value, the OnGreaterThan output is fired with the input value.

keyvalues.name: Initial value
keyvalues.desc: Initial value for the input value.

keyvalues.name: Compare value
keyvalues.desc: The value to compare against.

keyvalues.name: Use string length
keyvalues.desc: Use the length of the string in the compare value rather than its actual value.

inputs.name: Compare
inputs.desc: Force a compare of the input value with the compare value.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the value that will be compared against the compare value.

inputs.name: SetValueCompare
inputs.desc: Set the value that will be compared against the compare value and performs the comparison.

inputs.name: SetCompareValue
inputs.desc: Set the compare value.

inputs.name: SetCompareValueCompare
inputs.desc: Sets the compare value and performs the comparison.

outputs.name: OnLessThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is less than the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnNotEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is different from the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than or equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnLessThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than or equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

inputs.desc: Sets the target entity.

outputs.desc: Fires when a field is found. Passes its value.

desc:
A special variant of logic_relay designed to queue trigger inputs. If the relay is still handling its I/O connections after being triggered, additional Trigger inputs will be queued and automatically fire when the relay is able to be re-fired. Activator, output ID, and parameter are all kept and saved. Inputs are added to the queue each time Trigger or TriggerWithParameter are received while the relay is disabled or still handling its current I/O connections. The first one in the queue will trigger the moment an opportunity becomes available and the next one in the queue will wait for that one.

This is useful for when you don't want something to happen multiple times at once, but don't want to discard further requests either.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Items
keyvalues.desc: The maximum number of Trigger and TriggerWithParameter inputs allowed in the queue. Any others received while this value is full will be discarded. Keep in mind this does not count the I/O chain currently being handled.

keyvalues.name: Don't queue when disabled
keyvalues.desc: Prevents the relay from queuing inputs when disabled. This means inputs will only be queued when enabled and still handling its current I/O connections.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay, causing its OnTrigger output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: TriggerWithParameter
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay with a parameter, causing its OnTriggerParameter output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the relay between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: EnableRefire
inputs.desc: If fast retrigger is disabled, the relay will not be able to fire again until its most delayed output has been fired. This input allows the relay to fire again early if it is in this state.This is automatically triggered 0.01s after the last OnTrigger output.

inputs.name: ClearQueue
inputs.desc: Clears the input queue.

inputs.name: SetMaxQueueItems
inputs.desc: Sets the maximum queue items.

outputs.name: OnTrigger
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered.

outputs.name: OnTriggerParameter
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered with a parameter.

desc: An entity that can measure the direction of an entity relative to another entity and apply that movement to a third entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Measure
keyvalues.desc: Entity whose direction you want to measure.

keyvalues.name: Measure Reference
keyvalues.desc: The direction of Entity to Measure will be measured from this entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Move
keyvalues.desc: This entity will be moved in the direction of the Entity to Measure.

keyvalues.name: Movement Reference
keyvalues.desc: The Entity to Move will move relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Trace scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale to *divide* the distance between the Entity to Measure and the trace's endpoint by before applying those movements to the Entity to Move. 1 = target entity moves to the end of the trace, 2 = target entity moves to the middle of the trace (half as far), and 0.5 = target entity moves twice as far as the trace.

keyvalues.name: Measurement Type
keyvalues.desc: How should the direction be measured?

keyvalues.name: Trace distance
keyvalues.desc: The maximum distance that the trace can go. 0 = no limit.

keyvalues.name: Trace Mask
keyvalues.default: MASK_SHOT (Anything that would be hit by a bullet) (1174421507)
keyvalues.desc: How the measurement tracing should act in regards to what it should collide with.

keyvalues.name: Collision Group
keyvalues.desc: The collision group the measurement tracing should use.

keyvalues.name: Trace Filter
keyvalues.desc: A filter to use for tracing.

keyvalues.name: Trace Filter behavior
keyvalues.desc: What the filter should actually be used for.

keyvalues.name: Additional trace from movement reference
keyvalues.desc: Initiates another trace from the Movement Reference using the existing properties and adjusts the position to its end point. Only use this if the Movement Reference is different from the Measure Reference.

inputs.name: SetMeasureTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Measure, whose movement should be measured.

inputs.name: SetMeasureReference
inputs.desc: Set the Measure Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Move, which will be moved to mimic the measured entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetReference
inputs.desc: Set the Movement Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetScale
inputs.desc: Set the scale to divide the measured movements by.

inputs.name: SetMeasureType
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement type.

inputs.name: SetMeasureAttachment
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement attachment.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the logic_measure_direction.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the logic_measure_direction.

inputs.name: SetTraceFilter
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as the trace filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the trace filter.

desc: An entity that fires a timer event at regular, or random, intervals. It can also be set to oscillate between a high and low end, in which case it will fire alternating high/low outputs each time it fires.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Random Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' is set, this is the minimum time between timer fires. The time will be a random number between this and the 'Maximum Random Interval'.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Random Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' is set, this is the maximum time between timer fires. The time will be a random number between the 'Minimum Random Interval' and this.

keyvalues.name: Refire Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' isn't set, this is the time between timer fires, in seconds.

inputs.name: RefireTime
inputs.desc: Set a new Refire Interval.

inputs.name: ResetTimer
inputs.desc: Reset the timer. It will fire after the Refire Interval expires.

inputs.name: FireTimer
inputs.desc: Force the timer to fire immediately.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the timer.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the timer.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the timer on/off.

inputs.name: LowerRandomBound
inputs.desc: Set a new Minimum Random Interval.

inputs.name: UpperRandomBound
inputs.desc: Set a new Maximum Random Interval.

inputs.name: AddToTimer
inputs.desc: Add time to the timer if it is currently enabled.  Does not change the Refire Interval.

inputs.name: SubtractFromTimer
inputs.desc: Subtract time from the timer if it is currently enabled.  Does not change the Refire Interval.

inputs.name: UseRandomTime
inputs.desc: 0 or 1, whether random time is enabled. If random time starts enabled and gets disabled here, the refire interval is set to the Maximum Random Interval.

outputs.name: OnTimer
outputs.desc: Fired when the timer expires.

outputs.name: OnTimerHigh
outputs.desc: Fired every other time for an oscillating timer.

outputs.name: OnTimerLow
outputs.desc: Fired every other time for an oscillating timer.

desc: An entity that can measure the movement of an entity relative to another entity and apply that movement to a third entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Measure
keyvalues.desc: Entity whose movement you want to measure.

keyvalues.name: Measure Reference
keyvalues.desc: The movement of Entity to Measure will be measured relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Move
keyvalues.desc: This entity will be moved to mimic the motions of Entity to Measure.

keyvalues.name: Movement Reference
keyvalues.desc: The Entity to Move will move relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Movement scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale to divide the measured movements by, before applying those movements to the Entity to Move. 1 = target entity moves as much as the measured entity, 2 = target entity moves half as far as the measured entity, and 0.5 = target entity moves twice as far as the measured entity.

keyvalues.name: Fire position outputs
keyvalues.desc: Allows OutPosition and OutAngles to be fired with the resulting position while this entity is active. Does not apply to the GetPosition input.

keyvalues.name: Measurement Attachment
keyvalues.desc: Only useful for the ''Attachment point'' measurement type. This attachment should be on the Entity to Measure and measurements will correspond to its position and angles.

inputs.name: SetMeasureTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Measure, whose movement should be measured.

inputs.name: SetMeasureReference
inputs.desc: Set the Measure Reference entity.

inputs.name: Target
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Move, which will be moved to mimic the measured entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetReference
inputs.desc: Set the Movement Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetScale
inputs.desc: Set the scale to divide the measured movements by.

inputs.name: SetMeasureType
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement type.

inputs.name: SetMeasureAttachment
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement attachment.

inputs.name: ShouldOutputPosition
inputs.desc: Sets whether we are allowed to fire position outputs while this entity is active.

inputs.name: GetPosition
inputs.desc:
Initiates a single measurement with the current settings, only firing OutPosition and OutAngles without moving anything. (it doesn't need a target to be available)
This input ignores the 'Fire position outputs' keyvalue and instead repurposes it to modify who the outputs' activator should be.
If 'Fire position outputs' is enabled, the target will be used as the activator if it is available.
If 'Fire position outputs' is disabled, the activator that fired GetPosition will be used instead.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the logic_measure_movement.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the logic_measure_movement.

outputs.name: OutPosition
outputs.desc: Outputs the resulting position when allowed.

outputs.name: OutAngles
outputs.desc: Outputs the resulting angles when allowed.

desc:
Coordinates a sequence out of up to 16 preset values. If the input value matches the sequence's current case value, an output is fired and (by default) the sequence increments to the next case.

This is intended for things like passwords in keypads, which usually demand a specific combination of numbers.

keyvalues.name: Initial Case
keyvalues.desc: Which case to start on, meaning inputs will initially compare with this case. Uses the case's index. (e.g. 4 for Case 04)

keyvalues.name: Start Disabled
keyvalues.desc: If this entity is disabled, it will not accept any case tests. It will still accept other inputs, like SetSequenceIndex.

keyvalues.name: Suppress auto increment
keyvalues.desc: Prevents automatically incrementing the sequence each time a case passes.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles whether this entity is disabled.

inputs.name: InValue
inputs.desc: Tests the input value against the current case.

inputs.name: SetCurrentCase
inputs.desc: Sets the sequence's current case. This will fire OutCurCase.

inputs.name: SetCurrentCaseNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets the sequence's current case without firing OutCurCase.

inputs.name: IncrementSequence
inputs.desc: Increments the current case by the specified number. (1 if blank)

inputs.name: ResetSequence
inputs.desc: Resets the sequence to Case 01.

outputs.name: OutCurCase
outputs.desc: Fires each time the sequence's current case value changes, e.g. when it's incremented by a passing case.

outputs.name: OnCasePass
outputs.desc: Fires when a case is matched, passing the input value.

outputs.name: OnCaseFail
outputs.desc: Fires when a case fails, passing the input value.

outputs.name: OnSequenceComplete
outputs.desc: Fires when the last case is matched and sequence is complete.

desc: Plays a movie and allows for various playback options

keyvalues.name: Movie to display
keyvalues.desc: The movie to display from the media/ folder. The BIK file extension must be included.

keyvalues.name: Allow User to Skip
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not the user may skip the video with common keys

keyvalues.name: Loop Video
keyvalues.desc: If set to true, the movie will loop forever

keyvalues.name: Fade In Time
keyvalues.desc: Time it takes for the video to fade in

inputs.name: PlayMovie
inputs.desc: Play the movie.

inputs.name: PlayLevelTransitionMovie
inputs.desc: Plays a movie with specific settings used for level transitions.  Pass the name of the movie in the parameters.  To be fired at the end of a level.

inputs.name: FadeAllMovies
inputs.desc: Fade movies out for all players connected.

outputs.name: OnPlaybackFinished
outputs.desc: Fired when the movie has completed playing back or was skipped by the user.

desc: A powerful entity that can read the specified ConVar's value. It functions similarly to a logic_branch, except you could also output the value directly. Due to theoretical abuse, players have the option to disable logic_ConVar usage on a map. Use the 'OnDenied' output to prevent any issues from players who have disabled logic_ConVar.

keyvalues.name: ConVar
keyvalues.desc: The ConVar to read. Can be serverside or clientside(?)

keyvalues.name: Compare value
keyvalues.desc: The value to compare with the ConVar's value during comparisons. You could use <, !=, etc. at the beginning similar to a Response System criterion.

inputs.name: SetConVar
inputs.desc: Sets the ConVar whose variable will be retrieved.

inputs.name: SetTestValue
inputs.desc: Sets the value that will be compared with the ConVar variable during comparisons.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Retrieves the ConVar's value, firing OutValue with its value.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Compares the ConVar's value with the compare value.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired when a comparison is true.

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired when a comparison is false.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired with the GetValue input. Passes the ConVar's current value.

outputs.name: OnDenied
outputs.desc: Fires when the ConVar is requested and logic_convar is not allowed by the server.

desc: Gets and outputs some model information from an entity.

keyvalues.name: Target
keyvalues.desc: The entity whose model will be evaluated.

keyvalues.name: Pose Parameter Name
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) The pose parameter to use for pose parameter-related I/O.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's target.

inputs.name: GetNumSkins
inputs.desc: Gets the number of skins on the target entity.

inputs.name: LookupSequence
inputs.desc: Looks up the specified sequence on the target entity.

inputs.name: LookupActivity
inputs.desc: Looks up the specified activity on the target entity. Uses the sequence outputs and outputs the first sequence with the given activity.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterName
inputs.desc: Sets the pose parameter to target.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterValue
inputs.desc: Sets the target pose parameter's current value.

inputs.name: GetPoseParameter
inputs.desc: Gets the current value of the target pose parameter and fires OutPoseParameterValue with it.

outputs.name: OutNumSkins
outputs.desc: Outputs number of skins.

outputs.name: OnHasSequence
outputs.desc: Fires when the target has the sequence requested. Outputs the sequence's index.

outputs.name: OnLacksSequence
outputs.desc: Fires when the target does not have the sequence requested.

outputs.name: OutPoseParameterValue
outputs.desc: Fires when the pose parameter value is requested, outputting its current value.

desc: Compares a set of inputs to each other. If they are all the same, fires an OnEqual output. If any are different, fires the OnNotEqual output. It is not possible to clear the memory, so this only works once.

keyvalues.name: Integer Value (optional)
keyvalues.desc: The value all inputs are compared to if ''Should use Reference Value'' is enabled.

keyvalues.name: Should use Integer Value
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, all inputs are compared to the reference value. If not enabled, they are instead compared to the last input added.

keyvalues.name: Use string length
keyvalues.desc: Use the length of the string in the compare value rather than its actual value.

inputs.name: InputValue
inputs.desc: Adds a value to our set of inputs and fires CompareValues automatically, comparing existing inputs to this one if set to do so.

inputs.name: CompareValues
inputs.desc: Compares the values and fires appropriate outputs.

outputs.name: OnEqual
outputs.desc: Fires if all of the values are equal.

outputs.name: OnNotEqual
outputs.desc: Fires if any of the values are not equal.

desc:
Formats a line of text akin to C# String.Format.
As curly brackets cannot be used in the help window, please see Mapbase documentation for clear instructions.

keyvalues.name: Input Value
keyvalues.desc: The input value. Should contain {0}, {1}, etc, which will be replaced by the parameters and then output as OutFormattedValue.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 0
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {0} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 1
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {1} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 2
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {2} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 3
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {3} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 4
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {4} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 5
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {5} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 6
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {6} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 7
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {7} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Backup Parameter
keyvalues.desc: If an invalid parameter is used (e.g. null parameter or asks for a parameter beyond {7}), then this will be used instead. Otherwise just uses '<null>'.

inputs.name: GetFormattedValue
inputs.desc: Fires OutFormattedValue, which passes the formatted input value.

inputs.name: SetInputValue
inputs.desc: Sets the input value. Should contain {0}, {1}, etc. enclosed by curly brackets, which will be replaced by the parameters and then output as OutFormattedValue.

inputs.name: SetParameter0
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {0}.

inputs.name: SetParameter1
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {1}.

inputs.name: SetParameter2
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {2}.

inputs.name: SetParameter3
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {3}.

inputs.name: SetParameter4
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {4}.

inputs.name: SetParameter5
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {5}.

inputs.name: SetParameter6
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {6}.

inputs.name: SetParameter7
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {7}.

inputs.name: SetBackupParameter
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all invalid parameters.

outputs.name: OutFormattedValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the formatted value is requested. Outputs the formatted value.

desc:
Contains a list of logic_branch entities and fires outputs when the state of any of the logic_branches changes.

This entity is used to fire an event when a set of conditions are all satisfied.

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 01

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 02
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 07
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 08
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 09
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 10
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

keyvalues.name: Logic Branch 11
keyvalues.desc: The name of one or more logic_branches (wildcards allowed).

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Tests the state of all the logic_branches in the list and fires the appropriate output.

outputs.name: OnAllTrue
outputs.desc: Fired when all the logic_branches in the list become true.

outputs.name: OnAllFalse
outputs.desc: Fired when all the logic_branches in the list become false.

outputs.name: OnMixed
outputs.desc: Fired when one of the logic branches in the list changes, but some are true and some are false.

desc: Manages two sets of values and can fire outputs based on the state of those values. Useful in coop where you can have players independently setting states on buttons, switches, etc.

keyvalues.name: Default State A
keyvalues.desc: The default state of A

keyvalues.name: Default State B
keyvalues.desc: The default state of B

inputs.name: SetStateATrue
inputs.desc: Set A to TRUE

inputs.name: SetStateBTrue
inputs.desc: Set B to TRUE

inputs.name: SetStateAFalse
inputs.desc: Set A to FALSE

inputs.name: SetStateBFalse
inputs.desc: Set B to FALSE

inputs.name: ToggleStateA
inputs.desc: Toggle A

inputs.name: ToggleStateB
inputs.desc: Toggle B

outputs.name: OnChangeToAllTrue
outputs.desc: Fires when ALL of the values change to TRUE for the first time.

outputs.name: OnChangeToAnyTrue
outputs.desc: Fires when ANY of the values change to TRUE for the first time.

outputs.name: OnChangeToAllFalse
outputs.desc: Fires when ALL of the values change to FALSE for the first time.

outputs.name: OnChangeToAnyFalse
outputs.desc: Fires when ANY of the values change to FALSE for the first time.

desc: An entity that is used to relay inputs/outputs to the player and back to the world.

inputs.name: SetFallDamageEnabled
inputs.desc: Whether or not fall damage is enabled

outputs.name: PlayerDied
outputs.desc: Fires when the player dies.

outputs.name: OnStartSlowingTime
outputs.desc: Fired when a Portal player initiates slow time.

outputs.name: OnStopSlowingTime
outputs.desc: Fired when a Portal player stops slowing time.

outputs.name: OnDuck
outputs.desc: Fired when a player starts to duck.

outputs.name: OnUnDuck
outputs.desc: Fired when a player releases the duck button.

outputs.name: OnJump
outputs.desc: Fired when a player jumps.

desc: An entity to control the number of gibs in the world, for performance reasons.

keyvalues.name: Max Gib Count
keyvalues.desc: Sets the max number of gib that can be spawned at a time. (-1=no limit)

keyvalues.name: Allow New Gibs To Spawn
keyvalues.desc: If true, when the max gib count is reached, oldest gibs are removed as new gibs spawn. If false, new gibs will not be spawned once the gib limit is reached.

inputs.name: SetMaxPieces
inputs.desc: Set the max gib count.

desc: An entity used to override player input when the player is looking at it.

keyvalues.name: FieldOfView
keyvalues.desc: The amount of tolerance in the view checking when determining whether the player's input is still under control. 1.0 = straight ahead, 0.0 = +/- 90 degrees, -1.0 = all directions. If the player isn't within the tolerance, the player regains control.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Return Player Control.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Take Player Control.

outputs.name: PlayerOn
outputs.desc: Fired whenever this entity starts controlling the player's input.

outputs.name: PlayerOff
outputs.desc: Fired whenever this entity stops controlling the player's input.

outputs.name: PressedMoveLeft
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the moveleft key.

outputs.name: PressedMoveRight
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the moveright key.

outputs.name: PressedForward
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the forward key.

outputs.name: PressedBack
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the backward key.

outputs.name: PressedAttack
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the attack key.

outputs.name: PressedAttack2
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player presses the secondary attack key.

outputs.name: UnpressedMoveLeft
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the moveleft key.

outputs.name: UnpressedMoveRight
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the moveright key.

outputs.name: UnpressedForward
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the forward key.

outputs.name: UnpressedBack
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the backward key.

outputs.name: UnpressedAttack
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the attack key.

outputs.name: UnpressedAttack2
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player releases the secondary attack key.

outputs.name: XAxis
outputs.desc: An output that fires whenever the X axis of the player's input changes. i.e. -1 when the player has moveleft key down, 1 when the player has moveright key down, and 0 if neither.

outputs.name: YAxis
outputs.desc: An output that fires whenever the Y axis of the player's input changes. i.e. -1 when the player has backward key down, 1 when the player has forward key down, and 0 if neither.

outputs.name: AttackAxis
outputs.desc: An output that fires whenever the state of the player's attack key changes. i.e. 1 when the player has the attack key down, 0 otherwise.

outputs.name: Attack2Axis
outputs.desc: An output that fires whenever the state of the player's secondary attack key changes. i.e. 1 when the player has the secondary attack key down, 0 otherwise.

desc: Outputs a few global variables when requested.

inputs.name: GetCurtime
inputs.desc: Gets curtime.

inputs.name: GetFrameCount
inputs.desc: Gets frame count.

inputs.name: GetFrametime
inputs.desc: Gets frame time.

inputs.name: GetTickCount
inputs.desc: Gets tick count.

inputs.name: GetIntervalPerTick
inputs.desc: Gets interval per tick.

outputs.name: OutCurtime
outputs.desc: Outputs curtime.

outputs.name: OutFrameCount
outputs.desc: Outputs frame count.

outputs.name: OutFrametime
outputs.desc: Outputs frame time.

outputs.name: OutTickCount
outputs.desc: Outputs tick count.

outputs.name: OutIntervalPerTick
outputs.desc: Outputs interval per tick.

desc: An entity that displays text on player's screens.

keyvalues.name: Message Text
keyvalues.desc: Message to display onscreen.

keyvalues.name: X Position
keyvalues.desc: Horizontal position on the player's screens to draw the text. The value should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is the far left of the screen and 1 is the far right. -1 centers the text.

keyvalues.name: Y Position
keyvalues.desc: Vertical position on the player's screens to draw the text. The value should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top of the screen and 1 is the bottom. -1 centers the text.

keyvalues.name: Text Color
keyvalues.desc: The main color of the text.

keyvalues.name: Transition Color
keyvalues.desc: Secondary color used when revealing text.

keyvalues.name: Fade in Time/Character Scan Time
keyvalues.desc: The time it should take for the text to fully fade in.

keyvalues.name: Fade Out Time
keyvalues.desc: The time it should take for the text to fade out, after the hold time has expired.

keyvalues.name: Hold Time
keyvalues.desc: The time the text should stay onscreen, after fading in, before it begins to fade out.

keyvalues.name: Scan time (scan effect only)
keyvalues.desc: If the 'Text Effect' is set to Scan Out, this is the time it should take to scan out all the letters in the text.

keyvalues.name: Text Channel
keyvalues.desc: You can have up to six individual game_text messages onscreen at once, stored in channels. Select which channel this text should be placed in, which will overwrite any active message already in that channel.

inputs.name: Display
inputs.desc: Display the message text.

inputs.name: SetText
inputs.desc: Set the text to display.

inputs.name: SetPosX
inputs.desc: Set the X position of the text. (0 - 1.0 = left to right) (-1 centers)

inputs.name: SetPosY
inputs.desc: Set the Y position of the text. (0 - 1.0 = top to bottom) (-1 centers)

inputs.name: SetTextColor
inputs.desc: Set color of the front text.

inputs.name: SetTextColor2
inputs.desc: Set color of the transition text.

desc: An entity to control the number of ragdolls in the world, for performance reasons.

keyvalues.name: Max Ragdoll Count
keyvalues.desc: Sets the max number of ragdolls that can be in the world at a time (if they are flagged to fade). Set to -1 if you want to use the default value (g_ragdoll_maxcount).

keyvalues.name: Save Important Ragdolls
keyvalues.desc: Should the ragdoll manager make sure ally ragdolls aren't deleted?

inputs.name: SetMaxRagdollCount
inputs.desc: Set the Max Ragdoll Count.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Landmark
keyvalues.desc: Entity at which the reference origin is contained.  If empty, the info_lighting_relative's origin will be used.

desc: An entity that can be used to change the lighting origin of a prop_static. Set the prop_static's Lighting Origin to point at this entity to make the prop_static light as if it was at the info_lighting's origin.  Good for prop_static entities that are embedded in world geometry (like rocks/windows/etc).

This entity indicates the position and facing direction at which the player will spawn. Any number of info_player_start entities may be placed in a map for when working in cordoned-off portions of the map. When multiple info_player_start entities are present in a map, set the 'Master' spawnflag on one of them to indicate which one should be used when running the entire map.

An entity that can use point_cameras to render images for materials used by entities. To author the material, use the special identifier _rt_Camera for the $baseTexture (or whatever texture you want, like envmap, etc.) in the .vmt then connect the 'target' field to the entity which uses that material, and the 'PointCamera' field to the point_camera you want to have appear on that entity's material.

keyvalues.name: Camera Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of a point_camera entity in the map that the material should be rendered from.

inputs.name: SetCamera
inputs.desc: Set the camera to use. The parameter should be the name of a point_camera entity in the map.

desc: This creates a scrolling texture at the intersect between two brushes, for things like wave effects at water edges.
An entity that does nothing itself, but can be used to specify the destination for a trigger_teleport entity. An info_target can be used instead.

An entity that projects a decal onto the world (or props). If the decal has no target name, it will immediately apply itself when the level is loaded. If it has a name specified, it won't apply until it receives the 'Activate' input.

keyvalues.name: Texture
keyvalues.desc: The texture used for the decal.

keyvalues.name: Distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance from the origin to project the decal.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Force the decal to apply itself to the world.

desc: An entity that spawns a particle system built using the particle editor.

keyvalues.name: Control Point 1
keyvalues.desc: If set, control point 1 of the effect will be at this entity's location.

keyvalues.name: Control Point 2
keyvalues.desc: If set, control point 2 of the effect will be at this entity's location. If control point 1 is not set, this will be ignored.

keyvalues.desc: If set, control point 3 of the effect will be at this entity's location. If control point 2 is not set, this will be ignored.
