inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to start emitting.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to stop emitting.

inputs.name: StopPlayEndCap
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to stop emitting and play its End Cap Effect.

inputs.name: DestroyImmediately
inputs.desc: Destroy the particle system and remove all particles immediately.

desc: An entity used to attach constraints to a local position on an entity. Usually constraints will attach to the center of mass of an object. Attach the desired constraint to this entity, and then parent this entity to the entity you want the constraint to apply to.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: Amount to scale the mass of this body in the constraint solver.

desc: An entity that's immediately removed on spawning. Useful as a spotlight target.
An entity that overrides the mass center of the target physics object, by moving it to the info_mass_center's location. This kills itself on spawn.

keyvalues.name: Target object
keyvalues.desc: The entity whose mass center will be overridden.

desc: Entity that, when seen, generates a simple game event.

keyvalues.name: Event Name
keyvalues.desc: The event to trigger by name from modevents.res

keyvalues.name: Range
keyvalues.desc: Distance that the player must be before the event is generated.

inputs.name: GenerateGameEvent
inputs.desc: Generate my game event. (This entity is sent as the SUBJECT)

desc: A generic target that gets replicated to the client for hud hint targeting.
Use this entity to mark surfaces that shouldn't receive dynamic shadows. Useful to apply to walls and floors where shadows are drawn improperly, giving away the location of enemies.

An entity that acts as a landmark for transitions to another level. There should be a corresponding info_landmark entity in the next map. Entities will be transitioned to the next level relative to the info_landmark entities.
An entity that does nothing. Very useful as a positioning entity for other entities to refer to (i.e. the endpoint of an env_beam)
An entity that places an overlay on the world.

keyvalues.name: Material
keyvalues.desc: Material to use for the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Brush faces
keyvalues.desc: The brush faces this overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Render Order
keyvalues.desc: Higher values render after lower values. This value can be 0-3.

keyvalues.name: U Start
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the starting X axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: U End
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the ending X axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: V Start
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the starting Y axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: V End
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the ending Y axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis Origin(Read-Only)
keyvalues.desc: Center of the overlay on the surface(s) the overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis U
keyvalues.desc: The direction the X-axis of the material points.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis V
keyvalues.desc: The direction the Y-axis of the material points.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis Normal(Read-Only)
keyvalues.desc: Normal of the surface(s) the overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 1
keyvalues.desc: Corner 1 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 2
keyvalues.desc: Corner 2 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 3
keyvalues.desc: Corner 3 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 4
keyvalues.desc: Corner 4 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the overlay starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist).

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which the overlay is visible (0 = don't fade out).

desc: An entity to handle endpoints for multiple ladders that are too close to each other.

keyvalues.name: Ladder Name
keyvalues.desc: If multiple ladders are near multiple endpoints, use this to stop them from interfering with each other.

desc: Allows manually placing model-based detail props. These are normally generated by VBSP on materials with %detailtype set.

keyvalues.name: World model
keyvalues.desc: The model to use for this prop.

desc: Alternate classname for prop_ragdoll

A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage.
Works exactly like a prop_dynamic, but it can optionally have a custom glow around it.

keyvalues.name: Does the prop glow by default?
Glow Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: The color of the glow (if enabled).

keyvalues.name: Glow Style
keyvalues.desc: What style of glow should be used.

inputs.name: SetGlowEnabled
inputs.desc: Starts the glow.

inputs.name: SetGlowDisabled
inputs.desc: Stops the glow.

inputs.name: SetGlowColor
inputs.desc: Change the glow's color. Format: <Red 0-255> <Green 0-255> <Blue 0-255>

inputs.name: GlowColorRedValue
inputs.desc: Sets the glow red color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: GlowColorGreenValue
inputs.desc: Sets the glow green color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: GlowColorBlueValue
inputs.desc: Sets the glow blue color channel's value (0 - 255).

desc: A prop that physically simulates and can be articulated with internal joints. The joint constraints are part of the physics model.

keyvalues.name: Override Animation
keyvalues.desc: Filled in by the engine via hammer_update_entity, do not edit by hand except to clear.

inputs.name: StartRagdollBoogie
inputs.desc: Begins ragdoll boogie effect. Parameter override = number of seconds to boogie.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Enable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Disable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: FadeAndRemove
inputs.desc: Fade out then remove (kill) self. Parameter override = duration of fade

desc: This class is the same as prop_physics, except the runtime collisions use a more bouncy method that avoids the prediction errors normal physics objects get.
Allows manually placing sprite-based detail props. These are normally generated by VBSP on materials with %detailtype set.

keyvalues.name: Upper-Left Position
keyvalues.desc: Position of the upper-left corner of the sprite in the world.

keyvalues.name: Lower-Right Position
keyvalues.desc: Position of the lower-right corner of the sprite in the world.

keyvalues.name: Upper-Left Sprite Position
keyvalues.desc: Position of the upper-left corner of the sprite in the texture.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Size
keyvalues.desc: Width and height of the sprite in the texture.

keyvalues.name: Spritesheet Size
keyvalues.desc:
The width of the spritesheet texture. 
Valve Bug: the aspect ratio must match the default detail/detailsprites!

desc: A prop that players can't get a good look at, hopefully making them unsure if it's there at all

keyvalues.name: Enabled Chance
keyvalues.desc: Percentage chance the hallucination starts enabled. 0 is always off, 100 is always on

keyvalues.name: Visible Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds the hallucination stays visible from the first frame it can be seen

keyvalues.name: Recharge Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds the hallucination stays invisible before it can be seen again. 0 to disable recharging

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the hallucination algorithm

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the hallucination algorithm

inputs.name: SetVisibleTime
inputs.desc: Set Visible Time

inputs.name: SetRechargeTime
inputs.desc: Set Recharge Time

desc: A prop that physically simulates as a single rigid body. It can be constrained to other physics objects using hinges or other constraints. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_dynamic (i.e. it should not be physically simulated) then it cannot normally be used as a prop_physics. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics_override instead.

inputs.name: Ignite
inputs.desc: Ignite, burst into flames.

inputs.name: IgniteLifetime
inputs.desc: Ignite, with a parameter lifetime.

inputs.name: IgniteNumHitboxFires
inputs.desc: Ignite, with a parameternumber of hitbox fires.

inputs.name: IgniteHitboxFireScale
inputs.desc: Ignite, with a parameter hitbox fire scale.

desc: This class is the same as prop_physics, except it respawns after it breaks

keyvalues.name: Respawn Time
keyvalues.desc: Ammount in seconds this prop will respawn after it breaks.

desc: A prop that doesn't move and doesn't animate.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: Specify the model to place.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.

keyvalues.name: Alpha
keyvalues.desc: Alpha of the fade, where 0 = fully transparent and 255 = fully opaque.

keyvalues.name: Uniform Scale Override
keyvalues.desc: Resize the static prop uniformly.

keyvalues.name: Scale Override
keyvalues.desc: Resize the static prop.

keyvalues.name: Disable Prop Combine
keyvalues.desc: Prevent this static prop from combining with any other static props in vbsp.

keyvalues.name: Disable Vertex lighting
keyvalues.desc: Disable per-vertex lighting on this prop.

keyvalues.name: Disable Self-Shadowing
keyvalues.desc: When vertex lighting is enabled, prevent the geometry from self-shadowing -- casting shadows onto itself.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Surface Normal
keyvalues.desc: When vertex lighting is enabled, ignore the surface normal of faces when calculating the vertex lighting. Useful for thin, translucent objects such as leaves on foliage props.

keyvalues.name: Enable Bounced Lighting
keyvalues.desc: Whether VRAD should create indirect lighting from this prop.

keyvalues.name: Render in Fast Reflections
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, causes this entity/prop to to render in fast water reflections (i.e. when a water material specifies $reflectonlymarkedentities) and in the world impostor pass.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Screen Space Fade
keyvalues.desc: The method by which the fading distance should be determined. If 'No', the fade distances is the distance from the player's view to the object, in units. If 'Yes', the fade distance is the size of the object onscreen, in pixels.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it starts to fade.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the *minimum* number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it fades.

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

desc: A variant of prop_physics which has a perfect sphere shape. It is normally restricted to a radius of 12 units.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: The size of the sphere collision.

desc: A variant of prop_physics which will permit using models that do not have physics data compiled into them, like static or dynamic models. Health and physics data can be overridden on this version, to substitute for the missing info.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking.  0 means don't break.

desc: A way to attach one studio model to another as an ornament. It will render in the way that player/NPC weapons render.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that this ornament should attach to, at startup.

inputs.name: SetAttached
inputs.desc: Attach the ornament to a different entity. Parameter should be the name of entity to attach to.

inputs.name: Detach
inputs.desc: Detach from the Target Entity and become invisible. The ornament can be re-attached with the SetAttached input.

desc: A variant of prop_dynamic that permits the use of any model, including those designed to be used as prop_physics/prop_static.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking.  0 means don't break.

desc: A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it cannot normally  be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_dynamic_override instead.
An entity used to place a door in the world.

keyvalues.name: Slave Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of any doors that should be slaved to this door (i.e. should open when this one opens, and close when this one closes).

keyvalues.name: Ajar Angles (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: If the door 'Spawn Position' is set to Ajar, these are the angles to spawn at, instead of being open or closed.

keyvalues.name: Rotation Distance (deg)
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees, that the door should rotate when opened.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the door moves.

keyvalues.name: Fully Open Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door has finished opening.

keyvalues.name: Fully Closed Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door has finished closing.

keyvalues.name: Moving Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door starts to move.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before close (-1 stay open)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the door has opened before it closes. If the value is set to -1, the door never closes itself.

keyvalues.name: Damage Inflicted When Blocked
keyvalues.desc: Amount of damage done to entities that block the movement of this door, per frame.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the player tries to open the door, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door is unlocked.

keyvalues.name: Force Closed
keyvalues.desc: If set, this door will close no matter what. Useful for doors that have to close even if the player tries to block them with objects.

keyvalues.name: Open Direction
keyvalues.desc: Force the door to open only forwards or only backwards. Both directions is the standard door behavior.

keyvalues.name: Does the prop glow by default?
Glow Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: The color of the glow (if enabled).

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door, if it is not fully open.

inputs.name: OpenAwayFrom
inputs.desc: Open the door away from the specified entity.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door, if it is not fully closed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the door between open and closed.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the door.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the door.

inputs.name: SetRotationDistance
inputs.desc: Set the distance (in degrees) between Open and Closed.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed at which the door rotates. 100 is default.

inputs.name: MoveToRotationDistance
inputs.desc: Sets the open distance (in degrees) and moves there.

inputs.name: SetGlowEnabled
inputs.desc: Starts the glow.

inputs.name: SetGlowDisabled
inputs.desc: Stops the glow.

inputs.name: SetUnbreakable
inputs.desc: The door can't be broken.

inputs.name: SetBreakable
inputs.desc: The door can be broken.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is told to close.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is told to open.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully open position.

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully closed position.

outputs.name: OnBlockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnBlockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnLockedUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player uses the door, but it is locked.

outputs.name: OnRotationDone
outputs.desc: Fired when the door arrives at it's goal angle.

desc: A node entity that marks a point in a rope. Traditionally, one move_rope is used to start the chain and then is followed by one or more keyframe_rope entities. However they are freely interchangeable.
Animation KeyFrame
An entity to control the shadows in the map.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: This is the shadow direction. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, and roll is the rotation around the X axis.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Color
keyvalues.desc: This is the color of the shadows.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the maximum distance the shadow is allowed to cast, in Source units.

keyvalues.name: Enable Local Light Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Enables RTT dynamic shadow angles, which cause shadows to face away from the nearest light source instead of always using this entity's direction. This is a new feature and the original Half-Life 2 had no dynamic shadow angles. Leave this off if they are not desired.

inputs.name: color
inputs.desc: Set the shadow color.

inputs.name: direction
inputs.desc: Set the shadow direction.

inputs.name: SetDistance
inputs.desc: Set the maximum shadow cast distance.

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Set the shadow direction.

inputs.name: SetShadowsDisabled
inputs.desc: Set shadows disabled state.

inputs.name: SetShadowsFromLocalLightsEnabled
inputs.desc: Set local light shadows enabled state.

desc: An entity used for non-NPCs that need to synchronise their animation with an NPC in a scripted_sequence. Usually a piece of furniture or door that an NPC needs to manipulate within a scripted_sequence.

inputs.name: DisablePlayerCollision
inputs.desc: Disable collisions against the player.

inputs.name: EnablePlayerCollision
inputs.desc: Enable collisions against the player.

desc: A Generic NPC entity that hears and reports 'danger' and is not preserved on round restart. Danger sounds consist of gunshots, player sounds, bullet impacts, nearby vehicles and andything else that gives off a danger sound.

outputs.name: OnHearWorld
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears a sound (other than combat or the player).

outputs.name: OnHearPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears the player.

outputs.name: OnHearCombat
outputs.desc: Fired when this NPC hears combat sounds.

desc: Sets the color and angle of the light from the sun and sky.

keyvalues.name: Pitch
keyvalues.desc: The downward pitch of the light from the sun. 0 is horizontal, -90 is straight down.

keyvalues.name: AmbientScaleHDR
keyvalues.desc: Amount to scale the ambient light by when compiling for hdr.

keyvalues.name: SunSpreadAngle
keyvalues.desc: The angular extent of the sun for casting soft shadows. Higher numbers are more diffuse. 5 is a good starting value.

desc: An invisible and directional spotlight.

keyvalues.name: Entity to point at
keyvalues.desc: The name of an entity in the map that the spotlight will point at. This will override the spotlight's angles.

keyvalues.name: Remove After Compile
keyvalues.desc: If set, removes this entity after processing the map with VRAD

desc: A directional light with no falloff. Similar to sunlight in light_environment.

keyvalues.name: Pitch
keyvalues.desc: The downward pitch of the light from the sun. 0 is horizontal, -90 is straight down.

keyvalues.name: SpreadAngle
keyvalues.desc: The angular extent of the light for casting soft shadows. Higher numbers are more diffuse. 5 is a good starting value.

desc: An invisible lightsource that changes in some way over time.

keyvalues.name: Entity to point at
keyvalues.desc: The name of an entity in the map that the dynamic light will point at.

keyvalues.name: Maximum distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance that light is allowed to cast, in units.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight end radius
keyvalues.desc: This is the radius of the light, in units, at the object that it is hitting.

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Set the light's render color (R G B).

inputs.name: brightness
inputs.desc: Set the light brightness.

inputs.name: distance
inputs.desc: Set the maximum light distance.

inputs.name: _inner_cone
inputs.desc: Set the inner (bright) angle.

inputs.name: _cone
inputs.desc: Set the outer (fading) angle.

inputs.name: spotlight_radius
inputs.desc: Set the radius of the spotlight at the end point.

inputs.name: style
inputs.desc: Change the lightstyle (see Appearance field for possible values).

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the light off.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn the light on.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the light on/off.

desc: An invisible omnidirectional light-source.

keyvalues.name: Remove After Compile
keyvalues.desc: If set, removes this entity after processing the map with VRAD

desc: Test entity for Ken!
A debugging tool for testing tracelines. Pretty much useless for other people. This spins wildly, tracing lines to the closest brush.
An entity that controls the postprocess settings in the map.

inputs.name: SetFadeTime
inputs.desc: Set the fade time between post process settings.

inputs.name: SetLocalContrastStrength
inputs.desc: Set the local contrast strength.

inputs.name: SetLocalContrastEdgeStrength
inputs.desc: Set the local contrast strength at the edge of the screen (controlled by vignette).

inputs.name: SetVignetteStart
inputs.desc: Set the vignette start distance (from screen center).

inputs.name: SetVignetteEnd
inputs.desc: Set the vignette end distance.

inputs.name: SetVignetteBlurStrength
inputs.desc: Set the strength of the desaturated blur on the vignette.

inputs.name: SetFadeToBlackStrength
inputs.desc: Set the fadeout strength.

inputs.name: SetDepthBlurFocalDistance
inputs.desc: Set the focal distance of the depth blur effect (in the range [0,1]).

inputs.name: SetDepthBlurStrength
inputs.desc: Set the depth blur effect strength.

inputs.name: SetScreenBlurStrength
inputs.desc: Set the screen blur effect strength.

inputs.name: SetFilmGrainStrength
inputs.desc: Set the film grain effect strength.

desc: An entity to draw a spotlight. Will draw a beam when the player views it side on, and a halo when it's facing towards the player. Unless the 'No Dynamic Light' spawnflag is checked, it will also create a dynamic light wherever the end of the spotlight rests.This spotlight is entirely client side, it is not sync'd across clients.

keyvalues.name: Max Rotation Speed
keyvalues.desc: The maximum rotation speed of the spotlight, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Length
keyvalues.desc: Length of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

inputs.name: LightOn
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight on.

inputs.name: LightOff
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight off

inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Start the rotator rotating.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop the rotator from rotating.

inputs.name: Reverse
inputs.desc: Reverse the direction of rotation of the rotator.

outputs.name: OnLightOn
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns on.

outputs.name: OnLightOff
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns off.

desc: This is the center of the instance for rotation.

Place one copy of this entity inside of an instance.  Sending messages to entities inside the instance from the Proxy's OnProxyRelay output will allow you to trigger these entities from outside the instance by sending messages to the func_instance.  Send the ProxyRelay message from entities inside the instance to the proxy and you will be able to use these events to send messages to other entities outside the instance from the func_instance. NOTE: The instance, the proxy, and all entities involved should be named descriptively.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay
inputs.desc: This message will get relayed and will be available from the instance.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay1
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay2
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay3
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay4
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay5
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

outputs.name: OnProxyRelay
outputs.desc: A message from outside can trigger this to cause something to happen in the instance.

desc: Creates a school of interactive fish that swim near this entity.

keyvalues.name: Fish Count
keyvalues.desc: Number of Fish in this Pool

keyvalues.name: Max Range
keyvalues.desc: How far away a Fish can wander (max 255)

desc:
An entity used to specify the endpoints of a ladder. This entity is functional, but has been replaced by the easier-to-use func_useableladder entity. Left in only for backwards-compatibility!

To be valid, a full sized player hull traced between the start and end points must not be obstructed at level activation time. The angle determines in which direction the player leaves the ladder if the player presses the +jump button.

Note: This entity is non-functional in Counter-Strike: Source. In CS:S, use func_ladder instead.

keyvalues.name: Other
keyvalues.desc: A ladder goes between any two func_ladderendpoints pointing at each other.

desc: An entity for placing an instance of a map file.  You may translate and rotate this entity. You can use the replace keys to do parameter changes on the instance contents in a $ at the beginning of a variable name. Then just use the $variable name inside of the instance contents on any value portion of a key/value pair.

keyvalues.name: Fix Up Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that all entities will be fixed up with based upon the fix up style.

keyvalues.name: VMF Filename
keyvalues.desc: This indicates a map file relative to the map's file name. This is also looked up relative to <your mod>/maps/ or sdk_content/maps/, if one exists in the parent directories.

keyvalues.name: Entity Name Fix Up
keyvalues.desc: Fixup style for instanced entity names.  Uses the 'Fix Up Name' field.

desc:
A Half-Life 2 ladder. Handles player auto mount/unmount, as well as +use to get onto the ladder. 

See also 'info_ladder_dismount', used to specify ladder auto-dismount points.

Note: This entity is non-functional in Counter-Strike: Source. Use func_ladder instead.

keyvalues.name: Start
keyvalues.desc: Ladder end point.

keyvalues.name: End
keyvalues.desc: Ladder end point.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable this ladder.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable this ladder.

outputs.name: OnPlayerGotOnLadder
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a player gets on this ladder.

outputs.name: OnPlayerGotOffLadder
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a player gets off this ladder.

desc: An entity used to build paths for other entities to follow. Each path_track is a node on the path, each holding the name of the next path_track in the path.

keyvalues.name: Next Stop Target
keyvalues.desc: The next path_track in the path.

keyvalues.name: Branch Path
keyvalues.desc: An alternative path_track to be the next node in the path. Useful for making branching paths. Use the ToggleAlternatePath / EnableAlternatePath inputs to make the alternative path active.

keyvalues.name: New Train Speed
keyvalues.desc: When the train reaches this path_track, it will set its speed to this speed. This speed must be a positive value that is less than the train's max speed. A value of 0 will cause no change in the train's speed.

keyvalues.name: Orientation Type
keyvalues.desc: The way that the path follower faces as it moves through this path track.

inputs.name: ToggleAlternatePath
inputs.desc: Cause the track to toggle to/from its alternate path.

inputs.name: EnableAlternatePath
inputs.desc: Enable the alternate path of the track.

inputs.name: DisableAlternatePath
inputs.desc: Disable the alternate path of the track.

inputs.name: TogglePath
inputs.desc: Cause the track to toggle on/off/

inputs.name: EnablePath
inputs.desc: Enable the track.

inputs.name: DisablePath
inputs.desc: Disable the track.

outputs.name: OnPass
outputs.desc: Fired when any entity following this path passes this path_track node.

outputs.name: OnTeleport
outputs.desc: Fired when any entity following this path teleports directly to this path_track node.

desc: Path points for func_train or NPC entities to follow.

inputs.name: SetNextPathCorner
inputs.desc: Sets next pathcorner

outputs.name: OnPass
outputs.desc: Fires when a path follower passes this point

desc: Helicopter Crash Path
An entity to control & draw a sun effect in the sky.

keyvalues.name: Viewer entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of an entity used to determine where the sun is in the skybox. The sun should be lined up on a line from this entity to the env_sun entity.

keyvalues.name: UseAngles
keyvalues.desc: The old way to orient env_sun is to point it at a target. The new way is to specify the angles. If you use the new way, set this property to YES.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: A value of 0 0 0 will act the old way.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Size
keyvalues.desc: A value of -1 means the overlay will act the old way.

keyvalues.name: Material Name
keyvalues.desc: Material of the inner glow.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Material Name
keyvalues.desc: Material of the overlay glow.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Glow Distance Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scales the distance used to test for sun glow occlusion, 0.99 will act the old way.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable sun rendering.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable sun rendering.

inputs.name: SetColor
inputs.desc: Change the sun's color. Format: <Red 0-255> <Green 0-255> <Blue 0-255>

desc: An entity used to create sparks at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Max Delay
keyvalues.desc: The longest delay between sparks (in seconds).

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: The size of the sparks.

inputs.name: StartSpark
inputs.desc: Start the spark effect.

inputs.name: StopSpark
inputs.desc: Stop the spark effect.

inputs.name: ToggleSpark
inputs.desc: Toggle the on/off state of the spark effect.

inputs.name: SparkOnce
inputs.desc: Spark once.

outputs.name: OnSpark
outputs.desc: Fired every time this entity sparks.

desc: An entity to control the color correction in the map.

keyvalues.name: Lookup Falloff Start Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance to the start of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere)

keyvalues.name: Lookup Falloff End Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the distance to the end of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere)

keyvalues.name: Maximum Weight
keyvalues.desc: This is the maximum weight for this lookup

keyvalues.name: Lookup Fade In Duration
keyvalues.desc: Duration of fade in on when enabled.

keyvalues.name: Lookup Fade out Duration
keyvalues.desc: Duration of fade out on when disabled.

inputs.name: SetColor
inputs.desc: Sets the color.

inputs.name: SetFadeInDuration
inputs.desc: Sets the 'fadeInDuration' variable, used to fade cc lookup usage when entity is enabled.

inputs.name: SetFadeOutDuration
inputs.desc: Sets the 'fadeOutDuration' variable, used to fade cc lookup usage when entity is disabled.

desc: An entity that will cause a physics impact on another entity.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: Direction to project the impact.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: Strength of the impact.

keyvalues.name: Distance
keyvalues.desc: How far to project the impact (if 0 uses a default value).

keyvalues.name: Point to Entity
keyvalues.desc: If set, 'Distance' and Angle settings are ignored and the direction and distance to the target entity will be used.

inputs.name: Impact
inputs.desc: Trigger the impact

desc: An entity that controls the depth of field settings for the player. Depth of field simulates camera blur of out-of-focus regions of the scene.

keyvalues.name: Enabled
keyvalues.desc: Whether the effect should be active

keyvalues.name: Near blur depth
keyvalues.desc: Distance that the blurriness is at its peak near the viewpoint.

keyvalues.name: Near focus depth
keyvalues.desc: Distance that the focus is in full effect near the viewpoint.

keyvalues.name: Near blur radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius (in pixels) to blur the surrounding pixels.

keyvalues.name: Far blur depth
keyvalues.desc: Distance where blurriness is at its peak far from the viewpoint.

keyvalues.name: Far focus depth
keyvalues.desc: Distance that the focus is in full effect far from the viewpoint.

keyvalues.name: Far blur radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius (in pixels) to blur the surrounding pixels.

keyvalues.name: Focus target
keyvalues.desc: Entity to use as a focal point.

keyvalues.name: Focus target range
keyvalues.desc: Distance behind the focal plane to remain in focus.

inputs.name: SetNearBlurDepth
inputs.desc: Set the distance in front of the focus region at which the scene will be completely blurred using the near blur radius. Must be smaller than NearFocusDepth.

inputs.name: SetNearFocusDepth
inputs.desc: The area between the near focus and far focus distances is perfectly in focus. Must be smaller than FarFocusDepth.

inputs.name: SetFarFocusDepth
inputs.desc: The area between the near focus and far focus distances is perfectly in focus. Must be smaller than FarBlurDepth.

inputs.name: SetFarBlurDepth
inputs.desc: Set the distance beyond the focus region at which the scene will be completely blurred using the far blur radius. Must be larger than FarFocusDepth.

inputs.name: SetNearBlurRadius
inputs.desc: Set the blur radius (in pixels) to use at the near blur distance. Set to 0 to disable near blur.

inputs.name: SetFarBlurRadius
inputs.desc: Set the blur radius (in pixels) to use at the far blur distance. Set to 0 to disable far blur.

inputs.name: SetFocusTarget
inputs.desc: Set the focal target for the effect.

inputs.name: SetFocusTargetRange
inputs.desc: Set the distance behind the focal point that will remain in focus.

desc: An entity that creates an explosion at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage done by the explosion.

keyvalues.name: Radius Override
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the radius in which the explosion damages entities. If unspecified, the radius will be based on the magnitude.

keyvalues.name: Ignored Entity
keyvalues.desc: Do not harm or affect the named entity.

keyvalues.name: Ignored Class
keyvalues.desc: Do not harm or affect this class.

inputs.name: Explode
inputs.desc: Triggers the explosion.

desc: An entity used to create a jet of steam.

keyvalues.name: Spread Speed
keyvalues.desc: The amount of random spread in the particle's velocity after they spawn.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The default speed at which the particles move after they spawn.

keyvalues.name: Particle start size
keyvalues.desc: The initial size of the particles after they spawn.

keyvalues.name: Particle end size
keyvalues.desc: The size of the particles at the point at which they are removed.

keyvalues.name: Emission rate
keyvalues.desc: The rate of particle emission. i.e. particles per second.

keyvalues.name: Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: The color of the steam. Only has an effect if the Emissive flag is on, but can otherwise be used to set the color shown in Hammer.

keyvalues.name: Length of steam jet
keyvalues.desc: The length of the jet determines the lifetime of each particle.

keyvalues.name: Spin Speed
keyvalues.desc: How fast do the particles spin

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turns the steam jet on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turns the steam jet off.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the steam jet between on and off.

inputs.name: JetLength
inputs.desc: Sets the length of steam jet.

inputs.name: Rate
inputs.desc: Sets the particle emission rate in particles per second.

inputs.name: Speed
inputs.desc: Sets the default speed of the particles in units per second.

inputs.name: SpreadSpeed
inputs.desc: Sets the spread speed in units per second.

desc: An entity to control sound in an area. The active soundscape at any time is the last one that had line-of-sight to the player, and was within the radius.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: If set to -1, then the player can hear the soundscape as long as they can see it (regardless of distance to it).

keyvalues.name: Soundscape
keyvalues.desc: The name of the soundscape to use. Corresponds to an entry in the soundscapes*.txt file in the scripts/ directory.

keyvalues.name: Sound Position 0
keyvalues.desc: A sound position that will be referenced inside the soundscape text file. Usually used to position a set of sounds within the world.

keyvalues.name: Sound Position 6

keyvalues.name: Sound Position 7
keyvalues.desc: A sound position that will be referenced inside the soundscape text file. Usually used to position a set of sounds within the world.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the soundscape.

inputs.name: Disabled

inputs.name: ToggleEnabled

desc: An entity that has special animation events that can be fired by a model with an animation inside its .qc designed for use by this entity.

keyvalues.name: Script Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use for animation sequences.

inputs.name: SetSequence
inputs.desc: Sets the script model's sequence.

desc: The suck-in effect from the HL1 Resonance Cascade sequence.
Continuous rocket flame for HL2 RPG missiles.
Muzzle Flash

keyvalues.name: Parent Attachment
keyvalues.desc: The name of an attachment on the parent to hierarchically attach to.

desc: An entity that acts as a microphone. It works in one of two modes. If it has a 'Speaker' set, it picks up all sounds within the specified sound range, and rebroadcasts them through the Speaker entity. In this Speaker mode, it ignores the Hears X spawnflags and does not fire the SoundLevel output. If it has no Speaker set, it measures the sound level at a point, and outputs the sound level as a value between 0 and 1. In Measuring mode, it only hears sounds that match the Hear X spawnflags.

keyvalues.name: Measure target
keyvalues.desc: If the speaker is in Measuring mode, this is the name of the entity where the sound level is to be measured.

keyvalues.name: Speaker target
keyvalues.desc: The name of an entity through which to play any sounds heard by this microphone. If specified, the microphone will consider itself in Speaker mode.

keyvalues.name: Listen Filter
keyvalues.desc: The name of an filter entity which specifies the only entities the microphone can hear. Sounds emitted by other entities will not be heard.

keyvalues.name: Speaker DSP Preset
keyvalues.desc: Only useful in Speaker mode. If specified, when the microphone is enabled, it'll set the global dsp_speaker preset to this value. Sounds played back through speakers will then be affected by the selected DSP.

keyvalues.name: Sensitivity (0 - 10)
keyvalues.desc: Microphone sensitivity, 0=deaf, 1=default, 10=extremely sensitive). Only applicable in Measuring mode.

keyvalues.name: Smoothing (0 - 1)
keyvalues.desc: Smoothing factor, 0=no smoothing, 1=maximum smoothing). Only applicable in Measuring mode.

keyvalues.name: Maximum hearing range (0=infinite)
keyvalues.desc: Sounds beyond this range won't be heard, irrelevant of attenuation. WARNING: setting this to zero (or a value > 1024) when the microphone is in Speaker mode can be very bad for performance!!

inputs.name: SetSpeakerName
inputs.desc: Set the microphone to output through a different speaker entity.

outputs.name: SoundLevel
outputs.desc: Fired in Measuring mode whenever the sound level changes.

outputs.name: OnRoutedSound
outputs.desc: Fired whenever a sound is routed out through the specified speaker (if any).

outputs.name: OnHeardSound
outputs.desc: Fired whenever this microphone hears any sound it cares about.

desc: An entity that can display and control a set of screen overlays, to be displayed over the player's view. Useful for view effects like drunkenness, or teleporter afterimages, etc.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 1
keyvalues.desc: Name of the first overlay material to display.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 1
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the first overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the second overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 2
keyvalues.desc: Name of the second overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 2
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the second overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the third overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 3
keyvalues.desc: Name of the third overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 3
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the third overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the fourth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 4
keyvalues.desc: Name of the fourth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 4
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the fourth overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the fifth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 5
keyvalues.desc: Name of the fifth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 5
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the fifth overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the sixth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 6
keyvalues.desc: Name of the sixth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 6
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the sixth overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the seventh overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 7
keyvalues.desc: Name of the seventh overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 7
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the seventh overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the eighth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 8
keyvalues.desc: Name of the eighth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 8
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the eighth overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the ninth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 9
keyvalues.desc: Name of the ninth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 9
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the ninth overlay should be displayed for, after which it will begin showing the tenth overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Name 10
keyvalues.desc: Name of the tenth overlay material to display. If left blank, overlay displaying will finish, and this entity will consider itself done.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Duration 10
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time that the tenth overlay should be displayed for, after which this entity will stop displaying overlays.

inputs.name: StartOverlays
inputs.desc: Start displaying the first overlay.

inputs.name: StopOverlays
inputs.desc: Stop displaying any overlays.

inputs.name: SwitchOverlay
inputs.desc: Switch to displaying a specific overlay. Pass in the desired overlay number in the parameter.

desc: An entity to control wind in the map. Partially functional.

keyvalues.name: Min normal speed

keyvalues.name: Max normal speed
keyvalues.desc: Maximum speed of the wind while idling.

keyvalues.name: Min gust speed
keyvalues.desc: Minimum speed of wind gusts.

keyvalues.name: Max gust speed
keyvalues.desc: Maximum speed of wind gusts.

keyvalues.name: Min gust delay
keyvalues.desc: Minimum time delay between random gusts.

keyvalues.name: Max gust delay
keyvalues.desc: Maximum time delay between random gusts.

keyvalues.name: Gust Duration
keyvalues.desc: How long will the wind gust for.

keyvalues.name: Max gust dir change (degrees)
keyvalues.desc: Maximum amount that the wind's direction changes due to a gust.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables the wind.

inputs.name: Disable

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the wind.

outputs.name: OnGustStart
outputs.desc: Fired when a wind gust begins.

outputs.name: OnGustEnd
outputs.desc: Fired when a wind gust ends.

desc: An entity that creates an explosion at its origin. If the no-damage spawnflag is set, the explosion won't be visible, but will apply force to any physics objects within its radius.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: Amount of physics force applied by the explosion. A negative value can be used to suck entities inward.

keyvalues.name: Clamp Radius (0 = auto)
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the radius in which the explosion damages entities. If unspecified, the radius will be based on the magnitude.

keyvalues.name: Limit to Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the explosion will only affect the matching entity.

keyvalues.name: Inner radius
keyvalues.desc: If not zero, the LOS is calculated from a point intersecting this sphere.

inputs.name: Explode
inputs.desc: Trigger the explosion.

inputs.name: ExplodeAndRemove
inputs.desc: Triggers the explosion and then removes the entity.

outputs.name: OnPushedPlayer
outputs.desc: Fires when the player is pushed by the explosion.

desc: Announcement Speaker

keyvalues.name: Context rule script
keyvalues.desc: Script file containing rules for playing appropriate sounds.

keyvalues.name: Concept name
keyvalues.desc: High level concept name used as primary search key.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn on the random announcements.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn off the random announcements.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the random announcements off and on.

desc: An entity that monitors the material of the surface the player is standing on, and fires outputs whenever it changes to/from a specific material.

keyvalues.desc: The material to watch. When the player stands on/off this material, this entity's outputs will be fired.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start watching the player's surface.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop watching the player's surface.

outputs.name: OnSurfaceChangedToTarget
outputs.desc: Fired when the player moves onto the specified game material.

outputs.name: OnSurfaceChangedFromTarget
outputs.desc: Fired when the player moves off the specified game material.

desc: Obsolete older name for env_sprite.

outputs.name: OnShowMessage

desc: An entity that shoots models, or sprites, out of its origin.

keyvalues.desc: ONLY WORKS FOR POINT GIBS. This field allows you to scale gravity so that gibs fall faster, slower, or not at all.

keyvalues.name: Mass override
keyvalues.desc: EPISODIC ONLY. Specify an arbitrary mass for the gibs emitted by me.

keyvalues.name: Lifetime in seconds

inputs.name: Ignite

inputs.name: Enable

inputs.name: Disable

desc: An entity to control the display of HUD hints. HUD hints are used to show the player what key is bound to a particular command.

inputs.name: ShowHudHint

inputs.name: HideHudHint
inputs.desc: Hides the hint message.

desc: Spawns the specified entity template at its origin. If set to auto-spawn, it will spawn the template whenever there's room and the player is looking elsewhere.

keyvalues.name: Point_template To Spawn
keyvalues.desc: Name of the point_template to spawn here.

keyvalues.name: PostSpawn Movement Speed
keyvalues.desc: If specified, all the entities created in the template will move this fast in the specified PostSpawn Movement Direction.

keyvalues.name: PostSpawn Movement Direction
keyvalues.desc: If a PostSpawn Movement Speed is specified, all the entities created in the template will move in this direction.

keyvalues.name: PostSpawn Direction Variance
keyvalues.desc: This variance is applied to the PostSpawn Movement Direction for each spawned entity in the template. Use it to apply some randomness to the directions.

keyvalues.name: PostSpawn Inherit Angles
keyvalues.desc: If in hierarchy, is spawn direction in world space, or object local space of parent.

inputs.name: ForceSpawn
inputs.desc: Spawn an instance of the template at this origin and angle.

inputs.name: ForceSpawnAtEntityOrigin
inputs.desc: Spawns an instance of the template that has the same origin and angles as the specified entity.

outputs.name: OnEntitySpawned
outputs.desc: Fired when an instance of the entity template has been spawned.

outputs.name: OnEntityFailedSpawn
outputs.desc: Fired when a ForceSpawn input failed to spawn the template, either due to lack of space or being in player's view, depending on the spawnflags.

desc: An entity that allows you to script special visual effects via a script file.

desc: The entity that controls the rolling credits, loaded from 'scripts/credits.txt'.

inputs.desc: Start the outro credits rolling.

inputs.name: ShowLogo
inputs.desc: Show the HL2 logo.

outputs.name: OnCreditsDone
outputs.desc: Fired when the credits having finished rolling.

desc: An entity that allows you to change the textures on other brush-built entities, or on overlays.

inputs.desc: Increments target brush's current texture frame by one.

inputs.name: SetTextureIndex
inputs.desc: Sets target brush's texture frame to the specified index.

desc: Dissolves the target entity when triggered. Only works on model entities. In Portal 2, this uses the Fizzler effects.

keyvalues.name: Target to Dissolve
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity you want to dissolve.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: How strongly to push away from the center.

inputs.name: Dissolve
inputs.desc: Dissolve target, if no target is passed it'll use the target specified in the target field.

desc: An entity to control the sunlight that casts cascaded shadows in the map.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: This is the shadow casting direction. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, and roll is the rotation around the X axis. (Note that pitch is negated vs. light_environment's pitch.)

keyvalues.name: Light Color
keyvalues.desc: This is the color of the sunlight.

keyvalues.name: Max Shadow Distance
keyvalues.desc: Maximum dynamic shadow distance. Higher values are slower, default on PC is 400 units.

keyvalues.name: Use light_environment's angles
keyvalues.desc: If true, the CSM shadow angles are automatically harvested from the light_environment's angles. If false, this entity's angles are used.

inputs.name: LightColor
inputs.desc: Set the light color.

inputs.name: LightColorScale
inputs.desc: Set the light color scale

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Set the sun direction.

desc: An entity that allows for creation and control of instructor lessons by map logic.

keyvalues.name: Replace Key
keyvalues.desc: Unique name so that messages with the same key will replace each other.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity to show this hint on top of. The entity used must exist on the client, info_target_instructor_hint can be parented to server only entities for this purpose.

keyvalues.name: Positioning
keyvalues.desc: Either show at the position of the Target Entity. Or show the hint directly on the hud at a fixed position.

keyvalues.name: Allow invisible target
keyvalues.desc: Do we allow the hint to follow entities with nodraw set?

keyvalues.name: Caption
keyvalues.desc: The text of your hint.

keyvalues.name: Activator Caption
keyvalues.desc: The text of your hint shown to only the activating player.

keyvalues.name: Caption Color
keyvalues.desc: The color of the caption text

keyvalues.name: Show through walls
keyvalues.desc: Do we show the caption text even if the hint is occluded by a wall?

keyvalues.name: Onscreen Icon
keyvalues.desc: The icon to use when the hint is within the player's view.

keyvalues.name: Offscreen Icon
keyvalues.desc: The icon to use when the hint is outside the player's view.

keyvalues.name: Show offscreen
keyvalues.desc: When the hint is offscreen, do we show an icon and arrow?

keyvalues.name: Bound Command
keyvalues.desc: If using 'show key bindings' for the onscreen icon, this field should be the command we want to show bindings for.

keyvalues.name: Icon Height Offset
keyvalues.desc: A height offset from the target entity's origin to display the hint

keyvalues.name: Size Pulsing
keyvalues.desc: The icon size can pulsate

keyvalues.name: Alpha Pulsing
keyvalues.desc: The icon alpha can pulsate

keyvalues.name: Shaking
keyvalues.desc: The icon can shake

keyvalues.name: Timeout
keyvalues.desc: The automatic timeout for the hint. 0 will persist until stopped with EndHint.

keyvalues.name: Display Range
keyvalues.desc: The visible range of the hint.

keyvalues.name: Gamepad Bound Command
keyvalues.desc: If using 'show key bindings' for the onscreen icon, this field should be the command we want to show bindings for when gamepad is enabled

inputs.name: ShowHint
inputs.desc: Start showing the hint. If an entity name is passed as a parameter, the hint is shown only to that entity.

inputs.name: EndHint
inputs.desc: Stop showing the hint if it hasn't already timed out.

desc: A env_sprite that allows orientation.
An entity that can be used to light the smoke particles emitted by env_smokestack entities. Does not light any other particle types.

keyvalues.name: Color
keyvalues.desc: Color emitted by this light.

keyvalues.name: Directional
keyvalues.desc: If this is specified, then this light will use the bump map on the particles. Each particle system can have one ambient and one directional light.

keyvalues.name: Particle System Entity
keyvalues.desc: Set this to the name of the env_smokestack that you want this light to affect.

desc: Bugbait Spore Effect

keyvalues.name: Spawn Rate (as percentage)

desc: An entity that controls the drawing of a sprite in the world.

keyvalues.name: Framerate
keyvalues.desc: Rate at which the sprite should animate, if at all.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Name
keyvalues.desc: Material of the sprite to be drawn.

keyvalues.name: Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale multiplier of the sprite.

keyvalues.name: Render Mode
keyvalues.desc: Specify the sprite rendering behaviour.

keyvalues.name: Size of Glow Proxy Geometry.
keyvalues.desc: Size of the glow to be rendered for visibility testing. Must be larger than the distance from the sprite center to empty space. So if this glow is inside geometry (like a light bulb), set this value to be bigger than the bulb's radius. Any time a sphere of this radius would be visible (poking through any nearby geometry), the glow will be rendered.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

inputs.name: ColorRedValue
inputs.desc: Sets the red color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorGreenValue
inputs.desc: Sets the green color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorBlueValue
inputs.desc: Sets the blue color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: SetScale
inputs.desc: Set the sprite's scale (0 - 8.0).

inputs.name: HideSprite
inputs.desc: Hide the sprite. Won't be drawn until the 'ShowSprite' input is received.

inputs.name: ShowSprite
inputs.desc: Show the sprite.

inputs.name: ToggleSprite
inputs.desc: Toggle the sprite between hidden and shown.

desc: Gunfire Effect

keyvalues.name: Target
keyvalues.desc: Shoot at this target. REMEMBER - this is an effect only! It does not do damage!

keyvalues.name: Min Burst Size
keyvalues.desc: Minimum number of rounds in a burst.

keyvalues.name: Max Burst Size
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of rounds in a burst.

keyvalues.name: Min Delay Between Bursts
keyvalues.desc: Minimum delay between bursts. (seconds)

keyvalues.name: Max Delay Between Bursts
keyvalues.desc: Maximum delay between bursts. (seconds)

keyvalues.name: Rate of fire
keyvalues.desc: Expressed as rounds per second

keyvalues.name: Bullet spread
keyvalues.desc: The 'cone of inaccuracy' of the shots fired by this entity.

keyvalues.name: Bullet distribution should be...
keyvalues.desc: How to distribute bullets within the spread. Even distribution is a true scatter throughout the spread. Biased towards the outside makes the shots 'miss' the target by tending towards the outside of the spread.

keyvalues.name: Collision detection
keyvalues.desc: Whether/how to handle bullet collision detection. NOTE: If you select NONE, this entity will be very cheap to use, but all bullets will stop short at their target's position in space and there will be no impact effects. Normal collision detection does the same things NPCs do when they fire their guns (except harm anything).

keyvalues.name: Shoot Sound
keyvalues.desc: Gunfire sound to make

keyvalues.name: Tracer
keyvalues.desc: Type of tracer to display

desc: An entity that creates gibs when it's within the influence of a helicopter's rotor wash.

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: Thing to shoot out.  Can be a .mdl or a .vmt.

keyvalues.name: Gib Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin on all gibs produced by this shooter.

keyvalues.name: Time Under Rotor
keyvalues.desc: The average time it has to be under the rotor before it shoots a gib.

keyvalues.name: Time variance
keyvalues.desc: The random amount to vary the time it has to be under the rotor before it shoots a gib.

desc: An entity that creates a visible beam between two points. The points can be attached to entities to make the beam move around.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: If the 'Random Strike' spawnflag is set, this radius determines the area within which the endpoints will randomly strike.

keyvalues.name: Life (seconds 0 = infinite)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time before the beam dies. Setting to zero will make the beam stay forever.

keyvalues.name: Width of beam
keyvalues.desc: Pixel width of the beam.

keyvalues.name: Strike again time (secs)
keyvalues.desc: Refire time between random strikes of the beam. Only used if the 'Random Strike' spawnflag is set.

keyvalues.name: Start Entity
keyvalues.desc: Entity that the beam starts at.

keyvalues.name: Ending Entity
keyvalues.desc: Entity that the beam ends at. If not set, the Ending Location will be used instead.

keyvalues.name: Decal Name
keyvalues.desc: Decal to be applied at the end of the beam

keyvalues.name: Touch Type (tripwire)
keyvalues.desc: If you want the beam to fire an output when touched by entities, choose the entity type here.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to determine what triggers the output.

keyvalues.name: Ending Location
keyvalues.desc: If an Ending Entity is not specified, use this point as the destination instead.It is relative to the beam origin.

keyvalues.name: Beam clipping
keyvalues.desc: Select whether you want the beam to clip against geometry or characters, making it stop prematurely.

inputs.name: StrikeOnce
inputs.desc: Causes the beam to strike once. It will stay on for its set Life and then turn off (it will never turn off if Life is set to zero).

inputs.name: Amplitude
inputs.desc: Set the amplitude of beam noise (0 - 255).

outputs.name: OnTouchedByEntity
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity touches the beam. Only fired if the entity passes the 'Touch Type' choice.

desc: An entity that can emit dust puffs.

keyvalues.name: Speed

inputs.name: SpawnDust

desc: An entity for turning on and off measuring and display of particle throughput.

inputs.name: TurnOnDisplay

inputs.name: TurnOffDisplay
inputs.desc: Turn off display of particle simulation benchmark

inputs.name: StartMeasuring
inputs.desc: Start measuring particle simulation speed

inputs.name: StopMeasuring
inputs.desc: Stop measuring particle simulation speed

desc: An entity that creates a sample point for the Cubic Environment Map.

keyvalues.name: Brush faces
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) Brushes faces to directly attach to the env_cubemap. Press Pick then click on faces in the 3D View to select them. Use CTRL while clicking to add or remove from the selection.

keyvalues.desc: Optionally assigns this cubemap a bounding box for parallax correction (brush entity tied to parallax_obb). This means the cubemap reflection will move as the camera moves, similar to func_reflective_glass.

desc: An entity to control a game-specific global states.

keyvalues.name: Counter
keyvalues.desc: An integer counter value associated with this global.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Set state of global to ON.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Set state of global to OFF.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles state of global between ON and OFF.

inputs.name: Remove
inputs.desc: Set state of global to DEAD.

inputs.name: SetCounter
inputs.desc: Sets the counter value of this global.

inputs.name: AddToCounter
inputs.desc: Adds to the counter value of this global. Negative numbers subtract.

inputs.name: GetCounter
inputs.desc: Causes the Counter output to be fired, passing the current counter value for this global. This doesn't work properly.

outputs.name: Counter
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetCounter input, passing the current value of the counter.

desc: An entity that can be used to control the player's FOV. Useful for scenes where the player's view is being controlled, or player-usable binoculars/telescopes, etc.

desc: Projected texture entity.

keyvalues.name: target
keyvalues.desc: target

keyvalues.name: FOV
keyvalues.desc: FOV

keyvalues.name: NearZ
keyvalues.desc: Near Z for projected texture

keyvalues.name: FarZ
keyvalues.desc: Far Z for projected texture

keyvalues.name: Enable Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Enables/disables shadows from this projected texture.

keyvalues.desc: Quality of shadows.

keyvalues.name: Light World
keyvalues.desc: Control whether flashlight effects static world geometry.

keyvalues.desc: Indicates if this is a simple, non-light casting texture projection

keyvalues.desc: Amount of time it takes for a color change to occur.

keyvalues.desc: VTF Texture to 'project' onto the enviroment. Please note that env_projectedtexture uses .vtf files directly and does not use .vmt files. The material browser is only available here to assist with finding textures since materials typically have the same name as their textures.

keyvalues.desc: .webm file used in place of the texture.

keyvalues.name: Texture Frame
keyvalues.desc: If the VTF is multi-frame, specify the frame to use.

keyvalues.name: Enable Volumetrics
keyvalues.desc: Enables/disables volumetrics from this projected texture.

keyvalues.name: Volumetric Intensity
keyvalues.desc: Sets the intensity of the volumetric lighting.

keyvalues.name: Custom Appearance
keyvalues.desc: Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn on the texture

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn off the texture

inputs.name: FOV
inputs.desc: Set FOV of projection.

inputs.name: Target
inputs.desc: Set a new target entity to point at.

inputs.name: CameraSpace
inputs.desc: Set Camera Space.

inputs.name: AlwaysUpdateOn
inputs.desc: Turn on per frame updating (for moving lights)

inputs.name: AlwaysUpdateOff
inputs.desc: Turn off per frame updating (for moving lights)

inputs.name: SpotlightTexture
inputs.desc: Set the spotlight texture

inputs.name: SetSpotlightTextureFrame
inputs.desc: Sets the spotlight texture frame

inputs.name: EnableShadows
inputs.desc: Set if the shadows are enabled.

inputs.name: LightColor
inputs.desc: Change the light color/brightness

inputs.name: SetLightStyle
inputs.desc: Change the lightstyle (see Appearance field for possible values).

inputs.name: SetPattern
inputs.desc: Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. The Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

inputs.name: SetNearZ
inputs.desc: Sets the near Z distance.

inputs.name: SetFarZ
inputs.desc: Sets the far Z distance.

inputs.name: LightOnlyTarget
inputs.desc: Set if the projected texture lights the target only.

inputs.name: LightWorld
inputs.desc: Set if the projected texture lights the world and static geometry.

inputs.name: EnableVolumetrics
inputs.desc: Set if the volumetrics are enabled.

inputs.name: SetVolumetricIntensity
inputs.desc: Sets the volumetric lighting's intensity.

inputs.name: SetBrightnessScale
inputs.desc: Sets the brightness.

desc: Allows screenspace effects to be played on the player's view.

keyvalues.name: Effect Type
keyvalues.desc: Which effect to use.

inputs.name: StartEffect
inputs.desc: Start the effect with the duration in seconds as the passed parameter.

inputs.name: StopEffect
inputs.desc: Stop the effect.

desc: An entity that detects changes in heat nearby.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: The radius around this entity in which to detect heat changes.

keyvalues.name: Heat level
keyvalues.desc: The target heat level to check for. Outputs are fired when the heat moves over this target level (increasing or decreasing).

keyvalues.name: Time at level
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time the heat level must spend over the target level before the 'OnHeatLevelStart' output is fired.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable fire sensor.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable fire sensor.

outputs.name: OnHeatLevelStart
outputs.desc: Fires when the heat level has been sustained for the specified length of time.

outputs.name: OnHeatLevelEnd
outputs.desc: Fires when the heat level drops below the target level.

desc: An entity that controls screen fades.

keyvalues.name: Duration (seconds)
keyvalues.desc: The time that it will take to fade the screen in or out.

keyvalues.name: Hold Fade (seconds)
keyvalues.desc: The time to hold the faded in/out state.

keyvalues.name: Fade Alpha
keyvalues.desc: Alpha of the fade, where 0 = fully transparent and 255 = fully opaque.

keyvalues.name: Reverse Fade Duration (seconds)
keyvalues.desc: The duration of the reverse fade.

inputs.name: Fade
inputs.desc: Start the screen fade.

inputs.name: FadeReverse
inputs.desc: Begin doing the reverse of the current fade.

outputs.name: OnBeginFade
outputs.desc: Fired when the fade has begun.

desc: An entity to control screen shake on players.

keyvalues.name: Amplitude (0-16)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of noise in the screen shake. Should be a range between 0 and 16.

keyvalues.name: Effect Radius
keyvalues.desc: The radius around this entity in which to affect players.

keyvalues.name: Duration (seconds)
keyvalues.desc: The length of time in which to shake the player's screens.

keyvalues.name: Frequency
keyvalues.desc: The frequency used to apply the screen shake. Should be a value between 0 and 255, where 0.1 = jerk, and 255.0 = rumble.

inputs.name: Amplitude
inputs.desc: Set the amplitude (0-16)

inputs.name: Frequency
inputs.desc: Set the frequence. Should be a value between 0 and 255, where 0.1 = jerk, and 255.0 = rumble.

inputs.name: StartShake
inputs.desc: Start the shake.

inputs.name: StopShake
inputs.desc: Stop the shake.

desc: An entity that spits out a constant stream of smoke. See particlezoo.vmf for sample usage. You can place up to two env_particlelight entities near the smoke stack to add ambient light to its particles.

keyvalues.name: Spread at the base
keyvalues.desc: Amount of random spread in the origins of the smoke particles when they're spawned.

keyvalues.name: Spread Speed
keyvalues.desc: Amount of random spread in the velocity of the smoke particles after they're spawned.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the smoke particles move after they're spawned.

keyvalues.name: Particle start size
keyvalues.desc: Size of the smoke particles when they're first emitted.

keyvalues.name: Particle end size
keyvalues.desc: Size of the smoke particles at the point they fade out completely.

keyvalues.name: Emission rate
keyvalues.desc: Rate at which to emit smoke particles (i.e. particles to emit per second).

keyvalues.name: Length of smoke trail
keyvalues.desc: Length of the smokestack. Lifetime of the smoke particles is derived from this & particle speed.

keyvalues.name: Wind X/Y Angle
keyvalues.desc: This specifies the wind direction. It is an angle in the XY plane. WindSpeed specifies the strength of the wind.

keyvalues.name: Wind Speed
keyvalues.desc: The strength of the wind.

keyvalues.name: Particle material
keyvalues.desc: Material of the smoke particles emitted by this stack.

keyvalues.name: Twist
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees per second, that the smoke particles twist around the origin.

keyvalues.name: Roll Speed
keyvalues.desc: Amount of roll in degrees per second.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn on the smokestack.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn off the smokestack.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the smokestack between on and off state.

inputs.name: JetLength
inputs.desc: Set the length of the smoke trail.

inputs.name: Rate
inputs.desc: Set the rate at which to emit smoke particles (particles per second).

inputs.name: Speed
inputs.desc: Set the speed at which the smoke particles move after they're spawned.

inputs.name: SpreadSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the amount of random spread in the velocity of the smoke particles after they're spawned.

desc: An entity that creates a smoke trail.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Opacity
keyvalues.desc: Opacity of the sprites (range from 0 - 1).

keyvalues.name: Spawn Rate
keyvalues.desc: Number of particles to emit each second.

keyvalues.name: Particle Life Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds until each particle dies.

keyvalues.name: Start Color
keyvalues.desc: Starting color of the emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: End Color
keyvalues.desc: Ending color of the emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: Emitter Life Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds until the env_smoketrail stops emitting particles. 0 means never stop emitting particles.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Random Speed
keyvalues.desc: Minimum randomly-directed speed to use for emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Random Speed
keyvalues.desc: Maximum randomly-directed speed to use for emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Directed Speed
keyvalues.desc: Minimum speed along the env_smoketrail's forward direction (x axis) to use for emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Directed Speed
keyvalues.desc: Maximum speed along the env_smoketrail's forward direction (x axis) to use for emitted particles.

keyvalues.name: Starting particle size
keyvalues.desc: Starting particle size.

keyvalues.name: Ending particle size
keyvalues.desc: Ending particle size.

keyvalues.name: Spawn radius
keyvalues.desc: Distance from env_smoketrail at which particles are emitted.

desc: An entity used to spawn blood effects.

keyvalues.name: Spray Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The general direction that the blood should spray and the direction to trace to apply the decal.

inputs.name: EmitBlood
inputs.desc: Triggers the blood effect.

desc: An entity that creates a laser beam between itself and a given target.

keyvalues.name: Target of Laser
keyvalues.desc: Name of entity, or entities, to strike at. The target is randomly chosen if there are multiple entities matching the given name.

keyvalues.name: Width of Beam
keyvalues.desc: The width of the laser beam, in pixels.

keyvalues.name: End Sprite
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this sprite will be drawn at the end of the laser beam.

desc: An entity that controls the HDR tonemapping for the player. Think of it as a method of controlling the exposure of the player's eyes.

inputs.name: SetTonemapScale
inputs.desc: Set the player's tonemap scale. It should be a value between 0 and 2, where 0 is the eyes fully closed, 1 is use the unchanged autoexposure (default), and 2 is the eye fully wide open.

inputs.name: BlendTonemapScale
inputs.desc: Blend from the player's current tonemap scale to a new one. The parameter syntax is as follows: <target tonemap scale> <blend duration>. For example: '0.5 10' would blend from the current tonemap scale to 0.5 over a period of 10 seconds. Tonemap scale is a value between 0 and 2, where 0 is the eyes fully closed, 1 is use the unchanged autoexposure (default), and 2 is the eye fully wide open.

inputs.name: UseDefaultAutoExposure
inputs.desc: Revert to using the default tonemap auto exposure.

inputs.name: SetAutoExposureMin
inputs.desc: Set a custom tonemap auto exposure minimum.

inputs.name: SetAutoExposureMax
inputs.desc: Set a custom tonemap auto exposure maximum.

inputs.name: SetBloomScale
inputs.desc: Set a custom bloom scale.

inputs.name: UseDefaultBloomScale
inputs.desc: Revert to using the default bloom scale.

inputs.name: SetBloomScaleRange
inputs.desc: Specify a base and minimum bloom scale. Format is <max bloom> <min bloom>.

inputs.name: SetTonemapRate
inputs.desc: Set the rate for autoexposure adjustment.

inputs.name: SetBloomExponent
inputs.desc: Set a custom bloom exponent.

inputs.name: SetBloomSaturation
inputs.desc: Set a custom bloom saturation.

inputs.name: SetTonemapPercentBrightPixels
inputs.desc: Set a target for percentage of pixels above a certain brightness. (default: 2)

inputs.name: SetTonemapPercentTarget
inputs.desc: Set a custom brightness target for SetTonemapPercentBrightPixels. (default: 60)

inputs.name: SetTonemapMinAvgLum
inputs.desc: Sets custom tonemapping param (ask Alex for details; default: 3).

desc: An entity that puts an additive glow in the world, mostly used over light sources.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance at which this effect will be fully translucent.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance at which this effect will be at full intensity.

keyvalues.name: Outer Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: If larger than the maximum distance, this is the length at which the glow will fade completely out, between the span of the maximum distance and this length.

keyvalues.name: Glow Proxy Geometry Size
keyvalues.desc: Size of the glow to be rendered for visibility testing. Must be larger than the distance from the sprite center to empty space. So if this glow is inside geometry (like a light bulb), set this value to be bigger than the bulb's radius. Any time a sphere of this radius would be visible (poking through any nearby geometry), the glow will be rendered.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Change the render color of the glow. Format: <Red 0-255> <Green 0-255> <Blue 0-255>

desc: An entity that controls the drawing of a sprite in the world, created clientside so cannot be parented to moving things and will use up no network bandwidth or CPU.
An entity that controls the fog and view distance in the map.

keyvalues.name: Fog Enable
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not the fog should start enabled.

keyvalues.name: Fog Blend
keyvalues.desc: Enables color blending between the primary color and the secondary color. When looking at the Primary Fog Direction, the primary fog color will appear. When looking away, the secondary color will. Looking between directly at the direction and directly away will cause color blending.

keyvalues.name: Primary Fog Color
keyvalues.desc: The color of the fog. If fog blend is enabled, this color blends with the secondary color when not looking at the primary fog direction.

keyvalues.name: Secondary Fog Color
keyvalues.desc: The secondary fog color. If fog blend is disabled, this color will never appear.

keyvalues.name: Primary Fog Direction
keyvalues.desc: If fog blend is enabled, this is the direction that shows only the primary color. Directly away is the secondary color and in-between the colors are blended.

keyvalues.name: Fog Start
keyvalues.desc: The distance from the player the fog starts.

keyvalues.name: Fog End
keyvalues.desc: The distance from the player the fog reaches the Fog Max Density keyvalue.

keyvalues.name: Fog Max Density [0..1]
keyvalues.desc: The max density the fog can get to, 0-1.

keyvalues.name: Interpolate time
keyvalues.desc: The fade time for the StartFogTransition input.

keyvalues.name: Far Z Clip Plane
keyvalues.desc: The distance at which the world will not be rendered.

keyvalues.name: HDR Color Scale
keyvalues.desc: Float value to multiply fog color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Zoom Fog Scale
keyvalues.desc: How much the fog min/max values will scale the default value by when players are zoomed in (scoped).

inputs.name: SetStartDist
inputs.desc: Set the fog start distance.

inputs.name: SetEndDist
inputs.desc: Set the fog end distance.

inputs.name: SetMaxDensity
inputs.desc: Set the max density, 0 to 1

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the fog on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn the fog off.

inputs.name: SetColor
inputs.desc: Set the primary fog color.

inputs.name: SetColorSecondary
inputs.desc: Set the secondary fog color.

inputs.name: SetFarZ
inputs.desc: Set the far clip plane distance.

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Set the angles to use for the secondary fog direction.

inputs.name: SetColorLerpTo
inputs.desc: Set the primary fog color.

inputs.name: SetColorSecondaryLerpTo
inputs.desc: Set the secondary fog color.

inputs.name: SetStartDistLerpTo
inputs.desc: Set the fog start distance.

inputs.name: SetEndDistLerpTo
inputs.desc: Set the fog end distance.

inputs.name: StartFogTransition
inputs.desc: Start fog transition.
